title: Fashion Dropshipping - Meta Ads Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
Pay: $3-5 USD/hour (based on experience and speed)

What We're Looking For

We need an experienced Meta Ads specialist who has worked on fashion dropshipping stores for at least 3+ months.

Requirements:



Proven experience creating Meta ads for fashion dropshipping stores (minimum 3 months)

Portfolio required: Share your previous work through Meta Ads Library or store examples (even inactive ads are acceptable)

Must be comfortable working independently on batch tasks

Fast turnaround time on ad creation



Important: Applications without experience or portfolio will not be considered.

The Role

Current Situation:



We have 1 active store running now

Planning to launch new stores end of February

Looking for a reliable person to join us before the expansion



Your Tasks:



Create batches of ads (typically 20+ image ads per batch)

Use Canva for design work

Source and edit images from online resources

Generate content using AI image and video tools

Work on-demand: We assign tasks, you complete them independently



Work Style:

This is a task-based, part-time position. You'll receive assignments like "create 20 image ads" and execute them on your own schedule.

Growth Opportunity

If your ads perform well, we offer:



More work volume

Higher hourly rate



How to Apply

Please include:



Brief description of your Meta ads experience with fashion dropshipping

Links to your work (Meta Ads Library URLs or store examples)

Your turnaround time for creating 20 image ads



We're looking for someone experienced and reliable to grow with us!

title: Direct Response Creative Strategist (DTC E-Commerce)
description:
We’re growing fast and need a Creative Strategist who is an expert at coming up with winning ideas for video ads. You don't just "write scripts"—you use your brain and AI tools to figure out exactly what will make people buy.



This job starts part-time, but it can quickly become a full-time job for someone who knows how to make ads scale!



What you’ll do

Write Winning Scripts: Create scripts and shot lists for TikTok and Meta that grab attention and get results.



Use AI Tools: Use AI (like Claude and Gemini) to help brainstorm ideas, research customers, and write scripts faster.



Study the Data: Look at the numbers to see which ads worked and why, then use those lessons to make the next ads even better.



Lead the Team: Work with our video editors and creators to make sure the final video looks exactly like your vision.



Who we’re looking for

DTC Expert: You have 3+ years of experience writing video ads for big brands that sell online. You know what makes a "good" ad.



AI Power-User: You already use AI tools to help you work. You know how to use AI to get deep insights into what customers want.



Problem Solver: You are great at testing new ideas, moving fast, and hitting your weekly goals without any drama.



The Details

Where: Work from anywhere! (Remote)



Time: Part-time to start, then full-time later.



Salary: $3000 USD per month + Uncapped Commission Bonus



Goal: Help us turn small brands into giant ones using smart strategy and fast testing.



Ready to lead the strategy?



Apply here below!

title: Social Media Manager + Video Editor (Remote)
description:
We’re hiring a Social Media Manager who can also edit videos and who truly understands Western audiences and how platforms rank content (especially YouTube + Instagram).



This is not a beginner role.



What We Need:

- A Social Media Manager + Video Editor who:

- Deeply understands YouTube’s ranking system (CTR, retention, watch time, session time, browse vs suggested traffic, keyword positioning)

- Understands Instagram and TikTok algorith
chanics (watch time, completion rate, saves, shares, remix behavior, creator signals)

- Knows how to craft hooks for Western audiences

- Understands pacing, storytelling structure, tension loops, and viral psychology

- Can edit both short-form and long-form content for performance, not just aesthetics

- Knows what makes content go viral — and why



You must know not just what to post — but what triggers ranking signals.





What You’ll Do:

- Edit short-form (Reels/Shorts/TikTok) and long-form (YouTube)



- Create strong hooks and viral-style pacing





Manage and grow content on:

- YouTube

- Instagram

- TikTok

-

- X 
)

- LinkedIn



Optimize YouTube videos (titles, thumbnails, SEO, retention)



Track analytics and improve performance weekly







REQUIRED (Must Include in Your Application):

If you don’t include these, we won’t review your
:



- Explain YouTube algorithm in your own words



- Explain Instagram/Reels algorithm in your own words



- Proof of results: Can show real proof you’ve grown accounts or channels (screenshots, links, stats, case studies)



- Video samples + tools you use





Important:

No AI-written applications.

If your message looks templated or generic, it will be rejected.



How to Apply:

Send your resume and application with your answers with the subject line: “Social Media Manager – Algorithm Expert”

Send to: George –

title: Senior React / Next.js + Supabase Developer (AI-First) Verified Experience + Perfect English
description:
About BMB Synq



BMB Synq is a fast-growing e-commerce education ecosystem. We build and maintain our platform using React / Next.js, TypeScript, and Supabase. We work AI-first (Cursor, 
v, ChatGPT/Claude) to move fast while keeping architecture clean.



We are a lean team. We value speed, clarity, ownership, and strong technical foundations.



Important Note (Read Carefully)

AI-First is NON-NEGOTIABLE



If you prefer coding everything manually and dislike using AI tools to accelerate development, this role is not a fit.

If you love combining AI tools with excellent engineering judgment, you’ll thrive here.



English Requirement (PERFECT)



Your English must be perfect, both written and spoken. Not “good”. Not “almost”. Perfect.

You will be communicating directly with founders and documenting technical decisions clearly.



Role



You will be the React + Supabase technical owner for the platform. This is a long-term position for someone who can deliver consistently, communicate perfectly, and build safely.



Responsibilities

1) High-Speed Development (AI-First Execution)



Use Cursor / 
v / ChatGPT / Claude to build UI and standard logic quickly



Write strong prompts and iterate efficiently



Move fast without breaking production



2) Supabase Ownership (Backend + Security)



Design and maintain Supabase architecture



Manage: DB schema, Auth, RLS policies, Realtime, Edge Functions



Ensure security, scalability, and clean structure



3) Advanced TypeScript + Integrations



Write high-quality TypeScript when AI reaches limits



Build & maintain integrations (APIs, webhooks, external services)



Debug complex issues and deliver stable fixes



4) Platform Stability



Keep production stable and reliable



Fix critical issues during working hours (no disappearing)



Requirements (Must Have — No Exceptions)

Technical



5+ years professional experience in React / Next.js



Strong TypeScript skills



Deep experience with Supabase: RLS, Auth, Realtime, Edge Functions



Proven ability to work on production systems (not just tutorials)



AI Workflow



Real experience using AI dev tools: Cursor / 
v / Claude / ChatGPT



You can explain how you use AI (prompting approach, verification, refactoring)



Communication



Perfect English spoken + written



Able to explain complex technical topics in simple business language



Proactive updates, no vague answers, no hiding problems



Professional Verification



You must provide a CV with real project history



You must be able to prove you actually did the work listed (details below)



Nice to Have



E-commerce experience



CI/CD, testing, observability



Performance optimization experience



Past technical leadership



Compensation & Terms



€700–€750 EUR per month (fixed)



40 hours/week, flexible schedule, but overlap required for communication



Long-term role if performance is excellent



You must be able to provide a monthly invoice for the agreed amount



Screening Process (Strict — This Filters for Real Seniors)

Step 1 — Application Requirements (MUST SEND ALL)



When applying, include:



CV/Resume (PDF)



GitHub / Portfolio links (mandatory)



2–3 minute Loom video (English only) explaining:



your last 2 React/Next.js projects



your last Supabase project (RLS/Auth)



what you personally built (exact parts)



Proof of work for each major project listed (pick at least 2):



GitHub commits (preferred)



screenshots of PRs / code reviews



reference contact (name +
/LinkedIn)



live walkthrough of code you wrote (screen share)



Answer this (in perfect English):



“Explain Row Level Security to a non-technical founder in 6–8 sentences.”



“Describe your AI workflow: how you prompt, verify, and ship production code.”



If any item is missing, your application is rejected automatically.



Step 2 — English Verification



Short live call (10–15 minutes)



Must demonstrate native-level clarity and professional communication



Step 3 — Paid Technical Test (Realistic Task)



Small scoped task similar to our platform (Next.js + Supabase + RLS)



You must explain decisions clearly



Must deliver clean code + short written explanation



Step 4 — Trial Period



1–2 weeks trial (paid)



We evaluate: speed, quality, stability, communication, ownership

title: CSR Fashion Beauty Application
description:
Customer Support Representative (E commerce | Fashion Brand)



We are looking for an experienced and reliable Customer Support Representative to join our growing e commerce fashion brand. This role requires strong judgment, speed, empathy and the ability to handle high ticket volumes while maintaining a premium customer experience.



This is a long term opportunity for candidates who are organized, proactive and comfortable working in a fast paced online retail environment.



- Responsibilities -



Handle customer inquiries via
, chat and occasional phone calls



Manage tickets efficiently while respecting First Response Time (FRT) and internal SLAs



Use Gorgias to organize, prioritize and resolve tickets



Work with Shopify to review orders, cancellations, refunds and customer details



Coordinate with 3rd party fulfillment partners, including warehouses based in China



Handle sensitive cases such as complaints, negative experiences and trust concerns with professionalism and empathy



Follow internal policies while knowing when and how to de escalate situations



Maintain accurate internal notes and clear communication with the team



- Requirements -



Previous experience as a Customer Support Representative



E commerce experience is required



Experience with Shopify and Gorgias is a strong plus



Experience in the fashion industry is a plus



Ability to manage multiple tickets simultaneously without sacrificing quality



Strong written communication skills and emotional intelligence



Stable internet connection and reliable electricity



Comfortable working with international teams and different time zones



- How we work -



Clear expectations and structured workflows



Focus on speed, consistency and customer satisfaction



Open communication and continuous feedback



Team oriented environment with accountability and ownership



Important application step:



To be considered for this role, all candidates must complete the application form below.

Applications without the completed form will not be reviewed.

title: eCommerce Growth Executive
description:
Own Category Growth, Optimize Performance, and Expand Market Dominance.



Hadley Designs is seeking a Growth Executive to take full ownership of a multi-million dollar product category, with Amazon as the primary growth channel. This is a high-impact role for a results-driven e-commerce operator who thrives on ownership, accountability, and driving measurable growth through disciplined execution and data-backed decision-making.



While this role operates deeply within Amazon, we welcome candidates who have driven growth across e-commerce, DTC, or marketplace environments and are excited to apply that experience within a scaled Amazon ecosystem.



How You’ll Win at Hadley Designs:

We believe performance comes from strong systems executed consistently.



Every eCommerce Growth Executive is expected to progress through three stages:



- Learn the Playbook – Understand our category strategy, operating standards, and decision frameworks

- Apply the Playbook – Execute accurately and consistently to deliver predictable, scalable results

- Enhance the Playbook – Improve systems with new ideas and strategies after mastery is demonstrated



This order matters. We value innovation, but only when it is grounded in proven execution. Our playbook exists to help high performers win faster, create leverage, and scale impact — not slow them down.



To formally apply, apply HERE:

title: Head Of Growth Strategy
description:
Growth Strategist- Application Form 

Remote, European Time Zone

I built this agency because I was excited about growing brands. Whilst others focus on ROAS and platfor
trics. 

We exist to guide brands through growth. 



We hire people who want to understand why a brand’s margin is collapsing, not just how to get their ROAS UP. If you’re the kind of person who asks about the business before you look at the ad account, keep reading.



This role exists because I need someone who can sit in front of a founder, understand their P&L better than they do, and tell them the truth about what’s actually going to grow their business, even when that truth is uncomfortable.

— Andy Gray, Founder & CEO

Who We Are

We’re not media buyers. We’re Performance Scientists.

The Graygency works with 7-8 figure DTC e-commerce brands across the UK, US, and UAE. While other agencies are chasing ROAS and vanity metrics, we’re in the P&L  pulling apart unit economics, contribution margins, and the commercial levers that actually drive profitable growth.

For most of our clients, we’re not just managing their ads. We’re operating as their growth team, , building the commercial roadmap and growth strategy. 



We then execute True Performance across the paid media platforms.

We’re also building this differently. AI-assisted analysis, automated reporting, custom tooling, we're replacing the busywork with technology so our people can focus on the thinking that actually moves the needle.



The Role

This is a commercially-focused growth strategist position for someone who understands that growing a DTC brand is about way more than optimisation. It's about understanding the entire business model and having the backbone to tell founders the hard truth when their expectations are unrealistic, their product positioning is broken, or their spend allocation makes no sense.



This is not an account management role. This is not a media buyer role.



Reports directly to the CEO. Part of the senior leadership team. The kind of role where you shape the agency, not just work in it.



What You’ll Actually Do

Own Strategy Across a Tiered Portfolio

Let’s be real, not every account needs the same level of strategic input, and pretending otherwise burns people out. You’ll build the framework for how we tier and serve clients:

Full growth strategy for our highest-value accounts. You’re in the room with the founder, setting the direction, challenging assumptions, building the commercial roadmap.

Consult and coach on mid-tier accounts alongside our platform specialists. You’re guiding, not doing.

Light-touch oversight on execution-focused accounts. Quick check-ins, flag issues, keep it moving.

Drive Commercial Outcomes

Understand every brand’s P&L: COGS, contribution margins, fixed costs, shipping economics, payback periods. Not as a nice-to-have  as the foundation for everything you recommend.

Work with our internal forecasting tools to develop financial models and forecasts that actually inform decisions, not just fill slides.

Make strategic recommendations on pricing, product positioning, and placement, not just media tactics.

Tell founders the truth. If their ROAS expectations are insane, their product positioning is off, or they’re spending 80% of their budget on existing customers and wondering why growth has stalled, you say it. With data. With credibility. Without losing the relationship.

Own Data & Reporting Quality

QA reporting infrastructure, pacing docs, and budget trackers. You won’t build every report, but when something’s off, you catch it before the client does.

Work with automated reporting tools (GoMarble,Internal measurement tools, custom dashboards) and understand their limitations.

Be hands-on enough to pull your own numbers fro
ta, Google, Shopify, or our reporting stack. If you need someone else to pull data before you can think, this isn’t the right fit.

Develop the Team

Lead a cross-functional team including paid social, PPC, creative strategy, and execs.

Set the standard. Hold people accountable. Be the person the team goes to when they need strategic clarity.



What Success Looks Like







Non-Negotiables

Growth Track Record

5-7 years in e-commerce marketing preferably with both agency and in-house experience. Agency for the pace and multi-account muscle. In-house for the commercial depth. We need both.

Specific, provable numbers. “Scaled Brand from X to Y over 18 months.” Not “worked on high-profile accounts.”

You’ve built growth engines, not just maintained someone else’s.

We want 

Commercial & Financial Acumen

Deep understanding of e-commerce unit economics: COGS, contribution margin, LTV:CAC, payback periods.

You’ve built financial models for scenario planning. Not used someone else’s template  built them.

You can have a serious conversation with a founder about their business model, not just their ad account.

Data Literacy

You can build and maintain reporting infrastructure. Google Sheets, Looker Studio, or equivalent.

You QA data instinctively. Pacing docs, budget trackers, attribution data  you catch what’s off.

You pull your own numbers. You don’t wait for a deck.

Backbone

You’ve delivered hard truths to founders  on pricing, product, expectations, spend allocation  and kept the relationship. This isn’t optional. Half the job is telling smart people things they don’t want to hear.

You build trust through commercial credibility and strategic clarity, not by being nice.

You handle the code-switching of agency life  subscription supplement brand in the morning, luxury fashion in the afternoon  without dropping context.

Platform Knowledge

Strong understanding of Meta and Google platform dynamics. You’re not building campaigns, but you know exactly what good looks like and you can QA what the team produces.

Team Leadership

Managed 2-3 direct reports and directed 5-10 cross-functionally.

Energised by developing junior talent. If mentoring smart specialists into strategists feels like a burden rather than a privilege, this isn’t the role.



What Would Make You Stand Out

Multiple e-commerce verticals, not just one category.

Brands at different stages: early growth, scaling, mature.

Background in consulting, analytics, or finance before moving into marketing.

Built proprietary frameworks, tools, or measurement systems.

International expansion or multi-market experience.

Opinions on how AI and automation multiply strategic impact. We’re building with GoMarble, MCP servers, Claude, and custom alerting. You should be excited by that, not threatened.



Red Flags

Account managers who are great at relationships but can’t show growth numbers.

Media buyers who only think in platform tactics.

People who’ve only worked on mature, high-spend brands in maintenance mode.

Anyone who jumps to tactics before asking diagnostic questions.

People-pleasers who avoid hard conversations to keep things comfortable.





Reports directly to the CEO. Part of senior leadership.

Genuine autonomy to build and lead your function.



This is a chance to shape a growing agency during a pivotal 
nt. Work with ambitious 7-8 figure DTC brands. Build systems that scale. Be part of redefining what a performance marketing agency looks like when it’s built around commercial thinking and technology, not just ad accounts and decks.



Please apply through the following link:

title: Link Builder
description:
We’re expanding our link building team and are looking for experienced Link Builders to work with us long-term.

We primarily hire from Indonesia and the Philippines due to time zone and communication fit.



That said, candidates from all countries are welcome if your English communication is strong.

What we offer:

Fully remote role with flexible working hours

$500 for the first month (probation)

$550 after probation

Monthly performance bonuses (negotiation-based)

10 paid leave days per year

What we’re looking for:

Good to excellent English (written & spoken)

Experience with outreach, negotiation, and link building

Ability to communicate directly with site owners and editors

Strong focus on quality links (no PBNs, farms, or spam tactics)

title: Sales Operations Manager (Revenue Performance)
description:
Job Overview



We are an Australian telehealth business generating high volumes of booked discovery calls each week. Our revenue depends on turning booked calls into attended calls — and attended calls into paid consultations.



We are looking for someone to own the numbers behind our revenue funnel and ensure the system runs with discipline and accountability.



This is a data-focused operations role.



Responsibilities



You will:



• Track daily performance metrics (calls booked, calls attended, show rate, conversion rate)

• Monitor on-time dial performance

• Identify patterns in no-shows and cancellations

• Build and maintain simple dashboards (Google Sheets / Excel)

• Pull reports from Pipedrive CRM

• Flag performance issues immediately

• Provide daily and weekly performance summaries

• Help implement structure and accountability systems



This role is about execution and reporting — not high-level strategy.



Required Skills & Experience



• Experience using a CRM (Pipedrive preferred)

• Strong Google Sheets or Excel skills

• Experience building dashboards

• Experience tracking sales or performance metrics

• Strong written English communication

• Detail-oriented and proactive



You must be comfortable working with numbers every day.



Nice to Have (Not Required)



• Experience in appointment-based businesses

• Experience improving show rates

• Basic automation knowledge (Zapier / Make)



Hours



20–30 hours per week (Australian business hours)



Opportunity to grow into full-time for the right person.



Salary







How to Apply

Please include your CV and a short introductory video on your experience as a sales manager/revenue ops manager. Your experience managing sales performance, What KPIs you tracked and how you improved results using data.



Please answer the following:



What CRM systems have you used?

Please include your expected monthly salary in your application.

Describe a dashboard you have built.

What is your experience tracking sales performance?

title: Case Manager - UK Mortgage Company
description:
Role: Case Manager - UK Mortgage Company



To apply use 17APP point, include FHH08 in the subject line and send a link to short video.



Work Hours 

- 9 to 6pm (GMT)



Initial Qualifications

- Valid Passport ID

- Reliable high-speed internet



Job Overview:



We are a UK-based mortgage company looking for a dependable and organised Case Manager to handle the day-to-day progress of our mortgage applications.



Your main role is to ensure each case moves smoothly—from submission to offer—by keeping everything updated, following up and communicating with clients, and making sure all required documents are complete.



You will work closely with the Director and help streamline the process by managing information, tracking deadlines, and ensuring no case is left behind.



Skills & Experience



- Experience as a Case Manager, Mortgage Administrator, or similar role (preferred)

- Good understanding of the UK mortgage process or willing to learn

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Very organised and detail-oriented

- Able to update and manage multiple cases daily

- Strong problem-solving and follow-up skills

- Can work independently with minimal supervision



Technical Requirements



- Proficient in Microsoft Office (Teams, Word, Excel, Outlook)

- Comfortable using CRMs (ideally Smartr365) and Trello

- Can learn new lender systems and portals quickly



Equipment Needed



- Laptop

- Reliable high-speed internet



Work Qualities



- Professional and client-friendly communication

- Trustworthy with sensitive financial documents

- Able to stay calm under pressure and meet deadlines

- Proactive and able to anticipate next steps in each case

- Able to collaborate with other tea
mbers to get the job done



To apply: send a short video answering the following questions:

- What does Resie Mortgages and Protection do?

- Why you would make a good case manager, including any experience?

- Tell us about an apple shortcut that would be useful in this role?

- Where do you see yourself in 3 years time?

- Why we should take you to interview stage?

- A joke that will make us laugh?

title: Social Media Manager & Copywriter
description:
The Vibe

YP Club isn’t just a network; it’s the infrastructure for the UAE's most ambitious young pioneers. We are building for founders and leaders scaling high-impact companies toward 8-figures. We’ve spent the last six months architecting our proprietary technology, the ExecutiveOS, and now we are ready to turn up the volume.



We don’t do "corporate." We do high-velocity, high-status, and high-impact. We are looking for a Creative Strategist to help us bridge the gap between "early-stage" and "global leader."



What You’ll Be Doing (The Deliverables)

Narrative Design & Copywriting: You will own the voice of YP Club. You’ll translate complex business concepts (The ExecutiveOS) into punchy, high-status copy for Instagram and LinkedIn that resonates with founders.



Visual Excellence (Figma Only): You will own our entire aesthetic. This includes high-end carousels, updated brochure layouts, and UI elements for our app. Every pixel must feel elite, monochromatic, and minimalist.



The Pulse: You’ll join our Monday morning strategy calls to catch the vision for the week and translate our core pillars—Influence, Knowledge, and Wealth—into a content roadmap.



Growth Analytics & Reporting: You don't just "post and pray." You will provide a weekly report on content performance, audience growth, and engagement trends, using data to iterate on our creative strategy.



Brand Guard: You are the gatekeeper of our identity. You ensure every post, banner, and story template aligns with a strict, premium, and minimalist brand guide.



Requirements (The Non-Negotiables)

Master of Figma: This is an absolute requirement. If you only use Canva, please do not apply. We build professional assets in Figma.



Founder-Centric Perspective: You understand the builder’s journey. You know how to create content that speaks to high-net-worth individuals and ambitious entrepreneurs.



Graphic Design Mastery: You have a deep understanding of typography, white space, and visual hierarchy. You can turn a simple text hook into a world-class visual asset.



English Fluency: Your written English must be indistinguishable from a native speaker. You can write with wit, authority, and clarity.



Strategic Thinking: You understand "Social Proof," "Authority Building," and "Community Nuance." You know how to build a brand, not just a following.



The Recruitment Task (The Filter)

To be considered, please send a message with the following:



The Subject Line: You MUST include the word "EXECUTIVE" in your subject.



The Portfolio: A link to your Figma design work. Crucial: Show us your best "High-Status/Minimalist" work.



The Strategy: Tell us about a time you scaled a founder's personal brand or a tech company's social presence. What was the one specific reporting metric you used to measure success?



The Tool: Confirm you are proficient in Figma and detail your experience with weekly reporting/analytics.

title: Executive / Personal Assistant (Remote • Full-Time)

We are looking for a highly organized, proactive Executive / Personal Assistant. This role is a blend of executive admin support and personal assistance—built for someone who loves bringing structure to busy days, protecting a business owner’s time, and quietly making everything work behind the scenes.



If you’re the person who naturally plans ahead, spots problems before they happen, and turns chaos into clear next steps, you’ll thrive here.

title: Project Estimator
description:
PRIOR RECENT EXPERIENCE IN ESTIMATING BLINDS, CURTAINS AND ACOUSTIC PRODUCTS FOR THE UK CONSTRUCTION MARKET IS REQUIRED.

ONLY APPLY IF YOU CAN SHOW REAL, RECENT UK FITOUT ESTIMATING WORK.

APPLICATIONS WITHOUT PROOF WILL NOT BE REVIEWED.



Pre?Screening Requirement

Include your answers in your cover letter. Applications missing these answers will be rejected automatically.



1. List three UK fitout projects where you personally estimated blinds, curtains or acoustic products.

2. State which UK suppliers you have previously requested quotations from and for which products.

3. Provide one example of your takeoff or markup work using Bluebeam or similar software.



Job Purpose

We are hiring an Estimator to support London commercial office fitout projects, specialising in blinds, curtains and acoustic finishes. You must already understand UK construction methods, UK suppliers, UK pricing structures and fitout tendering. This is a part?time role with potential to grow into full?time based on performance, reliability and output quality.

This role involves direct estimating work for premium London office projects. You must be able to work accurately, consistently and at UK commercial standards. Only candidates with recent, proven UK fitout estimating experience will be considered.



Responsibilities

Read and interpret drawings, specifications and BOQs to produce accurate takeoffs and estimates.

Request and negotiate quotations from UK suppliers and subcontractors.

Prepare complete cost breakdowns including labour, materials, preliminaries and risk allowances.

Understand installation sequencing, tolerances and fitout buildability.

Maintain updated knowledge of UK regulations and finishing trade practices.

Work closely with project managers and surveyors.

Keep estimating files organised and audit?ready.

Provide daily updates without follow?up.

Work with consistency, accuracy and attention to detail.



Qualifications

English C2 level.

Strong understanding of UK construction contracts and UK fitout practices.

High accuracy in takeoffs and measurements.

Proficient in Bluebeam, MS Office, CAD tools and CRM systems.

Clear written communication suitable for UK commercial clients.

Able to work independently and make commercially sound decisions.

Experience

Minimum three years of recent experience estimating blinds, curtains and acoustic products for the UK construction market.

Applicants without UK?specific evidence will not be considered.



Wage

USD 12.00 to USD 15.00 per hour depending on experience and output quality.



Schedule

08:00 to 17:00 UK time

Three days per week.



Work Setup

Remote work.



How to Apply

Send your CV and cover letter including answers to the pre?screening questions. Provide proof of UK fitout estimating work and links to companies and suppliers you have worked with. Add JDE/2 in your subject line.

: 



Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

title: Amazon FBA Product Sourcer (Wholesale)
description:
Type: Full-Time (Remote)

Location: Work from Home / Anywhere

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM EST (Weekends Off)



ABOUT US

We are an established and growing multi-million dollar wholesale company based in the U.S., founded in 2021. We specialize in bulk purchasing from trusted brands and distributors and reselling those products on Amazon's marketplace, primarily through the Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) program.



JOB OPPORTUNITY

We're looking for a talented and driven Amazon Product Sourcer to join our remote team. This role is ideal for someone who is analytical, detail-oriented, and passionate about finding profitable products. You'll play a key role in identifying opportunities that directly impact our growth and success.



RESPONSIBILITIES

Review and evaluate wholesale offers to identify profitable products

Analyze product performance and profitability based on established sourcing criteria using tools such as ScanUnlimited, Keepa, and SellerAMP (SAS)

Document findings and organize data using Google Sheets

Prepare draft purchase orders based on your analysis for internal review



WHO YOU ARE

Honest, loyal, and dependable — someone we can trust for the long term

Hardworking and self-motivated, with a strong sense of initiative

Quick to learn new tools and processes, and open to feedback

A team player who works well independently but has no problem collaborating with a team

Analytical and solution-oriented, always looking for ways to improve efficiency



QUALIFICATIONS

Decent understanding about Amazon Wholesale business

Strong analytical and product research skills

Proficiency in Keepa and SellerAMP (SAS) for product and profitability analysis

Advanced knowledge of Google Sheets or Excel, including basic formulas

Comfortable with basic math operations (multiplication, division, percentages, etc.)

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong follow-up ability

Must have your own reliable computer or laptop and a stable internet connection (with backup)



WORK SCHEDULE

Job Type: Full-Time (Remote)

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM EST (Fixed Weekends Off)



WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive hourly rate or performance-based bonuses

Long-term remote opportunity with room for growth

Supportive team culture and continuous training for professional development



HOW TO APPLY

If you meet the qualifications, apply only through the link provided, no need to message here.

mber to support our brand’s growth across digital and offline channels. You will play a key role in processing POs, coordinating marketing campaigns, managing events, and driving strategies that connect with our beauty brand presence.

title: Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

- Flag discrepancies or unusual transactions for review by the CFO



What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Experience handling multi-entity, multi-currency financial data preferred

- Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

- Fluent in English, both written and spoken



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

- Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

- Full-time opportunity

- Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

- Competitive pay

- Training and growth opportunities

- Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



Salary range

- Php 40,000 - Php 65,000 (based on experience)



Application Instructions

Since this is a long-term position, there will be an in-depth qualification process. If you believe you have what it takes, here is what to do next:



Please go to the link below, review the questions carefully, and share the required information.

 



 

If you believe you meet our qualifications and requirements, we encourage you to apply now and become a valuable part of our rapidly expanding company.

title: Payroll Accounting Specialist
description:
Shift: Night Shift (PST)

Job Type: Full-time / Independent Contractor / Remote



Please Note

Applicants without solid U.S. payroll processing and payroll accounting experience will not be considered.

Strong payroll systems proficiency (Rippling preferred), advanced Excel skills, and hands-on experience with payroll reconciliations, audits, and compliance are required.



About the Role

We are seeking a highly capable Payroll Accounting Specialist to support accurate, timely, and compliant payroll operations for a global workforce. This role sits within the Finance team and partners closely with People, Accounting, and external vendors.



You will own end-to-end payroll processing, payroll accounting, reconciliations, audits, and reporting, while supporting select employee lifecycle activities through close collaboration with the People team.



This role is ideal for someone with a strong payroll and accounting mindset, excellent attention to detail, advanced Excel skills, and the ability to operate confidently in a fast-paced, evolving environment.



What You’ll Do

*Payroll Processing & Administration

Own end-to-end payroll processing for U.S. employees

Ensure payroll accuracy across earnings, deductions, taxes, benefits, equity, commissions, and one-time payments

Coordinate payroll calendars, cutoffs, off-cycle runs, and year-end payroll activities

Partner with payroll vendors and internal teams to resolve payroll issues and employee inquiries



*Payroll Accounting & Reconciliations

Prepare and review payroll journal entries in accordance with U.S. GAAP

Perform payroll balance sheet and expense reconciliations each pay period and month-end

Support payroll accruals, true-ups, and payroll-related estimates

Maintain payroll documentation to support audits and internal controls



*Compliance & Reporting

Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll tax requirements

Support payroll audits, benefits audits, and external financial audits

Assist with W-2, 1099, and other year-end payroll filings

Maintain accurate payroll records and supporting schedules



*Systems & Data Management

Administer payroll and HRIS systems, with a focus on data integrity and controls

Partner on system testing, implementations, and payroll process improvements

Maintain accurate employee data related to payroll, compensation, and benefits



*Cross-Functional People Support

Partner with the People team on onboarding, offboarding, and employee changes impacting payroll

Support benefits and leave programs as they relate to payroll processing and deductions

Assist with headcount reporting, budgeting support, and workforce analytics



*Ad Hoc Analysis & Projects

Build payroll reports and models using advanced Excel

Support special projects related to payroll transformation, system upgrades, and process standardization



Who You Are

A clear and professional communicator

Service-oriented and responsive to employee needs

Highly detail-oriented with strong follow-through

Organized and comfortable managing recurring payroll deadlines

Proactive and effective working across Finance and People teams

Adaptable and confident in evolving environments



Required Education, Experience, and Skills

3–5+ years of experience in payroll processing and payroll accounting

Strong understanding of U.S. payroll, taxes, and wage compliance

Hands-on experience preparing payroll journal entries and reconciliations

Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, complex formulas)

Experience working with payroll systems and HRIS platforms (Rippling preferred)

Experience supporting audits and maintaining payroll controls

Ability to analyze payroll data and clearly explain variances



Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

Experience supporting multi-state and international payroll

Prior experience in a high-growth or startup environment

Familiarity with payroll treatment for benefits, equity, and commissions



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

*Your application letter

*An unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

PayrollAccounting – YOUR FULL NAME



!!! Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

title: GL Accountant (For Pooling)
description:
We are building a talent pool of experienced GL Accountants for potential client requirements, supporting entities in the United States, Australia, and Singapore.



This role is for pooling purposes only. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted as soon as matching client opportunities become available.



Job Overview

The GL Accountant will be responsible for managing general ledger activities, ensuring accurate financial reporting, and maintaining compliance with applicable accounting standards (US GAAP, with possible AU / SG exposure).



Key Responsibilities

Oversee and manage the general ledger process, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and compliance with US GAAP

Lead monthly, quarterly, and annual close processes for assigned entities

Perform bank and balance sheet reconciliations, including provision accounts

Investigate and resolve discrepancies and variances

Prepare and review journal entries, including accruals, deferrals, depreciation, amortization, straight-line rent, amortization, and reclassifications

Ensure proper accounting treatment of fixed assets (capitalization, depreciation, impairment, and retirement)

Perform variance analysis and provide explanations for financial results

Manage multi-currency transactions, including foreign exchange gains and losses

Act as Point of Contact (POC) for assigned entities or subsidiaries

Communicate directly with AP, AR, auditors, and internal stakeholders

Support audit activities by preparing schedules and responding to auditor inquiries

Identify opportunities to improve and automate accounting processes

Support transition from 15-day close to 10-day close

Assist in documenting onboarding and accounting processes



Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance

Strong understanding of US GAAP (required)

Minimum 3 years of relevant accounting experience

Experience with NetSuite or another large ERP system (required)

Advanced MS Excel skills

Hands-on experience with month-end close and reconciliations

Ability to multi-task, prioritize deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Team-oriented, professional, and positive attitude



Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting US, AU, or Singapore entities

Multi-entity and multi-currency accounting exposure

Audit support experience

CPA or equivalent certification



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

- Your application letter

- Unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

GLAcctPooling – YOUR FULL NAME



Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

title: LinkedIn Outreach Assistant Needed (Part-Time, Daily)
description:
I’m looking for a focused, detail-oriented LinkedIn Outreach Assistant to help generate leads for a specific website offer I provide to business owners.

• Review my LinkedIn connections

• Strong written English

• Excellent attention to detail

• Ability to follow criteria carefully (no rando
ssaging)

• Good judgment when selecting prospects

• Reliability — daily follow-through



You will be choosing who to message carefully. Quality over quantity. If you tend to rush or blast generic messages, this is not the role for you.



If this sounds like you, please reply with:

A short paragraph about your experience with LinkedIn outreach or lead generation

The tools you’ve used to track conversations

Your availability (hours per week)

Your favourite inspirational quote



I read every application carefully — thoughtful responses stand out.

title: Healthcare Scheduler - Australian Recruitment Agency

title: Data Entry/ Data Processing Specialist (Job Ref: STRT-DE-38804)
description:
Company Overview



StrataWorks is a leading provider of digital consulting and operational solutions. We assist businesses in optimizing workflows, managing data, and improving operational efficiency. Our clients range from startups to established enterprises, and our team is dedicated to delivering accurate, timely, and high-quality operational support.



Position Summary



StrataWorks is seeking a Data Entry / Data Processing Specialist to support the management and maintenance of information across internal systems. This position is critical for ensuring the accuracy, organization, and reliability of data used in decision-making and operational processes.



This is a support role focused on precision and consistency. Technical expertise beyond basic data handling is not required.



Key Responsibilities



Enter, update, and organize data in spreadsheets, databases, and internal platforms



Verify data accuracy and completeness



Conduct online research to gather relevant information for projects



Prepare basic reports and maintain documentation



Maintain organized records of client projects, campaigns, or operational tasks



Follow instructions accurately and review work for errors



Provide assistance to tea
mbers as needed



Adapt to changing tasks based on business requirements



Qualifications



Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy



Proficiency in spreadsheets and online platforms



Ability to follow instructions consistently



Proactive in seeking clarification when needed



Reliable, accountable, and responsive



Fluent in written English



Willingness to work night shifts aligned with US teams



Preferred but not required:



Previous experience in data entry or data processing



Proficiency with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)



Familiarity with databases or CRM platforms



Basic online research skills



Experience in remote team environments



C2-level English proficiency



Importance of the Role



Accurate data is essential to the operational success of StrataWorks. By ensuring information is complete, organized, and reliable, the Data Entry / Data Processing Specialist enables the team to make informed decisions, track progress effectively, and execute projects efficiently.



This role is ideal for candidates who are meticulous, dependable, and committed to supporting operational excellence.



How to Apply



Interested candidates are requested to send a message and complete the application form using the following link:

title: Recruiter
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Recruiter will be responsible for identifying hiring needs and filling job openings. The responsibilities of a recruiter include identifying future hiring needs, designing job descriptions, sourcing candidates through databases and social media, conducting interviews, filing paperwork, and keeping abreast of employment law and legislation. You should also monitor new and existing employees and act as their advocate.



This position is 100% remote.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, disciplined, accountable, transparent, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.





SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Open roles are filled efficiently with high-quality, aligned candidates

- Hiring managers feel supported and informed throughout the recruitment process

- Candidates have a smooth, professional, and inspiring experience

- Talent pipelines are proactively built and maintained

- Recruitment data and metrics are tracked and used to improve performance

- The company’s brand is positively represented in every hiring interaction

- Core values are consistently reflected in all recruitment efforts

- Compliance with employment laws and best practices is maintained

- You take ownership, hit your goals, and contribute to company growth





OBJECTIVES

- Identifying future hiring needs and developing job descriptions and specifications.

- Collaborating with department managers to compile a consistent list of requirements.

- Attracting suitable candidates through databases, online employment forums, social media, etc.

- Conducting interviews and sorting through applicants to fill open positions.

- Assessing applicants' knowledge, skills, and experience to best suit open positions.

- Completing paperwork for new hires.

- Promoting the company's reputation and attractiveness as a good employment opportunity.

- Managing internship programs.

- Keeping up-to-date on current employment legislation and regulations and enforcing them within the company.

- Providing recruitment reports to team managers.





COMPETENCIES

- The ability to conduct different types of interviews.

- Experience with recruitment processes and databases.

- The ability to design and implement recruiting strategies.

- Excellent communication skills.

- Good interpersonal skills.

- Good decision-making skills.

- A working knowledge of employment law and legislation.

- At least 3 years’ experience in a human resources/recruitment environment





PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

- Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer





COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.





If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: Hiring: Ecommerce Manager (Dropshipping + Etsy Personalized Products Experience)
description:
Part Time to start and can become full time later. 



We are looking for a highly skilled Ecommerce Manager with proven experience in dropshipping operations, supplier sourcing, and managing personalized/custom products similar to those sold on Etsy.



This role is perfect for someone who understands the full lifecycle of dropship products—from research, sourcing, supplier management, to coordinating with marketing and web teams.



About the Role



As our Ecommerce Manager, you will oversee the end-to-end process of building and scaling high-performing dropshipping stores. You must have a strong understanding of:

Dropshipping business model

Supplier vetting and quality control

Logistics & shipping performance (EU, North America, Australia, New Zealand)

Personalized/custom product fulfillment (Etsy-style products)

Product research and validation

Website merchandising and product page optimization

Cross-functional collaboration with web developers and media buyers

Training will be provided for product research tools, but experience is a strong advantage.



Key Responsibilities

Product Research & Validation

Use product research tools to identify winning products (training provided)

Prioritize products with strong personalization/customization potential

Supplier Sourcing & Management

Find and verify high-quality dropship suppliers with fast shipping to:

EU, USA, Canada, UK, Australia, New Zealand

Identify suppliers specializing in Etsy-style personalized/custom products

Manage supplier communication, sample ordering, quality checks, and dispatch times

Build a vetted supplier list and maintain relationships

Work closely with performance marketing to scale winners



Requirements

Must-Have Skills:



2+ years experience in ecommerce dropshipping

Strong supplier sourcing skills (AliExpress, CJ, Zendrop, private suppliers, Etsy-style suppliers)

Understanding of quality control, sample testing, and production timelines

Knowledge of EU, NA, and AU logistics & shipping times

Strong experience managing end-to-end product onboarding



Bonus Skills (Huge Advantage):



Experience working with POD suppliers for jewelry, gifts, engravings, apparel, home décor, etc.

Familiarity with Etsy production workflows and handmade/custom suppliers

title: Software Developer
description:
***PLEASE READ ON HOW TO APPLY***



Job Title: Software Developer

Location: Remote | Philippines based ONLY

Salary Range: Php 180,000 per month

A MUST: Minimum of 5 years of solid experience



We’re looking for talented Software Developers to join our remote-first team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for

building and maintaining responsive, high-performing full- stack web applications using Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and

Supabase. 



Our ideal candidate writes clean, maintainable code, takes ownership of their work, and thrives in a fast-paced

startup environment where autonomy, communication, and craftsmanship are valued.



Key Responsibilities

- Design, develop, and maintain web applications using TypeScript, React, and Next.js.

- Work with Supabase (PostgreSQL) to design, query, and optimise relational database schemas.

- Integrate third-party APIs, including reading, understanding, and applying API documentation.

- Implement responsive, accessible, and performant user interfaces with Tailwind CSS.

- Utilise AI-powered tools (e.g. Cursor, Claude, and similar) to accelerate development while

maintaining high code quality and exercising sound engineering judgment over AI-generated output.

- Collaborate with other developers and/or stakeholders to refine requirements, propose technical solutions, and deliver features on agreed timelines.

- Work with background jobs and scheduled tasks using Inngest (or similar services) for cron-like and event-driven workflows.

- Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve issues across the stack, including in production environments.

- Produce clear technical documentation for features, architectural decisions, and processes.

- Communicate proactively and clearly within a remote team, including written updates and participation in online meetings across UK-Philippines time zones.

title: N8N AUTOMATION SPECIALIST - AI HEALTHCARE WORKFLOWS (US HOURS)
description:
Company - Romea.AI

AI automation company building intelligent patient communication systems for plastic surgery clinics and medspas across the US and Australia. We run complex n8n workflows with 100+ nodes handling real-time AI conversations across SMS, WhatsApp, Instagram,
,
, and voice. Our systems process thousands of patient interactions daily using Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini, and custom LLM pipelines. Small senior team, fast-moving, zero bureaucracy.

Hours and Schedule

Must overlap US business hours. Remote/work from home. Start part-time with clear path to full-time based on performance.

What This Role Actually Is

You will own, build, debug, and improve production n8n workflows that are not simple automations. These are large-scale AI agent systems with 100+ nodes including LLM chains, Postgres chat memory, multi-channel message routing, webhook orchestration, CRM integrations, and heavy JavaScript code nodes. You need to look at a workflow like this and immediately understand what it does, where it can break, and how to make it better.

You will also read API documentation for platforms we integrate with (EMR systems like 4D, CRM platforms like GoHighLevel, booking systems, payment processors) and build new API connections fast. We expect you to use AI tools like Claude to accelerate your work. If you are not already using AI to code faster, this is not the right role.

What You Will Do

Build and maintain complex n8n workflows from scratch including AI agent nodes, conditional routing, webhook handling, code nodes with JavaScript, HTTP request chains, and error handling across multi-step processes.

Read and implement API integrations from documentation. When we get access to a new API like a medical records system or booking platform, you figure out the endpoints, authentication, data mapping, and build the n8n integration or standalone connector.

Debug production workflows. When something breaks at 2am and a clinic is not getting their AI responses, you trace the issue through webhook logs, node executions, API responses, and fix it.

Write and maintain JavaScript code nodes that handle data transformation, message routing, prompt building, contact enrichment, and output processing within n8n workflows.

Work with our AI models. Understand how Anthropic Claude and Google Gemini are configured in n8n agent nodes, how chat memory works with Postgres, how prompts are built dynamically, and how to tune these for better results.

Coordinate with the team. You work independently but communicate clearly. When you find a problem or finish a build, you document it and share it.

Must-Haves (No Exceptions)

Proven n8n experience with complex workflows. Not 5-node automations. You must have built or maintained workflows with 50+ nodes including code nodes, HTTP requests, webhooks, conditional logic, and error handling. Show us examples.

Strong JavaScript skills. You will read, write, and debug JavaScript daily inside n8n code nodes. You must be comfortable with async operations, JSON manipulation, API response parsing, and data transformation.

API integration experience. You have connected systems by reading API docs, handling authentication (OAuth, API keys, bearer tokens), parsing responses, and mapping data between platforms. REST APIs and JSON are second nature to you.

Experience coding with AI. You actively use Claude, ChatGPT, or similar tools to write and debug code faster. You understand prompt engineering well enough to get accurate code output and know how to verify and fix what AI generates.

Git and GitHub. You use version control. You can clone repos, create branches, commit, push, and handle pull requests. This is mandatory.

Python literacy. You can read Python code, understand Python scripts, and make basic modifications. We are moving some systems to FastAPI and you need to follow along.

Problem-solving mindset. When something breaks you do not wait for someone to tell you what to do. You investigate, trace the issue, test solutions, and fix it.

Good written and verbal English. You will communicate with the team daily and occasionally with clients.

Strong Preferences (Big Plus)

Docker experience. Understanding containers, docker-compose, how to deploy and update containerized services.

Server management basics. Comfortable with Linux servers, SSH, updating services, checking logs, restarting processes. We run on Digital Ocean and Hetzner.

Vercel and/or Render experience. We deploy frontend and some backend services on these platforms.

FastAPI knowledge. We are converting some n8n workflows to FastAPI microservices. If you can already build FastAPI endpoints, that is a major advantage.

GoHighLevel experience. Many of our workflows integrate heavily with GHL including contacts, conversations, opportunities, calendars, and custom webhooks.

Healthcare or clinic automation experience. Understanding HIPAA basics, patient data handling, appointment booking flows.

Postgres database experience. Our chat memory and data storage runs on Postgres.

What Success Looks Like in 30 to 60 Days

You have taken ownership of at least 2 to 3 production client workflows and can maintain them independently. You have built at least one new API integration from documentation. You have improved existing workflows with better error handling, cleaner code nodes, or performance optimizations. You have documented your work so the team can follow it.

How We Work

We use n8n self-hosted for workflow automation, GitHub for version control, ClickUp for project management, Slack for communication. Our AI stack includes Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini, and OpenAI models. We integrate with GoHighLevel, Symplast, 4D EMR, HealthEngine, Google services, Twilio, and various other platforms via API.

What to Include in Your Application (Show Do Not Tell)

Links to n8n workflow examples or screenshots of complex workflows you have built. Redact sensitive information.

Your GitHub profile. We want to see real code, not empty repos.

A short description of the most complex API integration you have built and how you approached it.

Which AI tools you use for coding and a specific example of how AI helped you solve a problem faster.

Your hourly rate or monthly retainer expectation, US hours you can cover, and earliest start date.

title: Creative Director - E-commerce (Luxury Brand)
description:
Before anything else…



We can definitely tell when a message feels overly dependent on or fully generated by AI. Nothing wrong with using AI (we all do!), but if you really want to stand out, we’d love to hear your voice. Your taste. Your thinking. Your creative energy.



!! How to Apply (Read Carefully) !!

Incomplete applications won’t be reviewed. If you’re applying for a Creative Director role, attention to detail and the ability to follow direction is kind of the bare minimum.



1. Use “Creative Director” as your
 subject line.

2. In your message, include: A short introduction about yourself

3. A link to your resume and portfolio

4. Your availability to start

5. Your desired starting rate ($/hour)



JOB TITLE: Creative Director



Key Responsibilities:

- Lead the creative direction and execution of Cabana’s visual identity across all platforms

- Drive the design of products, packaging, campaigns, website visuals, and digital content

- Collaborate cross-functionally to tell one cohesive brand story

- Review, refine, and elevate all creative output to ensure luxury-level consistency

- Translate strategy into stunning visuals that capture the heart of our audience

- Inspire and guide the design team while staying hands-on when needed



Bonus: Step in as Brand Designer for key campaigns or special projects



Qualifications:

- 2–3+ years of experience in art direction, brand design, or creative leadership

- Strong portfolio showcasing visual identity work across digital and print

- Mastery of design systems, typography, color, and composition

- Experience in lifestyle, luxury, or wellness brands

- Detail-oriented, collaborative, and obsessed with visual storytelling

- Strong project management skills — able to run projects end-to-end and keep timelines tight



Bonus:

- Good sense for copywriting (you think visually and verbally)

- Proficiency in Figma, Framer, or similar tools



Why Work with Cabana?

- Work from anywhere that sparks your creativity

- Flexible schedule (just a few shared US hours for collaboration)

- Paid Philippine holidays

- Supportive, no-drama team

- Build a luxury wellness brand that blends science with style



Role Overview:

At Cabana, design isn’t just how we look, it’s who we are.



As our Creative Director, you’ll shape and elevate Cabana’s visual world across every touchpoint — from our website and campaigns to packaging and branded experiences. This role is about bringing beauty, intention, and storytelling into every pixel.



You’ll collaborate closely with our Brand Designer, Front-End, and Web teams to bring our luxury wellness vision to life. Every detail should feel thoughtful, modern, and unmistakably Cabana.



Perfect for someone who lives for aesthetics, thrives on creative energy, and knows how to turn a brand into a feeling.





About Cabana:

Cabana is where science meets style, a modern luxury wellness brand redefining what it means to look and feel your best. We offer science-backed treatments like GLP-1s and hormone therapies, helping people live with more confidence, energy, and ease.



We’re building something beautiful. At Cabana, you won’t just design visuals, you’ll help shape a world where wellness feels elevated, effortless, and deeply personal.

title: MSP - Senior Systems Engineer - M365 / Azure / Security
description:
Location: Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid / onsite)

Hours: Mon–Fri, 8:30am–5:30pm (Australian Eastern Time), with a 1-hour lunch break

Type: Full-time



About Us

We’re a fast-growing Australian Managed Service Provider supporting small–to–mid-sized businesses. We deliver modern workplace, cloud, security, and networking solutions with a strong focus on Microsoft 365 and Azure.



The Role

We’re looking for a client-facing Senior Systems Engineer to lead complex escalations and deliver cloud and on-prem projects. You’ll own Microsoft 365/Azure environments, strengthen security posture, and mentor our service desk while driving improvements in reliability and user experience.



What You’ll Do

Own client environments: Manage Microsoft 365, Azure (including Azure Virtual Desktop), and on-prem infrastructure (Windows Server, AD/GPO).



Networking: Administer local networks including firewalls (SonicWall), switches, and Wi-Fi (Ubiquiti/UniFi).



Escalations: Act as the senior escalation point for Office/Microsoft 365 and general IT issues from our helpdesk.



Projects & migrations: Plan and deliver Microsoft 365/Azure deployments, AVD builds, tenant-to-tenant moves,
/domain migrations, and server/network upgrades.



Security & compliance: Implement Conditional Access, Intune/Endpoint Manager, Microsoft Defender (ATP), and
 authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC).



Automation & documentation: Script with PowerShell, create runbooks, improve processes, and maintain high-quality technical/customer documentation.



Client communication: Translate technical concepts into clear business language and build trusted relationships with stakeholders.



What You’ll Bring (Required)

Microsoft 365 expert: SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive, Exchange Online, Power Automate (Flow) and related services.



Security & device management: Microsoft Defender (ATP), Intune/Endpoint Manager, Conditional Access/Entra ID.



Azure experience: Azure IaaS/VMs and Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) design/operations.



 security: Hands-on setup of SPF, DKIM, and DMARC.



Windows Server & AD: Group Policy, DNS/DHCP, and identity fundamentals.



Networking: Switching/VLANs, Wi-Fi (Ubiquiti/UniFi), and SonicWall firewall administration.



Communication: Excellent written and spoken English; comfortable leading client calls and documenting solutions.



Nice to Have

PowerShell automation for M365/Azure/Entra tasks.



Exchange hybrid experience.



Backup/DR in Microsoft/Azure ecosystems.



ITIL-aligned service management in an MSP.



Exposure to other firewalls/WAFs or SD-WAN.



Certifications (Preferred, not required)

Microsoft: MS-102, SC-300, AZ-104, AZ-140.



SonicWall (e.g., CSSA) and/or Ubiquiti (UEWA).



How We’ll Measure Success

Reduced escalations through robust standards and automation.



On-time, in-scope delivery of migrations and projects.



Improved security posture (MFA/CA coverage, device compliance, Defender baselines).



Clear, proactive client communication and high CSAT.



How to Apply:



**TO APPLY FOR THE JOB :

1. YOU MUST HAVE Level 3 EXPERIENCE IN AN MSP

2. PLEASE SEND YOUR RESUME

3. PLEASE SEND VIDEO RECORDING OUTLINING WHY YOU WOULD BE A GREAT FIT FOR OUR COMPANY

4, PLEASE ANSWER THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS :

A. What MSP Experience do you have?

B. Please describe how you currently ensure your office365 tenants are secure? What best practices do you apply and how?

C. Please provide details of networks your have been responsible for in an MSP and duties associated with

D. What AUD monthly salary rate are you looking for?

title: Operations Manager - Offshore Staffing solution
description:
Job Title: Operations Manager

Location: Fort Bonifacio, Taguig, Metro Manila, Philippines  (Will be onsite once operation starts)

Employment Type: Full-time

Industry: Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) – Managed IT Services & Accounting Support

Work Schedule: Australian business hours (Monday to Friday)

________________________________________

About Us

We are a startup boutique Offshore staffing solution operation dedicated to supporting Managed IT Service Providers (MSPs) and accounting firms based in Australia. Our mission is to deliver specialised, high-quality offshore support that aligns with our clients' technical and professional needs. With a focus on precision, trust, and long-term partnerships, we aim to redefine outsourcing through a personalised, values-driven approach.

________________________________________

Role Overview

We are seeking an experienced Operations Manager to establish and lead our Philippine operations. This role will be pivotal in setting up the local business infrastructure and building a high-performing team to support our growing client base. You will play a key role in both startup execution and ongoing operations, ensuring our services meet the high expectations of our Australian clients.

________________________________________

Initial Responsibilities

In the first 3–6 months, you will work directly with the founders on:

• Business Setup: Assist in setting up local business registration, legal structure, and regulatory compliance.

• Office Establishment: Research, negotiate, and secure a serviced office in Fort Bonifacio; manage the transition to a long-term dedicated office space as we grow.

• Vendor Coordination: Coordinate with legal, HR, real estate, and IT vendors to support operational readiness.

• Hiring: Collaborate on recruiting and onboarding the first wave of staff (technical, administrative, and accounting support roles).

• Policy & Process Development: Help establish company policies, internal procedures, and workflows tailored to Australian client needs.

________________________________________

Ongoing Responsibilities

• Operational Leadership: Manage day-to-day operations to ensure reliable, high-quality service delivery.

• Team Management: Lead, train, and develop the team across technical and support functions.

• Client Management: Ensure excellent communication, KPI adherence, and satisfaction for Australian clients.

• Performance Monitoring: Track and report on productivity, quality, and service metrics.

• Continuous Improvement: Identify areas for operational improvement and implement process enhancements.

• Culture Building: Foster a positive, collaborative culture aligned with our core values and the expectations of a modern BPO environment.

________________________________________

Qualifications

• Minimum 5 years of BPO experience, with at least 2 years in an operations leadership role.

• Prior involvement in startup or greenfield BPO setup is highly desirable.

• Familiarity with Philippine business registration processes and office leasing.

• Experience working with Australian clients or an understanding of Australian work culture.

• Exposure to Managed IT Services or accounting/BAS/bookkeeping operations is a strong plus.

• Excellent English communication, people management, and problem-solving skills.

• Able to work autonomously and take initiative in a fast-paced environment.

________________________________________

What We Offer

• Competitive salary package

• Opportunity to shape and lead a startup from the ground up

• Direct collaboration with Australian founders and decision-makers

• Growth trajectory into a senior leadership position

• Australian public holidays observed (with local adjustments)

• Dynamic, purpose-driven work environment

• Opportunity for Phantom Equity / Management incentive Plan

________________________________________

How to Apply

To apply, please submit the following:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short video (2–4 minutes) introducing yourself and answering the following questions:

Video Questions:

1. Tell us a bit about yourself and your professional background.

2. What experience do you have working with Australian clients or in Australian time zones?

3. Have you ever been involved in setting up a new operation or business unit? What was your role?

4. What steps would you take to secure a serviced office in Fort Bonifacio within a startup budget?

5. How would you approach building a high-performing team from scratch in a boutique BPO environment?

6. What do you believe makes Managed IT Services and accounting support different from other BPO verticals?

7. What excites you about the opportunity to be part of an early-stage operation?

title: Appointment Setter (Warm Leads)
description:
Why join easyIT?

easyIT is a fast-growing Australian Managed Service Provider that supports businesses with 10-100 staff. We pride ourselves on fast, friendly service and a culture where people love coming to work. To keep pace with demand, we’re adding a dedicated Appointment Setter to turn warm LinkedIn connections  into high-value first meetings.

________________________________________

What you’ll do

Key Responsibility Typical Activities

20 % Qualify & Research Review each warm lead in LinkedIn Navigator / CRM, check company size, industry fit, tech stack and key pain points (public news, website, Crunchbase, etc.).

60 % Outbound Calling & Messaging Phone, voice-note or InMail prospects, introduce easyIT, reference mutual MD connection, and secure a 30-min discovery call for the MD (or sales lead).

10 ?lendar & CRM Management Book meetings, enter call notes, set follow-ups, keep pipeline data clean and up-to-date.

10 % Continuous Improvement A/B-test talk-tracks, share insights with marketing, suggest content pieces that would help conversion.

________________________________________

About you

• 1-3 years in appointment setting, SDR/BDR, telemarketing or similar role—ideally in IT, SaaS or professional services.

• Comfortable making 70 quality calls per day (of which expected to conversations with 10 people) and navigating gatekeepers with empathy.   These are not cold call.  They are Warm Calls

• Proven record of booking meetings that convert (please bring metrics).

• Working knowledge of CRM (HubSpot, Pipedrive, Salesforce or similar) and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.

• Strong business acumen: you can quickly grasp a prospect’s business model and likely technology pain points.

• Clear, confident phone manner and written communication that feels human, not scripted.

• Self-starter who thrives in a small, results-oriented team.

________________________________________

Nice-to-haves

• Exposure to managed IT services or cybersecurity.

• Experience working with Australian SMEs (10-100 seat range).

________________________________________

What we offer

• Base salary + performance bonuses for each completed meeting and qualified opportunity.

• Flexible work: Work From Home (WFH) – Australian AEST business hours .

• Ongoing coaching.

• Fun, inclusive culture—Final-Friday trainings & Lunch,  team hack-days 



How to apply  (NO CHAT GPT Responses!)



 
 with:

1. Send a video recording outlining why you’ll smash this role.

2. Your CV (PDF).

3. Two bullet-point examples of meetings you set that became revenue.

4.     Your expected Salary (in AUD)
