This role requires strong storytelling skills, technical expertise, and the ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

title: Brand Voice Consultant - Phone Based Customer Service and Social Media
description:
| ARE YOU OUR ULTIMATE BRAND VOICE? |



The most exciting phone based client role we have ever opened!



One position only | Immediate start | High impact and high reward | Amazing company



Are you bored of sounding like everyone else on the phone?



Do you know that if clients could just hear your voice, your energy, your confidence and your warmth, they would already feel safe, excited and ready to book?



Do people constantly tell your voice sounds globally polished?



Are you bored at work with the same stale script and call centre vibe all the time, and are looking for something more?



Do you light up when you are on the phone, not drain the energy by sounding like a note taker?



If this feels like you, keep reading. This role is rare and so are you!





| ABOUT THE ROLE |



We are hiring one person and we are looking for a voice diamond.



This role is the front door of My Ultimate Events! You will be the very first human most clients ever speak to when they call our Australian brands My Ultimate Hens, My Ultimate Bucks and My Ultimate Team.



Your voice, confidence, warmth and energy will set the tone for their entire experience.



This is not a call centre.

This is not cold calling.

This is not robotic or generic customer service support.



You will be answering warm inbound calls, guiding clients through our proven call flow, routing them into the right pathways, and creating instant trust, excitement and clarity.



You will also support written client and internal CRM communication when required, but your superpower is the phone.



When you are not on calls, you will also help grow our brand presence through social media and content, creating exciting, engaging posts that feel human, fun and high vibe. You must be confident using Canva and CapCut and able to write naturally, not robotically. You will have access to our AI image and video generation tools, Shutterstock, Canva and Capcut subscriptions in order to create dynamic, on brand reels, statics and captions. 



This is a high visibility role.

You are not behind the scenes.

You are the energy clients remember.



We are 15 years established, operating across Australia, with a long term Filipino and Australian team. We are stable, fast growing, and deeply committed to hiring people we can build with long term.







| WHAT YOU WILL DO |



Answer warm inbound phone calls from Australian based clients



Follow our established call flow to qualify, guide and route clients correctly



Create instant rapport, confidence and excitement on every call



Sound polished, warm, global and easy to understand



Never sound scripted, robotic or stiff



Route enquiries cleanly into the correct team or pathway



Handle basic questions and booking navigation confidently



Log call outcomes accurately into our CRM



Support written communication when required



When not on calls:



Create social media content using Canva and CapCut



Write engaging captions and brand voice content in natural English



Support brand development and online presence



Help keep My Ultimate feeling alive, exciting and premium online





| WHO YOU ARE |



You are not quiet.

You are not shy.

You do not sound small.



You are:



Confident, warm and charismatic on the phone



Easy to understand, global sounding voice



Comfortable speaking with Australian clients



Naturally bubbly, engaging and high energy



Someone who people like immediately when they hear you



Someone who makes brands sound premium and exciting



Organised, reliable and calm under pressure



Happy following process while still sounding human



You understand that voice is brand and you take pride in how you sound.



We are not looking for a generic call centre operative who sounds bland and generic. Do not apply if this is you!





| YOU MUST HAVE |



Proven experience handling phone based client roles



Experience speaking to Australian, UK or US markets



Clear, confident spoken EXCELLENT English that is easy for Western clients to understand



Social media experience using Canva and CapCut



Ability to write natural, engaging English without relying on AI to do the charisma for you (using it for spell check is fine)



A quiet home office and professional headset



Fast, wired internet and Windows PC



Strong attention to detail and process



If people struggle to understand you on the phone, or you don't have an excellent advanced understanding of English, this role will not suit you. This is a premium voice position.





| WORK HOURS |



Please only apply if you can commit to these exact hours every week. These hours are fixed and essential for this role.



Monday to Friday

7:00 am to 6:00 pm Brisbane Time

(5:00 am to 4:00 pm Manila Time)

During your shift you have 90 minutes total in breaks. 

(You get a total of 30 minutes of paid break time and 60 minutes of unpaid break time per shift)



Brisbane is UTC plus 10 and does not use daylight savings, so the hours remain the same year round.



Daily work and break structure:



7:00 am Brisbane | (5:00 am Manila)

Log on



9:00 am to 9:10 am Brisbane | (7:00 am to 7:10 am Manila)

Paid refreshment break



11:30 am to 12:00 pm Brisbane | (9:30 am to 10:00 am Manila)

First unpaid lunch break



2:30 pm to 2:40 pm Brisbane | (12:30 pm to 12:40 pm Manila)

Paid refreshment break



4:00 pm to 4:30 pm Brisbane | (2:00 pm to 2:30 pm Manila)

Second unpaid lunch break



5:20 pm to 5:30 pm Brisbane | (3:20 pm to 3:30 pm Manila)

Paid refreshment break



6:00 pm Brisbane | 4:00 pm Manila

Finish shift





| SALARY AND BENEFITS |



60,000 PHP per month depending on experience and voice quality



13th month pay



All Filipino public holidays paid and you don't come to work



As well as 15 days paid annual leave per year



Long term, full time stability



High trust, high growth environment



One of the most exciting front of brand roles in our company





| ABOUT US |



My Ultimate Events is Australia’s leading events company for hens, bucks and corporate team experiences. We have been operating for over 15 years and have built one of the strongest Filipino Australian teams in the industry.



We are fun, fast, bold, and people focused.

We care deeply about our team, your career growth, brand, client experience and team culture.



This is not just a job.

This is a glow up role.





| WHAT OUR FILIPINO TEAM SAY |



We do not churn people. We nurture them. We are a high performing team made up of growth mindset people. We hold ourselves at every level to a high standard and only hire tea
mbers who embody this for themselves as well. 



Our team stays because they grow, they feel valued, and they are part of something real. Our Filipino tea
mbers are long term, and we hire for growth of the company, not churn and burn. Because this is a place where effort is noticed, careers are built, and people are genuinely supported.



This is what some of our amazing tea
mbers say about working here at My Ultimate:



“Best company I have ever worked for. They actually do what they say they will. They really train you, support you and push you to grow instead of leading with fear. That changed everything for me. I have been here five years now and I still feel proud to be part of this team.” - Joan, 5 year ultimate tea
mber



“The managers here really work with you, not against you. They actually want you to succeed, not just survive. I have grown more in two years at My Ultimate than anywhere else in my career. Joining this company was honestly the best decision I have made for myself professionally and actually personally as well.” - Phillip, 2 years in to his ultimate career



“I have only been here six months but I feel so lucky everyday and thank god I found this role everyday as well. People celebrate the wins, they notice your effort and they push you to keep growing. The 
ntum and the support make coming to work every day exciting. If you get the chance to work here, you will really cherish it.” - Newbie Maria, 6 months in to her ultimate career





| HOW TO APPLY |



Do not apply through OnlineJobs. We do not check it.



 us at 



Include:



The word Champagne in the subject line of your



A short video introducing yourself and letting us hear your voice clearly, and in it tell us what your favourite My Ultimate Hens package is in Melbourne and why. 



A cover letter written by you, not AI, explaining your phone and client experience



Your CV



Your PC specs, internet speed and workspace setup



We are hiring the one person right for this role. Make sure your application stands out!



If you are confident, charismatic, globally polished and ready to be the voice of an iconic Australian brand, we want to meet you.



Welcome to your Ultimate career move!



_



We want to hear from you if you have experience in customer service, call centre, inbound calls, phone based support, voice roles, customer experience, client services, virtual assistant, VA, sales support, inbound sales, warm leads, appointment setting, customer care, customer success, front desk, receptionist, phone agent, call handling, Western market support, US clients, UK clients, Australian clients, social media management, content creation, Canva, CapCut, brand voice, community management, chat support,
 support, and CRM based customer communication.

title: Appointment Setter Needed ASAP – Immediate Start
description:
CLIENT SALES REP - FULL-TIME POSITION FOR HIGH PERFORMERS ONLY



WARNING: This isn't your typical "dial and smile" appointment setting role. We're building the #1 renovation growth agency in Australia, and we need absolute killers who thrive under pressure and deliver results. If you're looking for an easy paycheck, keep scrolling.



About ReynMedia



We're a renovator-specific growth agency helping high-ticket renovators ($20K-$100K+ AUD projects) generate consistent revenue. Our clients close $100K+ monthly because we don't mess around with cheap leads or empty promises.



We're scaling FAST: 10 clients now, 50 ASAP, 100 by end of 2026.



Your Mission As Client Sales Rep:



You're the bridge between high-value homeowners and life-changing renovation projects. Every call you make impacts thousands of families getting their dream homes.



Core responsibility: Call and qualify 100% of inbound leads to achieve 30-40% qualification rate.



What You'll Do Daily:



- Call new leads immediately when they come in (speed matters)

- Follow up with existing pipeline prospects

- Qualify homeowners for $20K+ renovation projects

- Track Leads Via GoHighLevel CRM

- Send Leads To Our Clients Directly Via Slack

- Communicate With Our Clients On Lead Specific Information

- Deliver an exceptional customer experience on every call

- Track performance and submit daily reports





Schedule & Compensation:



Hours: 9am-5pm Australian Eastern Daylight Time (full-time)

Base + Commission: $5/AUD + $6 commission for every lead you qualify

Uncapped earning potential - our killers make serious money ($600+ AUD per week)



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

- 1+ years phone-based B2C sales/appointment setting experience

- Proven ability to build rapport and trust quickly

- Experience with CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred, training provided)

- Elite level organisation and consistency

- Sales-driven mindset with positive attitude

- Available during mandatory hours



BONUS: Prior experience with renovators/home services



Our Culture (Can You Handle It?):

- Pure devotion to delivering best-in-class service

- Extreme accountability - we call each other out

- Elite standards - we don't settle for second place

- Growth focused - personal and professional development

- Fun - a work environment our team loves working in every day



This role is an entry point to higher positions. We promote from within based on performance, commitment, and competency.



Don't Apply If...

- You can't handle direct feedback

- You're just looking for any paycheck

- You don't thrive in high-performance environments

- You can't commit to consistent daily activity



How To Apply:



1. Fill out application form: 
/
. MANDATORY: Record 60-second Vocaroo audio explaining why you'll crush this role

3. We respond within 24-48 hours if you advance to group interview



Applications without Vocaroo submissions videos are automatically rejected.



Spots fill fast when we post these positions. Apply immediately if you're serious about joining the ReynMedia team and helping renovators and homeowners achieve their dreams.

title: Operations & Client Support Assistant
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a boutique interior design studio seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented Operations & Administrative Assistant to support daily business needs. This role focuses on
 management, administrative tasks, and backend organization allowing the founder to concentrate on creative work and client relationships.



This position does not involve sales or direct client interaction, but it does require professional communication with vendors, trade partners, and brands regarding pricing, samples, orders, and shipping. The role is hands-on and execution-driven, with a strong emphasis on organization and follow-through.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



 & Administrative Operations

* Monitor, organize, and maintain structured inbox systems

* Draft, send, and respond to professional
s using provided templates and brand guidelines

* Proactively follow up on outstanding
s, requests, and action items

* Flag priority items, identify next steps, and ensure timely resolution

* Maintain clear documentation and organization of
 threads when needed



Calendar & Scheduling Support

* Manage and maintain the business calendar, including scheduling calls, vendor meetings, site visits, and deadlines

* Coordinate scheduling with internal tea
mbers as needed

* Follow established calendar guidelines and respect scheduling boundaries



Vendor & Trade Accounts

* Apply to new trade and vendor accounts

* Track approvals, account credentials, and relevant details

* Request samples, pricing, and written confirmations

* Maintain organized and up-to-date vendor records



Purchasing & Order Tracking

* Log purchases, invoices, and related documentation

* Upload receipts and supporting files

* Track order status, shipping, and deliveries

* Communicate with vendors regarding delays, issues, or discrepancies



Design & Operations Support Systems

* Upload products, brands, and client-associated information into design software (Programma)

* Maintain clean, organized project records, removing duplicate or outdated items

* Assist with product tracking and coordination of shipping/freight to receiving companies and delivery setup



Future Support (as the role evolves)

* Assist with backend support for the website, ShopMy, and social platforms

* Light content uploads and organization (no creative direction required)



REQUIRED SKILLS

* Strong written English and professional communication skills

* Extremely detail-oriented with strong organizational habits

* Comfortable working with
, spreadsheets, and online systems

* Able to follow established processes and checklists consistently

* Proactive, reliable, trustworthy, and calm under direction

* Comfortable working independently once trained



Bonus (Not Required):

* Experience with interior design, architecture, or creative studios

* Familiarity with tools such as QuickBooks, Programma, or similar platforms



HOURS & PAY

* 10–15 hours per week to start

* Flexible schedule (some overlap with U.S. Central Time preferred)

* $6–$10/hour, depending on experience

* Long-term role with opportunity to grow



1-WEEK PAID TRIAL

Final candidates will complete a one-week paid trial to ensure alignment in communication, execution, and workflow.



HOW TO APPLY

Please include:

1. A brief introduction (something important to you and a future goal)

2. Relevant experience (especially administrative or operations work)

3. Your availability (days and hours)

4. One sentence describing how you stay organized



WHO THIS ROLE IS PERFECT FOR

Someone who:

* Loves structure, systems, and completion

* Enjoys organizing information and managing details

* Is happy working behind the scenes

* Wants a steady, long-term role supporting a creative business

title: SEO Director / SEO Systems Builder (Digital Marketing Agency)
description:
???? Who We’re Looking For



We’re looking for a high-level SEO expert who doesn’t just “do SEO” — but can build and systemize an SEO department from the ground up.



This role is for someone strategic. Someone who understands ranking mechanics, but also understands process, scalability, productization, and client deliverables.



You will help us:



• Build our SEO service structure

• Create SOPs and workflows

• Define deliverables and reporting standards

• Help shape pricing and packaging

• Lead execution once systems are built



This is not a beginner role. We need someone who can architect, not just execute.



???? Responsibilities



• Develop our full SEO service offering (Local, On-Page, Technical, Content, etc.)

• Build step-by-step SOPs for all SEO processes

• Create scalable workflows for team delegation

• Define what clients receive (reports, audits, dashboards, timelines)

• Establish SEO reporting standards and KPI tracking

• Help build fulfillment capacity (future team structure)

• Oversee strategy for client accounts



???? Qualifications



• 5+ years proven SEO experience

• Experience ranking real businesses (show proof/results)

• Experience building SEO systems or departments preferred

• Strong understanding of Local SEO + Technical SEO

• Strong understanding of on-page optimization + content strategy

• Familiar with tools like Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, GSC, GA4

• Strong documentation and process-building ability

• Strategic thinker (not just task executor)



???? Ideal Candidate



• Has worked with agencies before

• Understands recurring SEO retainers

• Thinks in systems, not one-off tasks

• Can communicate strategy clearly

• Wants long-term partnership and growth



???? Our Goal



We are building a scalable digital marketing company.

SEO is a core pillar of our next growth phase.



We want someone who can help us build this properly — not patch it together.

description:
This is a contract remote role for a
 Ads Creative Designer. The
 Ads Creative Designer will be responsible for creating visually appealing and effective designs for
 advertisements. The day-to-day tasks will include developing creative concepts, designing graphics, collaborating with the marketing team to align with branding guidelines, and continuously optimizing ad creatives based on performance data.



Payroll / Compensation

* After Training: $500/month

title: Media Specialist
description:
At Apex Realty Media, we don't just "edit." We engineer property value. Backed by 13 years of property management expertise and 20 years of creative vision, we create immersive experiences that convert viewers into buyers. We are seeking a dedicated Virtual Assistant to serve as our post-production backbone, ensuring every pixel reflects the "Apex" standard of peak quality.



The Role (Position Overview)

As our Virtual Editor, your primary objective is to transform raw assets into high-converting marketing tools. You will be responsible for the final polish that empowers our clients' real-world marketing goals.



Photo Post-Production: Expert HDR blending, color correction, occasional sky replacements on exterior photos, and vertical alignment for residential and commercial property photos.



Video Editing: Cutting cinematic property tours, synching audio, color grading, and adding motion graphics or text overlays.



Quality Control: Ensuring every delivery meets the "Apex" standard—clean, sharp, and results-oriented.



Asset Management: Maintaining an organized cloud-based filing system for rapid retrieval and delivery.



Qualities & Attributes (The Ideal Candidate)

Technical Mastery: Proficient in Adobe Creative Cloud (Lightroom, Photoshop, Premiere Pro/DaVinci Resolve). Ideally 5+ years of experience in video editing.



The "Marketing Eye": An understanding of how to highlight a property’s best features—not just making it "pretty," but making it "sellable" using the assets provided by the photographers.



Detail Oriented: Your work will be the final phase of content creation and quality control before being packaged and delivered to our clients, as such you need to be meticulous with a focus on how small details effect the greater picture.



Reliability: High-speed internet and the ability to meet strict 24-hour turnaround times.



Compensation & Benefits

Rate: $3.00 USD per hour.



Consistency: Steady, recurring volume from an established brand with a 20-year creative legacy.



Professional Growth: Direct mentorship and feedback from a seasoned photographer and property marketing expert.



Flexibility: 100% remote work with a focus on results and deadlines rather than a rigid clock-in system.

title: Lead Generation & Appointment Setter (Associations / Executive Outreach)
description:
Overview

We are a U.S.-based growth and marketing agency that works with professional associations and nonprofits. We help Executive Directors and CEOs increase membership, sponsorship revenue, event performance, and digital engagement. We are hiring a serious lead generation + appointment setting specialist who can identify decision-makers and book qualified sales calls. This is not a basic VA role.



Your Main Responsibilities

You will: Research U.S.-based professional and trade associations. Identify Executive Directors, CEOs, and senior leaders. Build and maintain accurate lead lists. Send personalized outreach 
 + LinkedIn + light calling). Follow up professionally. Book qualified intro calls on our calendar. Track activity and results. Your job = book real conversations with decision-makers.



Required Skills

You must have: Strong spoken and written English. Confident, professional communication style. Experience with lead generation or appointment setting. Ability to write custom outreach (no copy-paste spam). Comfortable speaking with executives. Organized and reliable. Good internet and quiet workspace.

Bonus if you have: CRM experience. LinkedIn Sales Navigator. B2B or nonprofit experience. Cold calling background.



What This Job Is NOT

This is NOT for people who only do data entry, only send templates, are afraid to talk on the phone, need constant supervision, or miss deadlines. If that’s you, please don’t apply.



Pay & Structure

Starting: $4–$7/hour (based on skill). Performance bonuses for booked calls. Raises based on results. Long-term opportunity for top performers. We reward performance, and want you to be successful with us.



Work Schedule

Part-time to start (20–30 hrs/week). Can grow to full-time. Must overlap with U.S. business hours.



How to Apply (Important)

When applying, include: 

(1) A short introduction (no copy-paste). 

(2) Your experience with lead gen / sales. 

(3) A Loom or voice sample (60 sec) introducing yourself. 

(4) Why you are a good fit for this role. Applications without these will not be reviewed.



Why Work With Us

Stable long-term work. Clear expectations. Direct communication. Growth opportunities. No micromanagement. Work with serious clients. We care about quality and results.

title: Land Acquisition Cold Caller/SMS/Acquisition specialist
description:
We are a U.S.-based land investment company focused on acquiring and reselling larger rural acreage lots anywhere in USA. We purchase directly from property owners and resell to end buyers.



This can be a long-term opportunity for the right person.



We are looking for a confident and conversational Cold Caller to contact landowners and identify motivated sellers.



This is NOT a high-pressure sales job.



Your role is to:



Start friendly conversations



Build rapport



Pre-qualify sellers



Collect pricing expectations



Set appointments for the acquisition manager



Assist with SMS follow-ups.



Responsibilities:



Make 100–200 outbound calls per day



Follow provided script but speak naturally



Build rapport with rural landowners



Ask qualifying questions:



Why are you selling?



What price would you consider?



Access? Utilities?



Any back taxes?



Log detailed notes in CRM



Send follow-up SMS messages



Tag and organize leads properly.



Book qualified appointments on calendar.



Compensation



$4–$6 per hour (based on experience) - I'd rather we work on commission after you get better at it and start closing deals so you actually make way more.

Opportunity for Growth

Performance bonuses for signed contracts





Who This Is NOT For:



Script readers who sound robotic



People who get discouraged by rejection



Short-term freelancers



We are looking for someone who wants to grow with a serious real estate business. 



To apply, please answer the following:



What is your experience with real estate cold calling?



What would you say if a seller says:

“I’ve been getting a lot of offers lately.”



How many calls per day are you comfortable making?



Can you work in US time zone?



Please attach a 1–2 minute voice recording introducing yourself.



Subject line of your application:

“LAND DEALS READY”

title: Experienced Cold Caller
description:
Remote | Uncapped Commission | Long-Term Opportunity 

 

We’re a fast-growing, family-run B2B sales agency working with SaaS companies, agencies, and service businesses across the UK, Australia, Europe, and the US. 

 

We’re looking for an experienced B2B cold caller who knows how to hold confident conversations with decision-makers, book qualified sales meetings, and take ownership of their results. 

 

This is not an entry-level role. If you have real B2B cold calling experience and want uncapped earning potential in a supportive, high-performance environment, we want to hear from you. 

 

What You’ll Be Doing: 

- Making high-volume outbound B2B cold calls to founders, directors, and senior decision-makers 

- Booking qualified sales meetings for our clients 

- Following clear call frameworks while adapting naturally in conversation 

- Handling objections calmly and confidently 

- Keeping notes and outcomes updated in our systems 

- Taking responsibility for your own performance and improvement 

 

What We’re Looking For: 

- Proven B2B cold calling experience 

- Strong objection handling and conversation control 

- Excellent spoken English with a clear, professional, natural tone 

- Self-motivated, disciplined, and hungry to earn 

- Comfortable working remotely and managing your own time 

- Coachable mindset and open to feedback 

- Reliable setup. Stable internet, quiet calling environment, headset 

 

What You’ll Get: 

- Uncapped commission structure 

- Consistent dial volume and qualified lead lists 

- Clear scripts, training, and ongoing coaching 

- Long-term role with room to grow as the company scales 

- Supportive, family-run culture where performance is recognised 

- Work with serious B2B clients and real decision-makers 

 

How to Apply: 

Do not send a written cover letter only. 

 

Instead, please submit: 

- Your CV 

- A short voice recording (2–4 minutes) covering: 

       - Who you are 

       - Why you would be great for this role 

       - Your experience in B2B cold calling 

       - The types of decision-makers you’ve spoken to before 

 

Applications without a voice recording will not be reviewed. 

 

If you’re confident on the phone, hungry to earn, and want to be part of a growing business where results matter, we’d love to hear you.

title: Social Media Video Editor / Creative Partner (Long-term)
description:
I’m building a personal brand in tech, startups, and AI.

I film daily raw content.

You turn it into high-performing, polished Reels.



I give creative direction + examples, not step-by-step micromanagement.

You understand the vibe, spot trends, experiment with hooks, and help this thing take off fast.



If you like experimenting, storytelling, and growth — keep reading.



It’s real-life building, documenting, experimenting, sometimes failing, sometimes winning.



The goal:

 • 1 Reel per day minimum

 • Test hooks, formats, storytelling styles

 • 1,000 followers in the first month (otherwise something’s wrong)

 • Serious traction within 2 months



Your role (important part)



You are not just an editor.



You will:

 • Take raw iPhone videos and turn them into polished Reels

 • Add strong hooks, captions, pacing, cuts, text, structure

 • Turn my ideas into formats that actually perform

 • Search for trends we can recreate (not copy blindly)

 • Suggest your own content ideas

 • Help create a storyline & narrative, not random clips

 • Experiment aggressively (different hooks, formats, styles)



At the beginning, there will be some back-and-forth — that’s normal.

The goal is that you slowly take control of the creative execution.



What I care about (read this twice)



? You can understand what I want from examples, not detailed instructions

? You have taste (pacing, text, music, visuals)

? You’re curious about trends and performance

? You’re okay with testing, failing, adjusting

? You want to go all-in, not just “do tasks”

? Strong understanding of Content game and Instagram Reels



I don’t want to explain every edit frame by frame.

I want to say: “This is the vibe” — and you get it.



What I will provide

 • Clear creative direction & references

 • Daily raw footage (I film a lot)

 • Fast feedback

 • Freedom to experiment

 • Long-term collaboration if this works - we are 3 cofounders so there is plenty things to do 



How to apply (important - if you will not send all required your application will not be considered) 

Please include:

 1. Examples of Reels you edited (links)

 2. Your Instagram / TikTok editing experience

 3. Why you think content in tech/startups performs well

 4. One sentence on how you’d help grow an account from 0 to 10k



Please understand CV is not important here, I care about results. :-)



This can grow into a very solid long-term role if you are interested. We are 3 co-founders so there might be plenty of things to make in cooperations of us. :-)

title: High-Volume Recruitment Specialist (Logistics) - $500/month + $30 Commission Per Hire
description:
Job Description

About Oprisa GmbH: We are a rapidly expanding German company managing a massive fleet of couriers for major Food Delivery Platform across Germany (50+ of the biggest cities). We operate in a high-speed environment where headcount equals revenue.



Job Summary: We are seeking relentless "Hunters" for our Logistics Division. You will execute mass and aggressive hiring to fill 50+ driver seats per week. This is NOT a traditional corporate HR role; this is a high-pressure, high-reward numbers game.



Key Responsibilities:



Mass Recruitment: Execute end-to-end recruitment for courier/driver roles across Germany.



Guerilla Sourcing: Post and manage 50+ job advertisements per day on
 Groups, Marketplace, Kleinanzeigen, and other local boards.



Speed to Lead: Conduct fast screening calls (5-10 mins) and push candidates to "Signed Contract" status within 24 hours.



Pipeline Management: Maintain a pipeline of backup drivers to ensure zero vacancy.



Reporting: Track daily output (Ads Posted vs. Leads vs. Hires) and report directly to the Fleet HR Manager.



Required Qualifications:



Experience: Proven experience in Mass Hiring / RPO (Logistics, BPO, High-Volume Retail, or Blue-Collar staffing).



Grit: You are not afraid of rejection and can handle high targets.



Tech Savvy: Expert in navigating
 restrictions, VPNs, and managing multiple job board accounts simultaneously.



Language: Excellent written and spoken English. (German language skills are a huge plus).



???? THE OFFER (High Earning Potential):



Stable Base Salary: Paid on time, every time ($500 - $700 depending on experience - weekly payments).



???? COMMISSION BOOSTER: You receive $30 USD for EVERY driver you hire who completes 300 deliveries.



Example: If you hire 10 good drivers in a week and they hit the target -> That is an EXTRA $300 USD/week for you.



There is NO CAP on commissions. The more quality drivers you find, the more you earn.



Schedule:



Must be willing to work mid-shift / night-shift (Philippine Time) to overlap with German business hours (Afternoon/Evening in Germany).



HOW TO APPLY: Please apply directly through this platform. Note: We use AI to screen applicants. To ensure your application is seen, please include the word "HUNTER" in your subject line or introduction and briefly state how many people you hired in your best month.



Skills Required:

Recruitment

HR Management

English (Speaking & Writing)

German optional, but big plus (Speaking & Writing)

Social Media Marketing 
)

Lead Generation

Telemarketing

title: Video Editor & Image Designer
description:
ABOUT US 

We are a fast-growing DTC skincare eCommerce brand. We are looking for a long-term tea
mber, not a freelancer, who wants to build a stable career with us.



We believe in empowering our team. You will get access (and training!) on premium AI tools like Higgsfield, Gemini, and ChatGPT to make your workflow faster and more creative.



WHO YOU ARE 

We are looking for a "preditor" (Producer/Editor)—someone who understands storytelling, pacing, and marketing, not just button-pushing.



- You possess a "student mindset": You take feedback well, you don't take critiques personally, and you improve quickly. We are looking for someone who wants to learn and grow, not someone who thinks they already know everything.

- You are efficient: You can edit a high-quality 60-second video in 2-3 hours and create a social graphic in 1-2 hours without sacrificing quality.

- You are detail-oriented: You have 0% tolerance for typos in captions and overlays.

- You are tech-savvy: You are excited to use AI to generate ideas and speed up your work.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

- Short-Form Video: Edit engaging Reels, Shorts, and TikToks (15–90 seconds) focused on UGC, products, and trends.

- Long-Form Video: Edit YouTube videos, and VSLs (5+ minutes) with clean pacing and storytelling.

- Engagement: Add animated captions, text callouts, B-roll, and visual hooks to keep retention high.

- Graphic Design: Create static ad creatives, quote cards, thumbnails, and simple motion ads.

- Photo Editing: Retouch, resize, and clean up product/lifestyle images.

- Copywriting: Write and polish short English hooks/headlines for your videos and ads.



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS (Must Have)

- Computer Specs: You must have a PC capable of editing 4K footage and running Adobe Premiere Pro/After Effects without lag or crashing. (Recommended: 16GB+ RAM, SSD Storage).

- Internet Connection: You must have a reliable, high-speed internet connection (Fiber preferred). You will be required to download and upload large batches of raw 4K video files from Google Drive daily.

- Software: Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro (preferred), CapCut, or Final Cut + Canva/Photoshop/Figma or equivalent.



WHY JOIN US? 

- Day Shift Schedule: Enjoy your evenings and weekends! Work normal PH business hours. 

- AI Training: We pay for the tools and teach you how to use them. 

- Stability: We are looking for a partner for the long haul. 

- Portfolio: Build a portfolio with a professional beauty brand.



Schedule & Pay:

- Mon–Fri, 9:00 AM–6:00 PM Philippine time

- $600/month



HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully)

title: Real Estate Media QC and Delivery Admin
description:
PLEASE READ ENTIRE DESCRIPTION TO BE SERIOUSLY CONSIDERED



Company: Evoke Media

Location: Remote

Pay: $6/hour (USD)

Hours: 15–25 hours per week (depending on workload)



Schedule & Availability

Required Core Schedule:

Monday–Saturday (Pacific Time)

6:30 AM – 10:00 AM Pacific Time

You must be online, responsive, and actively working during this window.

This schedule typically falls between 10:30 PM – 2:00 AM Philippines Time.

No shoots occur on Sundays. Sunday Pacific Time is always off.

This is a deadline-sensitive role. All projects must be delivered before 10:00 AM Pacific Time, and reliability during the core schedule is critical.

Some high-volume days may require additional hours beyond 10:00 AM Pacific.

Please confirm you are comfortable working late-night PH hours long-term.



Workload Expectations

Workload varies based on booking volume:

Slow weeks: 15–18 hours

Busy weeks: 20–25 hours

High-volume days may require up to 5–6 hours of work in a single day

You must be comfortable adapting to fluctuating workloads.



About Evoke Media

Evoke Media is a growing real estate media company providing photography, video, drone, 3D tours, floor plans, property websites, and other marketing assets for real estate professionals.

We are known for:

- Next-morning delivery

- Consistent quality control

- Clear client communication

- Organized internal systems



We are hiring a Quality Control & Media Delivery Virtual Assistant to manage final checks, organization, and client delivery of projects.



Role Overview

You will be responsible for quality control, project management, organization, and delivery of real estate media projects using our internal portal, Dropbox, and third-party platforms (Matterport, CubiCasa, property websites, etc.).

This role requires prior QC experience, strong attention to detail, deadline awareness, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Key Responsibilities

- Daily Delivery & Project Management

- Manage multiple client projects under tight deadlines

- Complete yesterday’s orders and prepare them for delivery

- Track project status accurately and move orders through proper stages

- Identify missing or delayed services and escalate appropriately

- Ensure all services are fully synced before delivery

- Quality Control (Photos, Videos & Other Media Assets)

- Quality check all delivered services including photos, videos, drone, twilights, floor plans, 3D tours, property websites, and other media assets, etc.



Verify:

- Correct property address (street, city, state, zip)

- Customer notes and special instructions

- Branding requirements (branded vs unbranded)

- Ensure files are organized, renamed, rearranged, and placed in correct folders



Photo Quality Control

- Review HDR images for:

- Proper blending and masking

- Clean and realistic sky replacements

- Accurate color correction and consistency

- Object removal and dust spot cleanup

- Straight vertical lines and natural window pulls



Video Quality Control

- Watch videos completely and confirm:

- Address graphics are correct

- Branding and end screens are accurate

- Text callouts and subtitles are spelled correctly

- Leave proper QC confirmation notes in the project chat



Platform & File Management

- Download and upload floor plans from CubiCasa

- Manage Matterport tours (Branded & Unlisted as required)

- Sync delivery files and test delivery links before sending

- Mark unfinished services as Escalations when needed

- Communicate clearly with editors and internal team



Client Communication

- Send professional delivery
s

- Notify clients of pending services when needed

- Maintain clear, accurate written communication



Required Skills & Qualifications

- Previous Quality Control (QC) experience is required

- Advanced Lightroom & Photoshop skills including:

- HDR blending and masking

- Sky replacements

- Object removal

- Color correction and color accuracy

- Strong project management skills

- Ability to manage multiple deadlines without supervision

- Excellent written and verbal English communication

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail

- Customer service experience required

- Reliable computer capable of handling Adobe Photoshop & Lightroom

- Stable, fast internet connection



Preferred Qualifications

- Experience with real estate media workflows

- Familiarity with Dropbox delivery systems, Matterport, CubiCasa, or property websites

- Access to a Mac computer



How to Apply

- To be considered, all of the following are required:

- A short video or video link introducing yourself and explaining your interest in this position

- Links to your portfolio showing: HDR blending, interior and exterior real estate photos, object removal work

- Your resume

- Your computer specifications (RAM, processor, OS)

- A screenshot of your internet download and upload speed

- Confirmation that you are available Monday–Saturday, 6:30–10:00 AM Pacific Time

- Include the exact phrase “I love photo editing!” somewhere in your application message



Applications missing any of the above will not be considered.

title: Senior Paraplanner
description:
Company Overview 



BE SmartAdmin Services Pty Ltd (BESAS) is a bespoke Australian start-up company providing administrative, paraplanning, and bookkeeping services to a diverse range of clients, including financial planning, property, mortgage lending, and creative industries. While most of our team is based in the Philippines, our services are fully Australian-focused, and we pride ourselves on delivering tailored, high-quality solutions for each client. 



At BESAS, we value excellence in our work and in our interactions with clients, while also recognising that well-being and work-life balance matter. Our culture encourages innovation, collaboration, and results, and we are looking for someone who can make an impact, demonstrates a can-do attitude, and thrive in a dynamic start-up environment. 



Role Overview 



As a Senior Paraplanner, you will play a pivotal role in our paraplanning team. You will: 



-  Manage SOA/ROA/research/modelling requests from advisers and allocate them to the paraplanning team, while also personally preparing SOA/ROA/research/modelling work. 

-  Review the SOA/ROA/research/modelling prepared by the paraplanning team before submission to the adviser. 

-  Lead, coordinate, and support the paraplanning team to ensure advice documents meet adviser requirements and AFSL compliance standards. 

-  Learn to prepare UK Pension SOAs and confidently review them. 



This is a hands-on role requiring both active production and team guidance, with opportunities to make a tangible impact on our clients and team. 



Key Responsibilities 



Personal SOA Production 



-  Prepare a minimum of 1 SOA per day (approx. 4–5 hours) according to adviser instructions.  

-  Ensure all personal advice documents (SOA/ROA) meet AFSL compliance and adviser-specific preferences. 

-  Master UK Pension SOA preparation to support both production and review responsibilities. 



Paraplanning Team Support 



-  Support paraplanning operations and workflow management. 

-  Liaise directly with advisers (mainly via
) for SOA requests. 

-  Manage adviser expectations with clear updates on timelines, scope, and required information. 

-  Review SOA requests and adviser strategies for completeness, accuracy, and feasibility before assigning tasks. 

-  Coordinate the schedule and workload of part-time paraplanners, ensuring a 3–5 business day SOA turnaround. 

-  Provide guidance and upskilling to paraplanners on correct SOA clauses to include/exclude. 

-  Review and approve SOAs prepared by paraplanners, ensuring adherence to AFSL templates. 

-  Implement revision requests from the AFSL compliance team and provide constructive feedback to improve accuracy, compliance, and adviser satisfaction. 

-  Contribute to team growth through recruitment input, training, and process improvement initiatives. 



Quality Control & Adviser Liaison 



-  Coordinate with advisers and paraplanners for revisions as needed. 

-  Personally make final amendments to meet adviser deadlines. 

-  Be willing to conduct weekend SOA reviews in special cases (e.g., payroll cut-off deadlines) to ensure billing is included in the correct period. 



Who Could Be an Ideal Candidate 



You could be our ideal candidate if you are someone who: 



-  Has a strong background in paraplanning (5+ years) within the Australian financial planning industry. 

-  Can balance multiple advisers or practices while maintaining high accuracy and attention to detail. 

Is proactive, solutions-oriented, and has a can-do attitude. 

-  Thrives in a start-up environment where your contributions directly impact the team and clients. 

-  Values excellence in work and client service while maintaining work-life balance. 

-  Possesses leadership or mentoring experience, capable of guiding part-time paraplanners effectively. 

-  Is keen to learn and grow, including mastering complex advice types such as UK Pensions and LRBA. 

-  Is proficient in Xplan, including SuperSolver/WealthSolver, Risk Researcher, and XTOOLS+ Calm (retirement modelling). Familiarity with other tools (ProductRex, Omnium/OmniLife, RetireMap, Fin365) is a plus. 



Qualifications 



-  Minimum 5 years’ experience as a paraplanner in or for the Australian financial planning industry. 

-  Proven experience managing workflow or supporting multiple paraplanners. 

-  Strong knowledge of superannuation, personal insurance, retirement planning, and investment strategies. 

-  Strong written and verbal English communication skills. 

-  Ability to work autonomously while supporting and developing a small team. 

-  High proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel. 

-  Exceptional attention to detail and ability to interpret technical information. 



Reporting 



This position reports directly to the Operations Manager. 



Home Office Requirements 



-  Power & Internet: Stable power supply and minimum 20 Mbps internet. 

-  Equipment: Computer/laptop with at least 8GB RAM and Microsoft Office installed. 

-  Environment: Quiet home office suitable for client calls and tea
etings. 



Working Hours 



-  Schedule: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Monday to Friday (Philippine Standard Time), including 1-hour unpaid lunch. 

-  Time Tracking: Use Clockify to track all work hours (excluding lunch) with task-level granularity. 

-  Breaks: Short tea breaks up to 15 minutes (max. 2/day) with supervisor notification. 



Compensation & Benefits 



Rates & Salary 



-  PHP 700/hour – Premium billable work (SOA/ROA prep, research, adviser communication). 

-  PHP 300/hour – Base rate for non-billable time (idle periods, tea breaks, etc.). 

-  Monthly salary range: ?107,467 (80% billable) – ?121,333 (100% billable). 

-  Independent contractor arrangement, inclusive of 13th month and government contributions (SSS, PhilHealth, Pag-IBIG). 



Leave & Incentives 



-  6-month probation: Hourly rate may be reviewed based on performance. 

-  1st anniversary: 10 workdays of paid leave annually, prorated in the first year. 

-  Mandatory 10-day Christmas break (dates advised annually). 

-  Performance bonuses are discretionary, based on quality, consistency, and turnaround expectations.

title: B2B Outbound Sales Development Rep - AU Shift
description:
APPLICATION MUST BE SENT HERE: 
/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScRTAWC1h5CUz-6mztT0ImZyhwdGTXZxlq6UUxpZ0U-3Zt99A/viewform?usp=sf_link





Maclean Financial is a well-established and fast-growing equipment finance brokerage based in Mascot, Sydney. We’re proud to be part of the Maclean Financial Services Group, alongside Maclean Accounting and Maclean Insurance, giving us a unique edge in offering integrated financial, lending, and insurance solutions to businesses across Australia. 



At Maclean Financial, we specialise in fast, service-driven finance solutions tailored for small to medium-sized businesses. Known for our personalised support, attention to detail, and efficient turnaround times, we’re a trusted partner to brokers and clients alike. 



We don’t just handle finance, we help businesses grow, and we back our people to do the same. 







About The Role

-Starting Rate: 45k basic + 11k and up monthly incentives

-Permanent WFH: Yes

-Provided Equipment: None, the candidate should have their own laptop/pc, headphones, internet connection etc.

-Contract: Full-time Freelancer/ Independent Contractor

-Work Schedule: Mon to Fri | 6:00 AM to 3:00 PM Manila

-Additional Perks: Paid Holidays, Leave Credits, Incentives





What You Should Have:

-Outstanding verbal and written communication skills: Strong understanding of the Australian market and confidence when speaking with business owners about their needs.

-Business-to-Business Sales: Proven ability to work in a business-to-business sales or lead generation role, with proficiency in cold calling (no warm leads).

-Scripting Compliance: Ability to understand and follow provided scripts, with a willingness to adapt based on previous sales experiences.

-Microsoft Office and CRM Skills: Advanced skills in Microsoft Office; knowledge of CRM systems is a plus. Must be able to speak while typing, accurately enter data into a semi-CRM, and maintain engaging conversations with clients.

-Listening and Objection Handling: Excellent listening skills and the ability to handle objections. A strong understanding of sales fundamentals (B2B) and a willingness to learn proven sales methods.

-Positive Attitude: A can-do attitude and a commitment to exceeding expectations.

-Technical Requirements: The computer (at least 16GM RAM) must be capable of running a dialer program, and you should have a fast and reliable wired internet connection at your primary workstation with speeds of at least 50 MBPS and 10 MBPS upload speed minimum.

-Availability: Must be unencumbered by other commitments and able to commit to full-time hours.



What You'll Do:

-Make outbound calls to cold leads, achieving a minimum of 300 calls per day.

-Maintain the database/CRM and ensure proper system upkeep.

-Generate quotes for clients purchasing assets within a four-month timeline.

-Participate in training programs and skills development initiatives.

-Collaborate directly with the Team Leader and Training Manager to help achieve sales objectives.

-Liaise with both internal and external stakeholders.

-Achieve the key performance indicators (KPIs) as outlined.

-Monitor and manage the deal pipeline, ensuring that daily follow-ups are completed consistently.

-Undertake any additional tasks or projects assigned by your manager that can be performed safely, in accordance with relevant internal policies and external regulatory requirements.

-Attend and actively participate in team and company meetings.

title: Social Media Content Creator (with VA Flexibility)
description:
Social Media Content Creator (with VA Flexibility) – Part-Time, Remote



I am Head of Marketing at an early-stage SaaS startup (www.offerday.ai) and I'm looking for a talented, self-driven Social Media Content Creator to help us build our presence on LinkedIn, Instagram, and possibly TikTok — and support outreach efforts to build referral partnerships with SBA organizations.



This is a part-time, fully remote role with flexible hours — we're async-friendly and focused on output, not clock-watching.



What you'll primarily do:



Content Creation (LinkedIn, Instagram / TikTok)

- Create engaging social media content for LinkedIn, Instagram / TikTok (posts, carousels, captions)

- Help maintain a consistent posting schedule and brand voice

- Repurpose existing content (blog posts, ideas, talking points) into social-ready formats

- Create and maintain a 2-week rolling content calendar



Partnership Outreach

- Research and identify relevant SBA organizations and small business referral partners

- Draft and send personalized outreach
s on our behalf

- Track responses, follow up, and maintain a simple outreach log



Occasionally, you'll also help with:

-
 management and inbox hygiene

- Simple outreach messages

- Light research / admin / assistant tasks as needed



You're a great fit if you:

- Have 2+ years of experience creating social content, ideally for a B2B or tech brand

- Write clean, confident English and can adapt to a brand voice quickly

- Are comfortable with professional outreach and basic research

- Are proactive and don't need heavy hand-holding — you ask smart questions and figure things out

- Are comfortable working async and delivering without constant check-ins

- Have a portfolio or examples of past social content you can share



Details:

- Part-time: approximately 15 hours/week to start, with room to grow

- Flexible hours — work when it suits you, deliver on agreed timelines

- Long-term relationship preferred



To apply, please send your CV, a link to your portfolio or content samples, and 2-3 sentences on why you'd be a good fit. 



Bonus points if you include a sample LinkedIn post for www.offerday.ai with messaging and an image targeting small business clients (that's our main focus right now, not enterprises). Here's a format suggestion that's on brand: 



(Note: The ads in the Canva project above are targeting enterprises, not small businesses. Our value proposition is different for small businesses. If you can make these ads look better and less basic, I will be impressed!)

 Ads Manager

• Understand basic scaling (budget increases, duplication, structure)

?? This is not for beginners. You must already know your way around Ads Manager.

This role can grow into a bigger position if performance is good.



How to Apply



To make sure you read everything, start your application with this keyword:



"FBISKING"

How many years of experience do you have with

As an SDR, you will be the first point of contact for prospective customers. Your primary responsibility will be to identify, engage, and qualify potential leads to build a strong sales pipeline for our account executives. This is a great opportunity for someone who is ambitious, coachable, and excited to kickstart or grow their career in sales.



Responsibilities:

* Research and identify potential clients and key decision-makers

* Conduct outbound outreach via phone,
, and social channels

* Qualify inbound and outbound leads based on business needs

* Clearly communicate the value of our product/service

* Schedule meetings and product demos for the sales team

* Collaborate closely with marketing and sales teams to optimize lead generation strategies

description:
Video Editor for Toddler Content



We’re looking for a creative video editor to work on 10-minute toddler videos (ages 1–4). Creativity is crucial. You’ll handle pacing cuts, captions, pop-ups, simple animations, sound effects, and basic colour/audio balancing to maximise engagement while maintaining original file quality throughout editing and transfer.



Work begins at two projects per month, with the option for more as the relationship grows. Turnaround time is one week per video start to finish.

 • Proficient in DaVinci Resolve or Adobe Premiere Pro or similar high end video editing software

Applications without long-form portfolio samples will not be considered.



As part of your application, briefly explain your editing workflow, including how you manage exports, compression, and file transfers to preserve quality, plus any plugins, templates, or tools you use to improve efficiency or engagement (e.g. captions, animations, sound cleanup)

title: DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER / MARKETING AUTOMATION SPECIALIST
description:
DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER / MARKETING AUTOMATION SPECIALIST



(Insurance Agency | Full-Time | Philippines-Based)



About the Company

We are a growing U.S.-based insurance brokerage expanding rapidly in personal and commercial insurance.



We are building long-term systems, not short-term fixes, and we are looking for one dedicated marketing professional, not a general VA.



This is a full-time, long-term position for someone who wants stability, growth, and ownership.



IMPORTANT, PLEASE READ BEFORE APPLYING

This is NOT:



• A social media posting role

• A beginner marketing job

• A task-only VA position This IS:

• A performance marketing role

• A lead generation & automation position

• A job for someone who understands funnels, data, and ROI



If you are comfortable owning results and improving systems, continue reading.



Your Mission

Your role is to design, build, and optimize a complete digital marketing funnel that consistently generates qualified insurance leads and converts them into booked appointments.



You are responsible for results, not just execution.



Traffic ? Leads ? Appointments ? Policies Written

 

Compensation & Long-Term Growth

• Salary based on proven experience

• Stable, long-term employment

• Internal promotions as the company grows

• Performance bonuses after 90 days tied to:

o Appointment volume

o Lead quality

o Cost-per-lead improvement

Core Responsibilities (Keyword Optimized)

Lead Generation & Paid Advertising

•
 / Meta Ads Manager (lead generation campaigns)

• Google Ads (Search & Local Service Ads)

• Retargeting campaigns

• Cost-per-lead optimization

• Ad creative testing



Marketing Automation & CRM

• Build and manage automations

• Lead scoring and tagging

• Automated follow-ups

• Appointment booking workflows

• CRM pipeline management







Funnels, Landing Pages & Conversion Optimization

• Funnel creation

• Landing page design

• Form optimization

• Google Tag Manager

• Tracking pixels and attribution

• Heatmap analysis (Hotjar or similar)



Analytics & Reporting

• Weekly performance reporting

• Cost-per-lead tracking

• Campaign profitability analysis

• Funnel performance reviews

 

• Strategic recommendations



SEO & Local Presence

• Google Business Profile optimization

• Review generation workflows

• Local SEO improvements



Ideal Candidate Profile

You should have hands-on experience in most (not all) of the following areas:



•
 Ads Manager (lead generation)

• Google Ads (Search campaigns)

• Marketing funnels & landing pages

• Marketing automation workflows

• Conversion tracking & analytics

• Performance reporting



Insurance experience is a strong advantage but not required.



If you do not meet every requirement but are confident you can perform at a high level, you are encouraged to apply.







Tools You Should Already Know

(You don’t need experience with every tool listed, but you should be able to work independently

in most of them.)



• Meta Ads Manager

• Google Ads

• GoHighLevel / HubSpot / ActiveCampaign / AgencyZoom

• Zapier or Make

• Google Tag Manager

• ClickFunnels / Webflow / WordPress

• Canva or basic creative tools







What Success Looks Like in the First 90 Days

• Automation pipeline fully built and running

 

• Consistent inbound lead flow

• Reduced cost per lead

• Appointment booking system operating with minimal manual work



HOW TO APPLY (MANDATORY — PLEASE FOLLOW EXACTLY)

Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed. Please submit:

1. A short introduction video

2. Platforms you are strongest in

3. Screenshots of campaigns you personally managed

4. Typical cost-per-lead results you’ve achieved

5. Type PIPELINE at the top of your application



Final Notes

• This is a full-time, long-term role

• We are not hiring freelancers managing multiple clients

• We value ownership, initiative, and improvement



If you are a builder, optimizer, and problem-solver who is confident offering ideas and improvements, we encourage you to apply.



We hire quickly.

title: CS agent
description:
Dear applicant,



We run a dropshipping business with multiple stores in different countries.



We are looking for long-term employees to join our team. There is a great deal of growth opportunity for those that consistently make a positive contribution to our company. We are seeking great candidates that will represent the company with great customer service and dedication.



Therefore, please apply the word strawberry before you introduce yourself. Read on to find out what tasks we expect you to perform, as well as the experience we feel is necessary for this job.



This is a Customer Support job where you would have to follow a very clear process to keep our customers happy, but which will become very simple when you understand every step.



MUST HAVE KNOWLEDGE OF THESE PLATFORMS:



Shopify (eCommerce platform)



Slack (communication channel)



ChatGPT (for prompts + translations)



DeepL (for translation)



PayPal (for managing disputes)



Responsibilities:



Handling customer complaints



Reporting on refunds and complaints



Responding to customer
s regarding refunds, tracking numbers, and FAQs



Contributing to our documentation and improving our support processes



Responding to all customer inquiries in a timely, polite, and accurate manner



Skilled in reporting in Google Sheets



Skilled in generating weekly reports per store



Demonstrating a high level of professionalism at all times



We maintain an ETA of 24 hours, therefore all customer
s must be replied to within this timeframe.



We will provide you with:



Video training



SOPs to follow



 templates



Worksheets



Access to the team lead to answer all your questions



Applicant needs to:



Speak fluent English, both written and verbal



Have a minimum of 2 years of experience in eCommerce Customer Support



Be available for and open to team calls



Be organized, motivated, and willing to learn and grow



Be available to join immediately



Be available during night shifts between 7:00 PM and 7:00 AM (Philippine Time)



This is a 12-hour availability window; the actual working shift is not 12 hours. Working hours (8 hours per shift) will be scheduled within this time frame



Be available 7 days per week (rotating schedule may apply) — this availability is mandatory



Be available for a minimum of 40 hours per week once starting full-time



We will start with a two-week trial period, after which the position will transition from part-time to full-time.

This means that ideally, you are not currently working another full-time job.



Ideally, you'll have some experience with customer support, but ultimately we want to work with someone who loves helping people and is interested in handling customer support issues. We do not want any inconsistency in the
s exchanged with customers.



Examples of inconsistency include:



Sending the same
 twice



Imprecise answers



Off-topic replies

title: YouTube Thumbnail Designer (Viral Style)
description:
A Note Before You Apply:



This is your first test. We do not consider generic, copy-and-pasted applications. If you don’t follow the instructions below precisely, your application will be archived. We’re looking for tea
mbers who are detail-oriented and committed, and that starts here.



You can find our founder on Instagram 
 to learn more about who you’d be working with.





TYPE OF WORK: Project-Based



WAGE / SALARY: Highly Competitive



VOLUME: 12+ Thumbnails Per Month



JOB OVERVIEW



We are looking for a creative and skilled YouTube Thumbnail Designer who specializes in creating high-energy, "viral style" thumbnails. The ideal candidate has a strong portfolio of eye-catching designs that drive clicks and a deep understanding of what makes a thumbnail successful on YouTube.



You will be responsible for designing thumbnails that are not only visually appealing but also strategically crafted to capture attention and communicate the video's value. We need a designer who can work quickly, meet a 48-hour turnaround time, and consistently produce high-quality work for a minimum of 12 videos per month.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



•

Design high-impact, "viral style" YouTube thumbnails that increase click-through rates.



•

Develop creative concepts and compelling text for thumbnails, sometimes using only an audio file for context.



•

Ensure all thumbnails align with our brand's visual identity and high standards.



•

Meet a 48-hour turnaround time for each thumbnail design.



•

Collaborate with our content team to ensure thumbnails accurately represent the video content.



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS



To apply, you must follow the instructions below precisely. Failure to follow these instructions will result in immediate disqualification.



1.

Send an
 to 

Use the subject line: Viral Thumbnail Editor



3.

Inside the
, copy and paste the questions below, providing your answer after each one:



A. Please provide a link to your portfolio, specifically showcasing your best YouTube thumbnail designs.



B. What is your price per thumbnail?



C. What is your desired hourly rate?



D. Are you able to listen to an audio file of a YouTube video and come up with the thumbnail text and concept yourself? Please describe your process for this.



E. What is your typical turnaround time for a single thumbnail design?



F. Are you comfortable working in a Christian-based environment?

title: Operations Coordinator (Remote Dispatch)
description:
Key Responsibilities

1. Fleet & Retail Ops Coordination

*Take retail calls

*Own the estimate-to-approval-to-route workflow:

**Create and submit estimates

**Follow up for approval

**Ensure parts are sourced

**Finalize tech routes for the following day

*Track all jobs in progress and flag issues proactively

*Ensure routes are realistic and efficient; confirm techs are prepped and ready

*Communicate clearly with customers and fleet managers about job timing, status, and follow-ups

*Submit and close out fleet approvals in Element, LeasePlan, and AutoIntegrate

*Ensure invoices match approvals; follow up on outstanding invoices and missing payments



2. Scheduling & Productivity Tracking

*Maintain the daily technician schedule, making updates as needed

*Monitor tech productivity; flag idle time, reschedules, or delays

*Track time logs and coordinate with bookkeeper for payroll



3. Customer Communication

*Respond to incoming calls, texts, WhatsApp messages, and system inquiries in a timely, professional manner

*Follow up with clients as needed to resolve open issues or gather job-related info

*Escalate concerns appropriately and promptly



4. Admin & Reporting

*Submit a detailed Daily Recap covering completed work, pending tasks, blockers, and KPIs

*Keep Trello and other tools up-to-date with accurate job and task statuses

*Track inventory needs and coordinate ordering of parts, oil, and supplies

*Monitor A/R and follow up on past-due fleet invoices



5. Marketing & Content Support

*Publish our monthly newsletter in MailChimp with content from marketing team

*Coordinate publishing of content to Instagram /
 / Google My Business

*Other light admin support as needed for the marketing team



What Success Looks Like

*All work orders, estimates, approvals, and tech routes are handled with zero dropped balls

*You identify blockers or problems before they become fires

*Communication is clear, timely, and professional — with both customers and internal team

*The business runs like a machine — nothing gets missed or delayed

*You take full ownership of your responsibilities and require very little follow-up



Who You Are

*A natural systems thinker who thrives on clarity, organization, and ownership

*Extremely proactive — you don’t wait to be told what to do

*Excellent at written and verbal English communication

*Comfortable in the automotive world and eager to learn the details

*Sharp and reliable — you retain info, spot gaps, and follow through



Experience & Skills Required

*3+ years of experience in a remote automotive: coordinator, dispatcher, operations role

*Demonstrated responsibility for keeping things moving without handholding

*Excellent written and spoken English

*Experience with dispatch, route planning, or technician scheduling

*Familiar with tools like Slack, Google Docs, Trello (or similar), CRM/invoicing platforms

*Experience working with U.S.-based field service, auto, or fleet companies

*Bonus: Familiarity with AutoIntegrate, Housecall Pro, Element, or LeasePlan platforms



Required Software Experience

*Slack

*WhatsApp

*Trello (or similar)

*Google Workspace

*CRM / invoicing tools (Housecall Pro, AutoIntegrate)

*
 (plus)



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

*Dual monitor setup is required to ensure efficiency in managing multiple applications simultaneously.



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Schedule: Full-time, US hours Monday to Friday (9:30 AM – 6:30 PM EST) / Tuesday to Saturday 10:30PM to 7:30 AM PHT

Pay: Php50K-75K monthly; we pay 13th month



We are offering bonuses for full-time members:

*Internet

*Generator

*Paid time off

*13th month pay

*HMO



Application Instructions:

Fill out this form: 
/appqNAvkEQ10YFlc3/pagrX4PvZe0xsKHWT/form

After submitting the form, click the apply button and send us a short message on why you would be a good fit for the role.

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Google PPC Ads Guru
description:
We are a translation company looking for a highly experienced candidate with deep and vast experience planning, setting up, running, optimizing, and scaling Google PPC ad campaigns across the USA to help advertise our translation and interpretation services online.

We care about lead quality and intent (not just clicks or impressions), and thoughtful budget allocation that prioritizes commercially meaningful searches.

The ideal candidate should have many years of experience working on all aspects of Google PPC ads, strong analytical skills and understands search intent, buyer readiness, and lead quality.

Responsibilities:

- Plan, build, and manage Google Ads campaigns across different stages of demand (BOFU, MOFU, and TOF)

- Monitor, track and analyze performance and continuously optimize bids, budget, keywords, ads, and landing page alignment

Requirements:

- Several years of hands-on experience managing high-conversion ads campaigns

- Super responsive and available to help fix urgent issues, including if occasionally needed on evenings and weekends

- Ability to explain strategy, performance, and ads recommendations

- Strong written and spoken English skills

- Previous experience doing PPC ads for translation companies would be great

Please be prepared to showcase work history and references during the application process. This can be a full-time, part-time, or freelance role.
