title: U.S. Mortgage Loan Officer Assistant (Remote - Night Shift)
description:
Join Our Team as a Remote Loan Officer Assistant



Are you organized, detail-oriented, and eager to grow your career in the mortgage industry? We’re looking for a proactive Loan Officer Assistant to join our remote team and support a high-volume loan office with day-to-day operations. This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has a solid understanding of the mortgage process.



Key Responsibilities:

• Communicate professionally with clients via phone and

• Gather and collect all required documentation from clients, including income, asset, and credit documents

• Review and organize loan files to ensure completeness and compliance

• Accurately calculate borrower income and run various loan scenarios

• Run loan approvals through AUS systems (DU/LP)

• Maintain and update CRM systems with client information and status updates

• Follow up with clients, third parties, and tea
mbers to keep files moving

• Support the Loan Officer with administrative tasks and ensure smooth file flow from application to closing



Requirements:

• Excellent written and spoken English communication skills (C1 or above)

• Availability to work during U.S. business hours (night shift)

• A stable work-from-home setup, including high-speed internet, a reliable computer, and a quiet work environment

• Strong attention to detail, time management, and organizational skills

• Ability to calculate income accurately and assess loan scenarios based on guidelines

• Familiarity with loan origination software and CRM tools

• Minimum 1 year U.S. LOA experience

• Experience using AUS systems like DU and LP





Compensation:

• Base salary: $1,000 - $1,300/month (based on experience)

• Opportunities for performance-based bonuses



If you're dependable, self-motivated, and ready to contribute to a dynamic mortgage team, we want to hear from you!



To Apply:



Please apply via online jobs with your resume, provide the best number to reach you via WhatsApp and complete the following questionnaire: 
/to/bqPhjX8d



*Applicants must have a minimum of 1 year of experience in the mortgage industry. Applications that do not meet this requirement will not be considered. Please ensure you follow the application instructions carefully.

title: Client Relations / Customer Service Support (Remote - Night Shift)
description:
We specialize in providing tailored mortgage services to homebuyers and real estate professionals. Our goal is to build strong partnerships within the real estate industry to help clients secure the best mortgage options available. We are seeking a dedicated, personable, and results-driven Dialer to reach out to prospective clients and real estate agents, establish relationships, and promote our mortgage services.



Key Responsibilities:

• Client Outreach: Make outbound calls to prospective real estate agents and clients to introduce our mortgage services.

• Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong, positive relationships with real estate agents, brokers, and clients.

• Service Promotion: Communicate the benefits of our mortgage services clearly and effectively to potential partners and clients.

• Lead Generation: Identify and qualify new leads from incoming inquiries or research and cold outreach.

• Application Intake: Take initial client applications and gather required information to prepare clients for the loan officer.

• Follow-Up: Track all interactions and schedule follow-up calls to ensure continued engagement with leads.

• Reporting: Maintain accurate records of calls, outcomes, and progress toward relationship-building goals.

• Team Collaboration: Work closely with the sales and loan officer teams to ensure smooth transitions and effective communication with clients.

________________________________________

Qualifications:

• Experience: Prior experience in telemarketing, customer service, or sales is a plus. Real estate or mortgage industry experience is highly desirable, but not required.

• Communication Skills: Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to build rapport quickly.

• Attention to Detail: Ability to accurately capture client information and ensure smooth transition to loan officers.

• Self-Motivated: Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and stay organized in a remote setting.

• Goal-Oriented: Strong drive to achieve goals and contribute to the growth of the company.

• Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using CRM systems and other communication tools.

• Professionalism: Must be highly professional, reliable, and able to work in a fast-paced environment.

• C1 English Proficiency: Must have C1 level English proficiency (Advanced) or higher. This includes the ability to understand and produce detailed, complex communication in both spoken and written English.



________________________________________

What We Offer:

• Competitive base salary + performance-based commissions/bonuses.

• Flexible work hours and the ability to work remotely.

• Comprehensive training and ongoing support.

• Opportunity to grow within a dynamic and growing company.

• A collaborative and positive work culture.



To Apply:



Please reply to the posting on online jobs with your resume, provide the best number to reach you via WhatsApp and complete the following questionnaire: 
/to/tZyKGM5o



*Applicants must have a minimum of 1 year customer service experience. Applications that do not meet this requirement will not be considered. Please ensure you follow the application instructions carefully.

title: Shopify Web Developer - Remote, Part Time
description:
We are seeking a skilled and analytical Shopify Developer to manage, enhance, and optimize our Shopify eCommerce store. This role will be pivotal in ensuring the technical health of our Shopify storefront while also assuring the tracking analytics between platforms is properly maintained and enhanced.



Ideal candidates are both technically savvy and data-driven, with experience in eCommerce, Shopify development, and performance analytics.



Requirements:

-Design, develop, and maintain the company’s Shopify website using Liquid, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

-Set up and manage analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, GA4, Meta Pixel, TikTok Pixel, etc.).

-Knowledge of Google Tag Manager and connection between tracking tools is an essential.

-Build, customize, and optimize Shopify themes and third-party app integrations.

-Maintain and troubleshoot the Shopify store to ensure site stability and performance.

-Improve and optimize page speed, checkout flows, mobile responsiveness, and user experience (UI/UX).

-Monitor, analyze, and report on key performance metrics (conversion rate, bounce rate, AOV, customer journey, etc.).

-Collaborate with marketing teams on A/B testing for product pages, landing pages, and campaigns.

-Assist in setting up tracking for affiliate and influencer marketing efforts.

-Implement CRO (conversion rate optimization) best practices based on real-time data and testing.



Qualifications:

-3+ years of experience in Shopify development, theme customization, and app integrations.

-Proven track record of optimizing eCommerce websites for conversion and performance.

-Proven track record of optimizing analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, GA4, Meta Pixel, TikTok Pixel, etc.).

-Proficient in Shopify Liquid.

-Strong knowledge of analytics platforms (GA4, Google Tag Manager, Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads Manager).

-Experience with A/B testing and CRO strategies.

-Strong attention to detail, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

-Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced eCommerce environment.

-Excellent communication and teamwork skills.



Know more about us!

Ennovation Brands is dedicated to creating innovative, high-quality beauty and wellness products. We are passionate about connecting with our audience and delivering exceptional value through our content, products, and services.



Visit our websites:


/


/



To move forward, please answer the following questions:

*Job Preferences

Are you comfortable working on graveyard shift?

What is your current salary?

What is your expected salary (in USD, per hour)?

Are you open to working with a time tracker?

Are you able to provide a contact from your previous employer for character reference?

Are you available to start immediately?



*Shopify Developer Experience

Years of experience as a Shopify Developer:

Years of experience in Shopify Liquid:

Years of experience in Google Tag Manager:

Years of experience monitoring, analyzing, and reporting Shopify analytics (e.g., conversion rate, bounce rate, AOV, customer journey)?

What is the biggest Shopify Account that you have handled (write down the monthly revenue in USD)

Share an example where a small CRO change made a significant impact?

Have you worked before with US clients?:



Additionally, please share a link to your CV and portfolio ensure it is accessible.



Due to the high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your time and interest!



Thanks!

Kim A.

title: [POOLING] Head of Ecommerce (Conversion Rate Optimization focused) – Full-Time, Remote
description:
[We are currently pooling applicants to fill several upcoming job orders]

Location: Remote (Philippines candidates only)



Type: Full-time







About Cyber Tools



Cyber Tools is on a mission to revolutionize the world of tools — blending innovation, performance, and storytelling to build one of the biggest power tool brands in the world.



We’re not just selling products — we’re building a movement. We're looking for a Head of CRO who can turn traffic into conversions and browsers into believers.



Our mission? To create the Biggest Tools Company, Biggest Tv Show and the Biggest Castle in the world by blending great products, storytelling, and direct-response marketing.







What You’ll Do



As the Head of CRO, you’ll lead strategy and execution for optimizing conversion across all of our customer touchpoints — landing pages, advertorials, checkout flows, and
 funnels.



You’ll combine creative copywriting with analytical experimentation to identify what truly drives results.



You will:



Own the end-to-end CRO roadmap for Cyber Tools’ DTC funnels and eCommerce sites.

Create, test, and iterate on landing page copy, layouts, and hooks that increase CVR and AOV.

Design and run A/B and multivariate tests using tools like Convert.

Analyze funnel performance and user behavior to find conversion leaks and opportunities.

Collaborate closely with designers, media buyers, and content teams to bring high-impact experiments to life.

Develop hypotheses based on consumer psychology and direct-response marketing principles.

Optimize messaging hierarchy, product storytelling, and visual elements to maximize clarity and desire.

Build dashboards and reporting for continuous learning and scaling what works.





What You Bring



3+ years experience in CRO or eCommerce growth, ideally for DTC or Amazon brands.

Proven success running data-driven A/B tests that moved key metrics.

Strong copywriting chops — you know how to sell with words, not just test buttons.

Deep understanding of consumer psychology and direct-response marketing.

Proficiency with analytics and testing tools (GA4, Mircosoft Clarity or Hotjar, etc.).

Comfort working in a fast-paced, experimental environment.

A growth mindset — analytical, creative, and relentless about results.





Why Join Cyber Tools?



Be part of a brand with a bold creative vision and global reach.

Work remotely with a world-class team driven by innovation and performance.

Have direct impact — your insights shape product launches, ads, and customer experience.

Competitive compensation + growth opportunities.





How to Apply

Send your resume + a short loom video with

-Share a test or campaign you ran that significantly boosted conversions

-Do a super fast review of 
 and let me know what you want to test first.



*Job Preferences:

Are you comfortable working on graveyard shift, 40hrs/wk?

Are you open to working with a time tracker?

title: Amazon Dispatcher
description:
Key Responsibilities



Live Dispatch (On-Road Support)

*Monitor active Cycle 1 routes in real time starting at 11:00 AM

*Support drivers with access issues, delivery problems, and route questions

*Coordinate rescues, sweeps, and route adjustments (in the coordination room with other dispatch)

*Track late routes and proactively mitigate delays



Driver Communication

*Communicate clearly and professionally with drivers via calls, texts, and chat

*Reinforce Amazon safety policies and DSP SOPs

*De-escalate issues and maintain calm, solutions-focused communication



Metrics & Performance

*Monitor and protect key Amazon DSP metrics, including:

*On-Time Delivery (OTD)

*Returns

*DCR / DNR

*Safety and compliance flags

*Identify trends that may impact performance and alert leadership

*Monitor how drivers are marking packages ( reach out to the drivers that are marking incorrectly such as household member , out of drive time )



Documentation & Reporting

*Document driver issues, i
, and returns accurately

*Provide end-of-shift dispatch summaries to management



Required Qualifications:

*Prior Amazon DSP/FEDEX/UPS or similar dispatch experience preferred

*Comfortable working midday to evening hours

*Strong multitasking and decision-making skills

*Excellent written and verbal communication

*Reliable internet and dedicated workspace



Preferred Experience:

*Amazon Flex

*Chime

*Support Central

*Rescue and sweep coordination

*Familiarity with Cycle 1 delivery flow



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

*Dual monitor setup is required to ensure efficiency in managing multiple applications simultaneously.

*Location: Remote (Philippines)

*Schedule: Tuesday - Saturday 12PM - 8PM EST // Wednesday - Saturday 1AM - 9AM PHT



Pay: Php 50K-65K monthly; we pay 13th month



We are offering bonuses for full-time members:

*Internet

*Generator

*Paid time off

*13th month pay

*HMO



Application Instructions:

Fill out this form: 
/appqNAvkEQ10YFlc3/pagHcLQwTxwDq1yRh/form

After submitting the form, click the apply button and send us a short message on why you would be a good fit for the role.

title: GHL Specialist & Systems Architect – AEST Hours
description:
We are looking for a specialist to help build the "Revenue Infrastructure" for Kinetic Marketing Co.



We are looking for an operations specialist who lives and breathes workflows and systems, by building it on GoHighLevel and other CMS platforms such as WordPress, Webflow or Shopify. You will be the technical backbone of our agency, ensuring our clients and our own internal operations run like a Swiss watch.



Your Core Responsibilities:

-GHL Mastery: Developing master templates, converting Figma designs to GHL, and managing complex workflows (AI SMS, Nurture, etc.).

-Systems Architecture (ClickUp): Setting up and optimizing ClickUp to ensure our project management is automated and scalable.

- Lead Management: Professional outreach and engagement on LinkedIn and Instagram. You will hunt for leads and manage them within our CRM. When you notice a qualified lead, you refer another tea
mber to take over

- Ops Hygiene: Ensuring the bridge between GHL (Sales) and ClickUp (Fulfilment) is seamless.



Requirements:



-Availability: Must be able to adhere to Australian Business Hours (AEST).

-Software: Deep GHL expertise is non-negotiable. Experience with ClickUp/Asana automations is highly valued.

-Transparency: We use Hubstaff/Time Doctor for time tracking and transparency.



How to Apply:

-Use Subject: "KMC GHL Specialist Application - [Your Name]"

- Link to a GHL Landing Page you’ve built.



Tell me: How would you automate the transition from a "Won" lead in GHL to a "New Project" in ClickUp?

title: Video & Social Content Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
Make Kinetic Marketing Co the Authority in Melbourne Digital Marketing.



We need a creative editor who understands the "Science of Attention." You will take raw Founder-to-camera footage and turn it into a high-authority content machine that builds trust and generates leads.



Your Core Responsibilities:



- Help editing our long-form videos to be ready to be uploaded onto YouTube

- The "Clip" Engine: Editing 5-15 minute YouTube videos and clipping them into high-energy Reels, TikToks, and Shorts.

- Premium Editing: Alex Hormozi / Sabri Suby / Iman Gadzhi style (dynamic captions, fast pacing, relevant B-roll, and sound design).

- Social Distribution: Scheduling content across all KMC social channels (IG, FB, LinkedIn, YouTube) using the GHL Social Planner.



Requirements:



Software: Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, or After Effects.

Style: You must understand how to edit for B2B authority, not just "viral" fluff.

Transparency: We use Hubstaff/Time Doctor for time tracking.



How to Apply:



Use Subject: "KMC Video Editor Application - [Your Name]"

Send 2 links: One Long-form YouTube video and one High-energy Reel/Short you have edited.

Tell me: What is the most important part of the first 3 seconds of a B2B Meta Ad?

title: Customer Support & Order Resolution Specialist
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Customer Support & Order Resolution Specialist to manage and resolve customer inquiries related to online orders from major U.S. and European retailers. In this role,  it is not a standard customer service role, where you receive inquires and speak directly to the customer, rather it is about customers who are facing problems with their online orders from globally recognized brands such as Amazon, Apple, Samsung, and other leading e-commerce platforms.



You will act on behalf of the customer, communicating directly with merchants (for example: You will be contacting via live chat or phone call to various online stores, where the customer has placed an order from, and is experiencing a problem with it) and to investigate issues, resolve order concerns, and ensure successful outcomes. This position is ideal for individuals who are familiar with online retail stores, have experience with customer service, detail-oriented, efficient, and capable of handling multiple cases simultaneously.



Key Responsibilities:



- Handle customer issues related to online orders, including delivery problems, refunds, replacements, and order discrepancies



- Communicate directly with merchants and retailers via English phone calls and online chat systems



- Manage and resolve multiple cases concurrently while maintaining accuracy and professionalism



- Document case progress and resolutions clearly and consistently



- Work independently while meeting daily case-resolution targets



- Ensure high-quality outcomes and customer satisfaction on every case



- Work Structure & Flexibility



Each day, you will be assigned a set number of cases to resolve



With flexible working hours, If all assigned cases are completed before the end of your shift, you may take the remainder of the day off while still receiving full pay



Over time, you will develop efficiency strategies that allow you to complete work faster without sacrificing quality, to be able to work less hours but get paid by full time hours





**Work Schedule**



Mandatory Start Time (Flexible): 2:00 PM (14:00) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)



End Time: Flexible, depending on workload and efficiency



Full-time availability is required



**Requirements:**



- Fluent English communication skills



- Ability to conduct professional phone calls / chats in English (Use of AI is permitted during chat/calls, to ease workflow)



- Proven ability to multitask and manage multiple cases simultaneously, to save time and complete your work day faster, while receiving pay as for the full day



- Prior work experience in customer support, call centers, order management, or a related field



- Stable and reliable internet connection



- Full-time commitment only (no part-time availability)



- Salary is paid in cryptocurrency, if you are not yet familiar with cryptocurrency, it is fast, instant transfer and super simple to setup. No more waiting times for funds to unfreeze, become available or to transfer. Guidance will be provided how to setup. 



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Customer Service Rep for Health Clinic
description:
Join Australia’s leading telehealth clinic as our next Customer Service & Patient Experience Coordinator.



We’re looking for a warm, articulate professional who loves helping people and delivering exceptional service.

This full-time work-from-home, day-shift role is perfect for experienced customer support specialists with excellent English and a caring nature.



About the Role



Answer inbound calls and make outbound follow-ups with care, empathy, and professionalism

Respond to
s and messages from patients, guiding them through next steps

Manage appointments, confirmations, and reschedules using our CRM and scheduling platforms (Acuity, Pipedrive, Keap)

Run our Quality Control (QC) and retention processes to ensure records are accurate and complete

Support with credit control and follow-ups on outstanding payments in a kind, professional manner

Handle feedback and complaints with patience, empathy, and problem-solving focus

Coordinate with the clinical and support teams to ensure seamless patient care

Help maintain our training and SOP documentation for consistency and quality

Call patients to make sure they have all they needed and encourage them to continue to use our products and services



You’ll Love This Role If You…



Have a warm, confident phone manner and a genuine love for helping others

Can stay calm, professional, and kind — even with challenging patients

Take pride in delivering excellent customer service

Are highly organised, detail-oriented, and process-driven

Speak and write fluent English with a neutral or light accent (near-native fluency — C2 level)

Have experience working in customer support, healthcare, or wellness environments

Enjoy learning new systems and improving processes



Requirements



5+ years of experience in Customer Support / Patient Care / Call Centre / Admin

Excellent spoken and written English

Experience managing phone +
 communications

Tech-confident — CRM or scheduling tools (Salesforce, Keap, Pipedrive, Acuity, Zendesk, etc.)

Quiet home office setup with reliable high-speed internet (essential)



Nice-to-Have



Experience in healthcare, wellness, or telehealth

Background in admin, quality control, or credit management

Experience supporting Australian or UK customers



What’s in It for You



Work-from-home stability with a respected Australian health brand

Warm, supportive team that values integrity and kindness

Structured onboarding and ongoing training

Real career growth — potential to progress into Operations or Team Lead roles

The chance to make a genuine difference in people’s lives every day



How to Apply



Apply via OnlineJobs.ph



Include “Patient Experience – TLRC” in your subject line

Record a 1-minute video introduction (Loom or MP4) telling us:

Who you are and your background

What you love about helping people

A time you turned a difficult customer into a happy one

Attach your CV and speed test result (
)

description:
Looking for a full-time OA sourcer with experience prior experience - not willing to train someone from the ground.



Commission would be a percentage of total spend and would start after a month or two on the job.  Most important thing for this role is total spend on high quality products, not the number of leads.  Will be evaluated on total spend and total spend only.

title: GHL Expert
description:
GoHighLevel (GHL) Funnel & Website Expert (Remote)



We equip entrepreneurs and leaders with strategic systems, digital infrastructure, and scalable growth solutions. We build streamlined ecosystems that combine automation, marketing, and mission-driven clarity.



We do not build messy tech stacks. We build clean, conversion-focused systems.



Role Overview



We are looking for a GoHighLevel expert who can confidently build high-converting funnels and aesthetically strong websites inside GHL.



This role is not for beginners. You must understand structure, UX, automation logic, and conversion flow. Design should look premium, modern, and clean, not template-heavy or cluttered.



Key Responsibilities



- Build high-converting funnels inside GoHighLevel

- Design clean, modern, mobile-responsive websites

- Set up automations, workflows, triggers, and pipelines

- Connect domains,
 systems, calendars, and integrations

- Optimize pages for performance and user experience

- Troubleshoot technical issues independently

- Collaborate with copy and strategy team for alignment



Requirements



- Proven experience building in GoHighLevel

- Strong understanding of funnel psychology and conversion principles

- Eye for design and layout structure

- Experience with automation workflows and CRM setup

- Ability to work without constant supervision

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Portfolio of live GHL funnels or websites required



Bonus Points



- Experience in faith-based or mission-driven brands

- Knowledge of AI integrations or advanced automation

- Basic understanding of copy structure and marketing strategy



What We Offer



- Remote flexibility

- Long-term opportunity for the right fit

- Clear project scope and structured communication

- Opportunity to build scalable systems, not one-off pages



How to Apply



Please submit:



- Links to 2 to 5 GHL funnels or websites you personally built

- A short explanation of your role in those builds

- Your rate (hourly or per project)

- Your availability



Thanks and we look forward to meeting you!

title: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
description:
As the DPO, you will be responsible for ensuring our company’s compliance with data protection regulations, implementing robust data protection policies and procedures, and safeguarding the privacy and protection of the data of our employees, customers, and stakeholders.

This is a critical role that requires a deep understanding of data privacy laws, excellent communication skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively across various departments.



 Responsibilities:



1. Data Protection and Privacy Policies:



• Develop, implement, and maintain data protection policies and controls to ensure regulatory compliance.

• Conduct audits to monitor compliance and collaborate with legal teams to address data protection issues.

• Ensure compliance for third-party vendors and update policies as necessary.



2. Privacy Impact Assessments and Data Mapping:



• Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for new projects and perform data mapping to identify privacy risks.

• Develop and implement mitigation strategies and regularly update DPIAs and data mapping exercises.

• Monitor emerging technologies for privacy impacts.



3. Data Subject Rights and Consent Management:



• Manage processes for data subject requests (e.g., access, erasure) and obtain and manage consent for data processing.

• Ensure compliance with consent requirements and periodically review processes.



4. Training and Awareness:



• Provide regular training on data protection and regulatory requirements.

• Develop specialized training for high-risk data processing and integrate data protection into onboarding.



5. Security I
 Management and Breach Response:



• Develop and maintain an i
 response plan and coordinate with teams to manage breaches.

• Conduct post-i
 reviews and implement prevention measures.



6. Vendor Management:



• Implement a vendor management program to assess and monitor data protection practices.

• Review and negotiate data processing agreements and conduct regular compliance audits.



7. Regulatory Compliance and Reporting:



• Maintain an inventory of data protection laws and serve as the contact for regulatory authorities.

• Prepare reports on data protection activities and i
.



8. Privacy by Design and Data Governance:



• Integrate privacy by design principles into product development and implement data governance frameworks.

• Monitor and recommend improvements for data governance compliance.



9. General Recommendation:



• Recommend strategies to management for enhancing overall data protection practices, addressing compliance gaps, and improving privacy and security measures across the organization.



Qualifications and Skills:



• Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in computer science or related field such as information security, data protection, law, or a related discipline.

• Proficiency with software for preparing reports and presentations

• Proven experience as a Data Protection Officer or in a similar role, preferably in a technology or data-driven organization.

• In-depth knowledge of global data protection laws and regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other regional frameworks.

• Familiarity with privacy-by-design principles and practical implementation strategies.

• Strong understanding of data security, encryption, anonymization techniques, and data lifecycle management.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess and manage privacy risks effectively.

• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.

• Professional certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) or Certified Data Protection Officer (CDPO) are highly desirable.

• Knowledge of emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cloud computing, and their implications for data protection is a plus.



Data Protection Officer and play a vital role in ensuring the privacy and security of sensitive data while driving compliance with global data protection regulations.

Apply your expertise in data privacy and make a meaningful impact on our company’s commitment to protecting data and maintaining the trust of our employees, customers and partners.

.

title: Bookkeeper & Financial Operations Analyst
description:
Enlightened Stock Trading is an online education business that helps traders transition from emotional, inconsistent trading to confident, systemised success using proven, backtested trading systems.



*Please read this entire job description before applying*



We are seeking a detail-oriented and commercially minded Bookkeeper & Financial Operations Analyst to manage bookkeeping, reporting, and actively monitor customer payments and renewals to maximise recurring revenue.



This is a long-term, remote role working closely with the founder and team.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- Maintain accurate financial records in Xero

- Perform bank and payment gateway reconciliations (e.g. Stripe, PayPal)

- Monitor customer payments, subscriptions, renewals, and failed payments

- Follow up on overdue invoices and payment issues

- Track Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) and identify revenue leakage

- Prepare monthly management reports (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)

- Assist with cash flow tracking and forecasting

- Maintain Excel-based financial reports

- Attend daily team huddles on Zoom



REQUIREMENTS:

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

- Proven bookkeeping or financial operations experience

- Strong working knowledge of Xero

- High proficiency in Excel

- Experience with online or subscription-based businesses preferred

- Fluent written and spoken English

- High attention to detail and strong follow-up skills



REMOTE WORK REQUIREMENTS

- Based in the Philippines

- Reliable high-speed internet (with backup preferred)

- Windows-based computer (Mac not supported)

- Webcam, headset, and quiet private workspace

- Willingness to sign confidentiality and NDA agreements



WORKING HOURS

- Part-time

- Must be willing to work Australian business hours

- Availability for daily Zoom huddles



WHY JOIN US

- Long-term remote role

- Structured business with clear systems and expectations

- Opportunity to grow responsibility as the business grows



NEXT STEPS TO APPLY (Please do ALL of the following)

1. Do not submit a generic AI generated application

2. At the top of your application please say "I have read the entire job description"

3. Please include a copy of your formal accounting or finance qualification including grades

4. Go to speedtest.net and run a speedtest of your normal computer setup and include a screenshot of the result

5. On your computer go to to "About my pc" and include a screenshot of your computer processor and ram so we can see you have sufficient hardware to run the computer

6. Explain in your cover letter what experience you have had with accounting / bookkeeping / payroll in Xero. If you do not have Xero experience please do not apply as you will not be considered.

7. Please provide 2 references for your relevant work including
s or phone numbers for us to contact should we requirte.

title: Business Development Representative – Private Equity & Growth Companies
description:
Company: OnTheGrow Leadership™

Location: 100% Remote (Philippines-based only)

Schedule: Full-time (40 hours/week) — Must be available during US Eastern Time business hours (9 AM – 6 PM ET). Night shift in the Philippines.



About OnTheGrow Leadership™



OnTheGrow Leadership™ helps private-equity-backed and high-growth companies dramatically improve execution, leadership alignment, and enterprise value. We don’t offer generic leadership training. We install the GROWTH™ Leadership Operating System — a proven execution framework that includes the GROWTH™ Execution Model, Grace + Grit™ behavioral standards, Leadership Operating Rhythms, and OnTheGrow.ai™ reinforcement.

+45% Employee Engagement | +32% Leader Effectiveness | -27% Voluntary Turnover | +13% Revenue Growth



Your Mission:

Key Responsibilities:



Prospect and build targeted lists of PE-backed portfolio companies, growth-stage organizations, and their executive teams

Execute high-volume, personalized outbound campaigns (LinkedIn + Cold
)

Craft compelling outreach that speaks to leadership execution risk, M&A integration, scaling challenges, and value creation

Qualify prospects and book discovery calls for the GROWTH™ Leadership System Diagnostic

Become an expert at communicating the power of our proprietary GROWTH™ framework

Track all activity and pipeline in our Go High Level CRM



Must-Have Requirements:



2+ years of proven outbound B2B sales experience (cold
 + LinkedIn prospecting)

Strong track record of booking meetings with senior executives or decision-makers

Excellent written English with the ability to write professional, persuasive messaging

Experience using LinkedIn Sales Navigator, 
, Instantly, or similar tools

Ability to work US Eastern Time hours consistently

High emotional resilience and coachability



Big Advantages (Major Plus):



Experience selling to Private Equity firms, portfolio companies, or C-level executives

Background in leadership development, coaching, HR tech, or organizational development

Familiarity with executive-level conversations around scaling, M&A, and leadership gaps



How to Apply (Very Important)

To be seriously considered, please submit your application with the exact subject line:

BDR – OnTheGrow Leadership – [Your Full Name]



In your application, please include:



How many qualified discovery calls/meetings have you personally booked in the last 6–12 months?



Link to your updated LinkedIn profile

Why are you excited about selling leadership systems to private-equity-backed and high-growth companies?

Why do you believe you would be a strong fit for OnTheGrow Leadership?



Applications without the Loom video will not be considered.



We review applications daily and will reach out quickly to the strongest candidates for a Zoom interview.

We’re looking for someone ambitious who wants to grow with a high-impact leadership company.

Best regards,



Bob

Co-Founder

OnTheGrow Leadership™

title: Senior Accountant
description:
About the Company

We are a fast-growing Australian non-bank lender specialising in real estate-backed private credit.

We are scaling and building institutional-grade finance operations.

The Role

This role is critical to maintaining financial control as the loan book grows.

Experience in non-bank lending, mortgage servicing, or private lending is highly regarded.

________________________________________

Who We’re Looking For

This role will grow as the company scales.

________________________________________

What This Role Is NOT

________________________________________

Compensation

________________________________________

2. A creative eye and strong attention to detail

3. Curiosity about trends and viral social media content

4. Enthusiasm, reliability, and a positive work attitude

5. Willingness to learn and grow in a fast-moving environment

6. Experience is a plus, but not required. Passion and creativity matter more.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:

- Performance-based bonuses

title: Full-time Social Media Manager
description:
Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term

42 hours/week | 6 days/week

$1,000 – $1,400 USD/month (based on experience)



Who This Role Is For:



This role is for someone who genuinely loves social media and understands how Instagram works today (trends, formats, timing, and why certain posts go viral)



You don’t need years of professional experience!

What we care about most is your passion for content creation and your understanding of what makes content trend and perform well.

- Making smart posting decisions based on data and patterns

- Reviewing content carefully before posting to avoid mistakes

- Sharing insights with the content team on what’s working and what’s not



You’ll be trained on how to analyze metrics, understand posting patterns, and improve performance over time.



What We’re Looking For:

- Strong interest in social media and content creation

- Good understanding of social media trends and viral content

- Attention to detail and strong judgment

- Comfortable working independently in a remote setup

- Willingness to learn and improve

- Experience is a plus BUT NOT REQUIRED

- Personal pages, passion projects, or content you’ve made for fun all count as experience.



Why You’ll Like This Role:

- Fully remote work

- No micromanagement

- Paid training and regular feedback

- Opportunity to work on accounts with large audiences

- Clear growth path into strategist or leadership roles

- Supportive and healthy team culture



How to Apply (Please Read Carefully)

To be considered, your application must include:

1. A portfolio (this can be client work, personal Instagram pages, Reels, TikToks, or any creative projects.)

2. A short video introduction (1–2 minutes): Tell us why you’re a great fit. Be creative &  show your personality. We are not looking for a boring or scripted intro.

IMPORTANT!!!!!!!

We’re looking for someone creative, detail-oriented, and passionate about social media not just someone who can follow instructions.

title: Meta Ads Creative Strategist
description:
WE NEED SOMEONE WITH EXPERIENCE IN HEALTH & WELLNESS AND/OR CONSUMABLE PRODUCTS (e.g. Supplements, powdered drinks, etc.)



Position Type: Full Time

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Schedule: Mon-Fri, 9:30am-6:30pm Singapore 

 

About the Company



Our client is a fast-growing Direct-to-Consumer health and wellness brand with sales in the USA and Singapore. Headquartered in Singapore, we operate as a remote-first team across four countries.



Over the last four years, we’ve grown to 7 figures in annual revenue with 60–80% year-on-year growth. As we scale toward 8 figures, we’re building a performance-led marketing engine driven by systems, data, and creative excellence.

 

About the Role



If you’ve only run ads for fashion brands, boosted posts, or content-first accounts, this role is not for you.

 

This role is for a data-driven Meta Ads Creative Strategist who can own the client’s entire Meta ads system, including scripting and media buying, to hit clear revenue, ROAS, CPA, and budget targets.

 

You won’t be guessing or “posting content.” You’ll be building a repeatable system that delivers consistent performance through structured creative testing and optimization.



As a creative strategist, you will fully own:



- Scripting

- Concept ideation

- Creative testing

- Production workflows

- Performance scaling

 

Responsibilities

 

- Strategic Ad Creative System: Build and operate a creative machine delivering 5–10 weekly video ads, tailored to different customer pain points and awareness levels.



- End-to-End Script Development: Write value-based, conversion-driven scripts using direct-response frameworks (AIDA, PAS) and create precise creative briefs for execution.



- Creative Testing Frameworks: Design and run systematic tests (e.g. 5 hooks × 3 angles × 2 lengths = 30 variations) to identify winning patterns.



- Performance Scaling: Launch structured tests with statistical significance, scale winners systematically, kill losers fast, and document learnings.



- Data Analysis & Optimisation: Monitor daily metrics (CTR, CPM, CPC, CVR, AOV), refresh creatives weekly to combat fatigue, and deliver monthly reports with actionable insights.



- Creator & Production Management: Coordinate creators in the US and Australia, manage production timelines, quality control output, and build repeatable templates for consistent delivery.



- Budget & ROAS Ownership: Take full ownership of scaling profitably while maintaining target ROAS and building predictable growth models.

 

Competencies and Qualifications



Must-Have



- 3+ years scaling Meta ads for DTC eCommerce brands

- Proven track record managing $5,000+ USD/month profitably

- Has scripted and/or created 30+ short-form video ads

- Strong direct-response copywriting skills (AIDA, PAS, etc.)

- Can clearly explain how CTR, CPM, CVR influence CAC

- Ability to break down funnels and diagnose bottlenecks (e.g. what to fix when CPC rises)

- Experience building systematic creative testing frameworks

- Expert-level proficiency in Meta Ads Manager

- Comfortable owning outcomes, not just execution

 

Nice-to-Have



- Experience managing remote creators and production workflows

- Experience scaling spend beyond $20k+ USD/month

- Strong documentation habits for systems and learnings

- Interest in mentoring or leading a team as the company scales

 

Key Attrributes



- Decisive: Able to make confident, data-backed decisions quickly; scales winners and cuts losers without hesitation

- Inquisitive: Naturally curious about why ads work or fail; constantly tests, questions assumptions, and seeks better angles

- Goal-Oriented: Driven by clear targets (ROAS, CPA, revenue) and focused on outcomes, not activity

- Analytical: Interprets performance metrics (CTR, CPM, CPC, CVR, AOV) to diagnose issues and guide creative and scaling decisions

- Detail-Oriented: Meticulous with scripts, test variables, data review, and execution; spots small issues before they become costly problems

title: Merchandise Planner (AU Retail)
description:
WE NEED SOMEONE WITH STRONG DATA ANALYSIS IN INVENTORY CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT FOR RETAIL BUSINESSES (Managed inventory planning for multiple physical retail stores)



Position Type: Full Time

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 9AM to 6PM AEST (Fixed)

 

About the Company



Our client is a leading wholesaler that designs, sources, and imports products from around the world for major Australian retailers. Renowned for setting industry trends, they deliver innovative solutions across categories such as apparel, impulse, accessories, and travel luggage. As a market leader in VMI, brand management, licensing, and private label solutions, they design, manufacture, distribute, and manage a diverse portfolio of products and brands across department stores, discount department stores, supermarkets, independent retailers, and pharmacy channels.



About the Role



As a Merchandise Planner (Retail), you will be responsible for leading the Allocation and Store Analysts, ensuring the right product is in the right place at the right time. As planning is the cog that keeps the whole machine running, your role is critical in aligning inventory with demand—managing procurement from China, partnering with sales to forecast needs, and overseeing allocations across both wholesale and retail channels to drive sales performance.

 

Responsibilities



- Lead and support the Allocation & Store Analysts team.

- Ensure stock is allocated to the right stores at the right time, in line with agreed allocation methodologies.

- Analyze future sales forecasts by product and place stock orders to maintain appropriate warehouse inventory levels.

- Identify and action in-store sales opportunities in collaboration with Allocation & Store Analysts to maximize performance.

- Communicate with customers as needed regarding product availability, delivery, or planning updates.

- Coordinate with merchandising on upcoming in-store demand driven by seasonal events (e.g. School Holidays, Easter, Christmas).

- Complete monthly Open-to-Buy (OTB) reviews and reforecasting activities.

- Responsible for seasonal article creation and article master data maintenance.

- Manage monthly purchase order (PO) creation and ensure accuracy of procurement data.

 

Competencies and Qualifications



Must-Have



- Minimum 5 plus years of experience in retail allocations and merchandise planning

- Proven background in multi-store or multi-channel retail operations, with strong hands-on experience in stock allocations 

- Having at least 2 years of management experience with a minimum of 2 direct reports

- Excellent Retail math skills and understanding of excel based allocations

- Demonstrated ability to use data to drive allocation accuracy and improve sales outcomes.

- Proficient in Microsoft Excel, with solid knowledge of intermediate formulas such as XLOOKUP, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS, MROUND, CEILING, and CONCATENATE.

- Skilled in sales forecasting and inventory planning—able to interpret sales trends and plan stock orders to maintain optimal warehouse levels.

- Knowledge of stock allocation principles and methodologies, ensuring accurate and timely stock placement across stores.

- Strong analytical thinking and decision-making skills.

- High attention to detail, including proactive stock management based on external factors (e.g., weather, regional events).

- Accountability and ownership—able to manage key tasks independently without constant reminders.

- Resilience and adaptability in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.

- Excellent communication and cross-functional collaboration abilities—comfortable working across sales, merchandising, and customer teams.



Nice-to-Have



- System Proficiency (Planning Tools & ERP Systems): Proficient in using planning and ERP systems such as SAP, Oracle, or JDA, with the ability to efficiently input, manage, and update forecasts.

- Master Data & Purchase Order Management: Experienced in managing seasonal article creation, maintaining master data, and ensuring accurate and timely purchase order (PO) creation.

- Leadership Experience: Minimum of 1–2 years in a leadership or senior-level planning role, with demonstrated ability to guide and support tea
mbers.

 

Technical Requirements



- Computer with a minimum of 16GB RAM

- Intel Core i5 processor (or equivalent).

- Headset (preferable noise canceling microphone)

- Fast/Stable and Reliable Internet Connection (At least 30 Mbps)

- Having 2 external monitor is a plus

- Webcam

 

What We Offer



- 100% Remote Work

- 13th Month Pay

- Healthcare (HMO)

- Complete Benefits Package

- Paid Service Incentive Lead (SIL)

- Paid Philippines Holidays

- Free Learning and Development Programs

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Growth-Minded Mid/Senior Python Developer
description:
Do you enjoy development and stimulating work that we approach like a game, with challenges and learning, all while doing great work with teammates who care? Let’s team up.



We believe in people. This is why we only work with clients who serve people. From firefighters, to law firms, to suppliers sending life-saving food to kids dying of malnutrition, the code you write will help make the world a better place.



Our team is made up of people who want to do the best work of their life. People who love to learn, challenge themselves, grow and have some fun along the journey. We also care about each other – we support each other in our own personal goals and vision. We are human beings before employees and we love to bring out the best in each other.



Now, ready to learn more about this opening? Buckle up.



If you work here, you’ll be:

- Challenged to do the best work of your life in a supportive environment.

- Become the best communicator you can become (this is the most important thing we do).

- Have the space to ask questions, voice your feedback and make a difference (and be yourself).

- Help expand our codebase and tools, participate in code reviews, and grow with your fellow developers.



You’ll do well in this job if you:

- Have a strong background in Python and understand HTML, CSS and Javascript enough to be dangerous.

- Enjoy working with people who actually care about what they do and will not let you be lazy or do sloppy work.

- Have an opinion and care about best practices and love learning and creating and building.

- Are familiar with common things we deal with as developers: Git, SQLAlchemy, building and engaging with APIs, linters, etc.

- Have grit and determination and are someone who will exceed no matter what gets in your way.

- Are attentive to details.

- Have 3+ years of Python development experience.



You probably shouldn’t apply if:

- You’re “just looking for extra money.”

- You like working 5 full-time jobs because all you care about is work.

- You get offended easily and take things personally.

- You are not someone with grit and determination who can persevere while being challenged to do great work.

- You get overwhelmed easily with new code, new habits, new learnings and chat messages.



The interview process:

- Since 99% of our work is done via Slack (we don’t do scheduled calls), the entire interview process will be via
. (With lots of questions, sprinkled with a few voice notes)

- You may be able to speak with a developer or two on our team to see how they like the role.



If you work here:

- You’ll get 13th month salary, Filipino holidays, unlimited time off (we don’t count sick days), a normal working day schedule (no night shifts, although an early start is preferred for time overlap) with some flexibility, a week off during the holidays in December, and the opportunity to grow and become your best self.



A little more about us:

- We’ve been in business for a decade+. Our teams are remote (mostly in the Philippines). Our longest standing tea
mber has been with us for over 13+ years. We've had people quit smoking on our teams with our help, lose weight, learn a new instrument, speak a new language, and more. We all love what we do.



How to begin

- Your mission, should you choose to accept, is to send us an
 with 3 questions you have about this role. If you’re currently in a full-time role and are looking for something new, we’re open to a transition window. We actually care about your happiness.



NOTE: While we like AI, and we use it in certain circumstances, we ask that no AI be used during communication. Communication is the most important thing we do. If I don't see your natural voice from our first interaction, then you're setting an inaccurate representation of who you are and how you communicate. And when I see that change, it's going to come across as a lack of harmony in how you communicate.

Ecommerce experience a plus

How to Apply

Fill out the application form here:

title: Content & Digital Asset Development Specialist (Authority & Lead Generation Focus)
description:
**IMPORTANT – READ FIRST**

To apply, start your application with the phrase:

**“Content becomes leverage.”**

Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.



---



## About the Role



We are building multiple authority-driven brands in the financial services, insurance, entrepreneurship, and travel sectors. We have invested in a large licensed library of digital content, templates, research materials, and pre-built assets that need to be organized, refined, and strategically deployed.



We are hiring a **Content & Digital Asset Repurposing Specialist** to turn these raw materials into high-quality, structured assets that support:



* Lead generation

*
 list growth

* Website SEO

* Authority building (books, guides, resources)

* Social media content

* Training and educational materials



This role is focused on transforming existing licensed and internal content into strategic, revenue-supporting assets — not producing random content without direction.



---



## What You Will Own



### 1. Content Library Audit & Organization



* Review and categorize existing licensed content libraries

* Identify high-value, relevant content aligned with our target markets (homeowners, business owners, professionals, families)

* Eliminate low-quality or redundant material

* Build an organized digital content database



---



### 2. Content Repurposing & Asset Creation



* Combine and restructure multiple licensed sources into:



  * Lead magnets (checklists, guides, reports)

  * Blog posts optimized for SEO

  *
 sequences

  * Social media content batches

  * Website resource pages

* Rewrite, restructure, and refine content to ensure originality, authority tone, and brand alignment

* Format content for:



  * Website publishing

  * Amazon KDP (books and short guides)

  * PDF lead magnets



---



### 3. Authority & Book Development



* Develop short authority books or guides from curated licensed material

* Structure manuscripts for Amazon publishing

* Support long-form content creation aligned with brand positioning

* Ensure messaging is cohesive and professional



---



### 4. Lead Magnet & Funnel Support



* Work with Growth Strategist to create campaign-specific lead magnets

* Adapt licensed materials into downloadable resources

* Ensure assets align with target audience pain points

* Prepare materials for integration into CRM and
 systems



---



### 5. Ongoing Content Systems



* Build reusable content frameworks

* Maintain content calendar support

* Repurpose long-form content into multiple formats

* Assist in building training material and educational resources



---



## Required Experience & Skills



* Strong writing and rewriting ability (clear, professional English)

* Experience with content repurposing and restructuring

* Ability to combine multiple sources into cohesive material

* Understanding of SEO fundamentals

* Familiarity with formatting for Amazon KDP and digital downloads

* Organized and detail-oriented

* Comfortable working with structured guidance and campaign direction



---



## Work Details



* Full-time or high part-time (30–40 hours per week)

* Long-term role

* Must overlap with U.S. Eastern Time for at least 3–4 hours daily



---



## Compensation



* $400 – $800 USD per month (based on experience and scope)

* Performance-based increases tied to asset production and usability



---



## This Role Is Ideal For



* Content professionals who enjoy restructuring and improving existing material

* Detail-oriented operators who can work independently

* Individuals who understand that content must support revenue, not just output volume



---



## This Role Is Not For



* Writers who only want to create original opinion pieces

* Candidates uncomfortable with structured rewriting

* People looking for short-term freelance projects

* Anyone who avoids deadlines and production targets

title: CUSTOMER SUCCESS / GHL SPECIALIST - USA MARKET (PART-TIME, GROWING TO FULL-TIME)
description:
Company - Romea.AI

AI automation company for medical and aesthetic clinics. We implement GoHighLevel end-to-end: forms, funnels, advanced calendars, workflows, LLM automations, and full-funnel reporting. Small senior team, fast decisions, zero drama.

Hours and Schedule

Starting at 20 hours per week with clear path to grow. Must overlap with US business hours (Eastern/Central/Pacific depending on client load). Weekly client calls across US time zones.

The Role

You own the full client journey from discovery to go-live to ongoing success. You will set up GoHighLevel from scratch for each new client, run weekly client meetings, train clinic staff, and act as the bridge between our technical/dev team and the client. You are a problem owner - when something breaks or a client needs something, you figure it out and make it happen. This is a client-facing role so outstanding spoken English and communication skills are non-negotiable.

What You Will Do

Client Onboarding and Success

Scope projects, create project plans and acceptance criteria. Lead weekly status calls with clinic owners and managers. Keep action logs tight and follow through on every item. Run playbook checklists from forms to calendars to pipelines to automations to reporting. Be the single point of contact for the client and coordinate with our dev team to deliver.

GoHighLevel Build (From Scratch)

Forms and funnels with UTM/GCLID capture, hidden fields, spam controls. Advanced calendars including multi-rule, round-robin, buffers, provider rules, no-show logic, Zoom and Google Meet integration. Workflows including dynamic
s and SMS, conditional paths, merge fields, custom values, reactivation sequences. Pipelines, snapshots, and full account configuration.

Ads and Tracking Integration

Google Ads: GCLID/UTM capture into contact fields, offline conversion uploads with lead stage mapping, values, and de-duplication rules. TikTok Ads: Pixel plus Events API/CAPI mapping for key events such as form submit, schedule, and attended. GA4/GTM where needed. Verify events and fix data gaps.

Reporting

Build executive dashboards in GHL and/or Looker Studio showing leads to bookings to show rate to revenue, broken down by source, campaign, adset, provider, and location. Monthly and quarterly business reviews with clear recommendations.

Training (This Is a Big Part of the Role)

Create SOPs, checklists, and short Loom videos. Deliver live training sessions to clinic staff, partners, and internal team. You must be comfortable presenting, explaining, and teaching in a professional and engaging way. Experience running client-facing training sessions is required.

Commercial Awareness

Understand the business side. Identify upsell opportunities, flag churn risks early, and think like a business owner when advising clients. You are not just a technician - you represent Romea.AI to our clients.

Must-Haves (No Exceptions)

Extensive GoHighLevel experience - minimum 2 years or 15 plus implementations across funnels, forms, workflows, calendars, pipelines, and snapshots. You must be able to set up a full GHL account from zero.

GoHighLevel certification(s) required. Please include proof in your application.

Proven experience with client-facing training - live sessions, webinars, onboarding walkthroughs. Show us examples.

Google Ads plus TikTok Ads tracking into GHL: GCLID/UTM capture, offline conversions import, Pixel/CAPI setup.

Excellent spoken and written English. You will be on camera with US clinic owners weekly. Communication skills are critical.

Strong problem-solving mindset. You own problems until they are solved.

Solid project management habits using ClickUp, Asana, or similar. Change logs and rollback plans.

Nice to Have

Healthcare or clinic onboarding experience, especially multi-location setups. WhatsApp/Twilio, Messenger,
 warm-up basics. Light n8n or Zapier familiarity to coordinate with our automation team.

Success in the First 30 to 60 Days

3 to 5 new US accounts fully onboarded with forms, calendars, workflows, and reporting live with tracked conversions. One standard US snapshot refined including forms, calendars, baseline workflows, and reporting pack. Training pack with SOPs and Looms delivered. QBR deck template in use.

What to Include in Your Application (Show, Do Not Just Tell)

Portfolio: 1 to 2 GHL snapshots or screen recordings showing a multi-rule calendar, dynamic
 workflow, and your reporting view. Redact any sensitive information.

Tracking brief (one page max): your steps for GCLID/UTM capture to offline conversion upload to Google Ads from GHL, and TikTok Pixel plus Events API mapping for form submit and schedule events.

Proof of GHL certification(s).

Examples of client-facing training you have delivered (Loom links, session recordings, or descriptions).

Your hourly rate or retainer expectation, US hours you can cover, and earliest start date.

title: Senior Graphic Designer with Modern Skill with AI Prompting Master Skils and proven experience with Amazon
description:
ABOUT US



Since 2013, Prodigy Media has built more than brands — we've created an Amazon-native empire. With 12 years of proven success and 28+ product lines under our belt, we don't play small. Our mission? Launch culturally resonant, design-led, emotionally sticky products that dominate Amazon and beyond.



Now, we're leveling up — and we want a design assassin who’s mastered AI workflows, commands Midjourney like a wizard, and turns prompts into visual gold.



WHO WE WANT



This is not your average graphic design role. We're looking for a hybrid Creative Director / Prompt Engineer / Graphic Design savant who can:



Think like a marketer. Design like an artist. Prompt like an AI god.



You’ll own the visual storytelling for our brands, using both traditional tools and bleeding-edge AI systems to pump out Amazon-optimized assets that convert.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Craft Ultra-High-Converting Amazon Ads – static, lifestyle, 
-tier, and scroll-stopping. Own A+ Content Design – full module execution with story arcs that build obsession. Design Labels & Packaging – pixel-perfect, regulatory-ready, and unforgettable on the shelf. Prompt, Edit & Produce AI-Generated Visuals – using tools like Midjourney, DALL•E, Runway, Spline, Veo3, Sora, and others. Run 3D Product Renders – via Blender, KeyShot, or AI-powered 3D tools. Develop Scroll-Hook Videos – using After Effects, Premiere, Runway AI, etc.



Systematize Brand Visuals Across 30+ Products – while keeping it all aligned, emotional, and conversion-focused.



WHO YOU ARE



5+ years in design, at least 2+ years in Amazon/e-commerce brand creative

Fluent in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Blender, After Effects

Pro-level Midjourney / AI prompt engineer – this is non-negotiable

Obsessed with Amazon visual psychology, packaging psychology, and design that sells

Able to juggle 10 brands and still hit deadlines

Operate with a Creative Director mindset — not just execution, but strategy

Bonus: Experience creating creative systems, art direction templates, or leading a team



MUST-HAVES

Portfolio with Amazon ads, A+ pages, labels, 3D renders, videos, and AI-gen examples

Real-world use of AI tools integrated into your workflow

Available Mon-Fri 5:00am–2:00pm PST

title: Social Media Manager
description:
Are you detail oriented and a clear communicator? We are looking for a QA manager to proofread video scripts and quality check YouTube videos. This is a full-time YouTube Manager position. The purpose of this role is to ensure our scripts and videos are polished, engaging, and ready to go viral. This role also involves uploading finalized videos to our YouTube channels, ensuring every detail is accurate and optimized for success.

If you have an eye for catching errors, improving content, communicating feedback, and understanding what makes a great YouTube video, we’d love to have you on our team!



Responsibilities:

- Script Review: Proofread scripts and provide constructive feedback to writers.

- Video Review: Watch videos to check for errors and note discrepancies, and provide clear feedback.

- Team Management: Maintain strong communication with the freelance team of writers and video editors, in addition to maintaining our SOPs up to date.

- Video Uploading: Upload finalized videos to the YouTube channel with descriptions.



Requirements:

- Experience in proofreading, editing, or writing.

- Experience in video editing faceless videos.

- MUST have strong attention to detail.

- Understand the fundamentals of YouTube CTR, retention, and hooks.

- Clear and professional communication skills for giving feedback and communicating with the team.

- Complete a QC test to assess your skills.



Pay:

- $2.50 - $4.00 USD Per hour

- Paid on the 1st and 15th of every month.

- Must have a Payoneer in your name linked to onlinejobs.ph.

- Growth opportunity based on performance.

- About 30 - 40 hours a week and flexible hours.



If you are interested, just send a quick message with your experience and "QAMA25" as the subject, so we know you are serious. If you have the experience we are looking for, we will send you the application/ test task link.



We appreciate all applicants, and we look forward to hearing from you!
