title: Video Editor (Real Estate Niche)
description:
We run a media / editing company in the real estate space, working with agencies, brokerages, and related businesses to turn raw footage into clean, high-performing video assets (ads, short-form, listing content, and brand pieces).

We’re looking for a reliable, detail?oriented video editor who understands (or is willing to quickly learn) the real estate world and can plug into our existing style and systems.



What You’ll Be Doing

Editing short-form and long-form videos for real estate agencies and similar companies

Turning raw footage into polished pieces with strong hooks, pacing, and retention

Adding captions, B?roll, transitions, sound design, motion graphics where needed

Matching and maintaining our existing style and quality standards

Delivering on time, following clear briefs, and being open to iterative improvement

You’ll be working directly from our examples and past work.

We’ll share a Google Drive folder with sample videos we’ve already produced so you can see:

The style we like

The speed and energy of cuts

The quality bar we expect on every project



Requirements

Proven experience as a video editor (Premiere Pro / Final Cut / DaVinci – we don’t care which, as long as output is great)

Strong sense of pacing, rhythm, and storytelling for social and ad content

Ability to follow brand guidelines and match an existing style

Reliable communication and on-time delivery

High attention to detail (no sloppy cuts, bad crops, or typo’d captions)

Bonus (not required, but a big plus):

Prior experience editing for the real estate market (agents, teams, brokerages, property tours, real estate ads, etc.)



Compensation & Growth

Pay: Per project (we’ll agree on a clear per?video or per?package rate before each batch)

Goal: Move the right person into a steady / full-time role as we grow together

If you deliver consistently, hit deadlines, and help us produce videos that get results, we’ll increase volume and long-term commitment



How To Apply 

To be considered, you must:

Record a Loom video (2–5 minutes) where you:





Introduce yourself

Tell us if you have any experience in the real estate market (who you’ve worked with, what type of content)

Walk through 2–3 of your best video projects and explain what you did on each





In your Loom, include links to the videos you’re showing (portfolio, Drive, YouTube, etc.).





Send us:





Your Loom link

Your portfolio link

Your typical turnaround time and your current availability (hours per week).

If you can match (or beat) the quality of the examples in our Google Drive and you’re hungry for consistent work, we want to talk to you.



P.S. We are here to compete in one of the strongest real estate markets in the whole USA. We are hungry, and we are here to make money and deliver a good product.

title: B2B Marketing Coordinator
description:
Remote Position | Part-Time to Full-Time | Managed Services Provider



About easyIT.



easyIT is a 22-year-old Melbourne-based managed service provider (MSP) with an extraordinary track record: 99% client retention rate and zero churn over two decades. We partner with growing businesses (10-80 employees) across manufacturing, professional services, and distribution sectors, providing comprehensive IT support that enables business growth.



The Opportunity

This is not a typical marketing role. You'll be joining during a critical transformation phase, working directly with our fractional CMO to build easyIT's marketing infrastructure from the ground up. You'll execute the strategic BLUEPRINT we've developed to generate qualified leads, build brand visibility, and create systematic revenue growth.



You'll have the rare opportunity to see immediate impact from your work. Every campaign you execute, every piece of content you create, and every lead you generate will be directly visible in company growth. This role combines content creation, campaign execution, and outbound lead generation, making it perfect for someone who wants diverse marketing experience with measurable business results.



Role Overview

Position Type: Part-time (15-20 hours/week initially), with potential to scale to full-time as campaigns expand



Reporting Structure: You'll work under the strategic direction of our fractional CMO, with direct collaboration with the CEO/founder for subject matter expertise and client insights.



Work Style: Initially Fully remote, flexible hours, but must be self-directed and able to execute independently without constant supervision. We need someone who can take strategic direction and run with it.  In the future may turn into a hybrid role if fulltime.



Core Responsibilities

1. Content Creation & Writing (30% of time)

• Website Content: Write and update service pages, About page, location pages based on strategic messaging frameworks. Build and test landing pages for lead magnets, case study downloads, and specific campaigns.

• Blog Content: Draft 2-4 blog posts per month (1,500-3,000 words) following SEO content calendar and keyword targeting

• Case Studies: Interview clients and write compelling case studies highlighting retention and client success stories

•
 Marketing: Write
 sequences for lead nurture, referral requests, and newsletter content

• Sales Enablement Materials: Create persona-specific one-pagers (Owner/CEO, CFO, Office Manager, IT Manager versions)

 

2. Cold Outreach & Lead Generation (25% of time)

• Prospect List Building: Research and build targeted lists of 10-80 employee businesses in Melbourne matching ideal customer profile

• LinkedIn Outreach: Execute connection requests and personalised messaging campaigns via SalesFlow (or similar automation tools)

• Cold
 Campaigns: Write and launch multi-touch
 sequences using best practices for deliverability

• Personalisation at Scale: Research prospects and customise messages using company-specific details and pain points

• Response Management: Monitor replies, categorise responses (interested/not interested/questions), coordinate handoffs to CEO

• Follow-up Sequences: Execute systematic follow-up across channels (LinkedIn +
 + potentially phone)

• Performance Optimisation: Track metrics (connection rates, reply rates, meeting bookings), adjust messaging based on results

 

3. Campaign Execution & Management (25% of time)

• Referral Campaigns: Execute systematic referral request campaigns to top clients using prepared scripts and templates

•
 Campaigns: Set up and manage automated
 sequences in GoHighLevel (or designated
 platform)

• Google Business Profile: Post weekly updates using 4-post rotation (company news, tips/advice, client success, offers/promotions)

• Social Media: Create and schedule LinkedIn posts (2-3x per week) based on content bank and thought leadership strategy

• Content Repurposing: Turn long-form blog content into social posts,
 snippets, and one-pager excerpts

 

5. CRM & Data Management (10% of time)

• GoHighLevel Management: Input leads, update contact records, and maintain buying committee stakeholder data

• Lead Tracking: Log all referrals, track source attribution, and update pipeline stages accurately

• Contact Enrichment: Research and add missing stakeholder information for buying committees (CFO, Office Manager, IT Manager)

 

6. Analytics & Reporting (10% of time)

• Performance Tracking: Monitor website traffic,
 open rates, LinkedIn engagement, campaign performance

• Monthly Reports: Compile data for CMO review (leads generated by source, campaign results, content performance)

• Dashboard Maintenance: Update tracking dashboards with current metrics and key performance indicators

 

Non-Negotiable Requirements



These are the essential skills you must have to be successful in this role:

1. B2B Copywriting Excellence

• Ability to write compelling business-focused content (NOT consumer/lifestyle writing)

• Understanding of B2B buying psychology and multi-stakeholder decision-making processes

• Can translate technical IT concepts into business outcome language

• Experience writing for different stakeholder audiences (CEOs, CFOs, Operations Managers)

 

2. Strong English Writing Skills

• Native or near-native English proficiency

• Excellent grammar, spelling, and sentence structure

• Can adapt tone for different personas and platforms

• Professional business communication style

 

3. Cold Outreach & Lead Generation Experience

• LinkedIn Outreach: Proven experience executing B2B LinkedIn connection and messaging campaigns

• Cold
: Can write and execute multi-touch cold
 sequences that generate responses

• Outreach Tools: Experience with SalesFlow, Apollo, Lemlist, Instantly, or similar automation platforms

• List Building: Can research and build targeted prospect lists based on ideal customer profile criteria

• Personalisation: Understands how to personalise outreach at scale without manual one-off messages

• Results-Oriented: Can demonstrate previous campaign results (connection rates 25%+, reply rates 3-8%)

 

4. Marketing Systems Proficiency

• GoHighLevel (or similar CRM): Campaign building, automation setup, contact management

•
 Marketing Platforms: Sequence creation, segmentation, A/B testing

• WordPress or Website CMS: Content updates, page creation, basic formatting

• Project Management Tools: Asana/Trello/Monday for task tracking and workflow management

 

5. Self-Direction & Execution Excellence

• Takes strategic direction and executes independently without hand-holding

• Proactively identifies what needs to be done next

• Meets deadlines consistently without constant reminders

• Asks clarifying questions when needed but doesn't require constant supervision

 

6. Detail Orientation & Quality Control

• Reviews own work before submission

• Catches errors in grammar, formatting, data entry

• Maintains brand consistency across all materials

• Double-checks links, tracking codes, campaign settings

 

7. Research & Learning Capability

• Can research industry-specific topics (MSP/IT services) and understand business models

• Quick learner of new tools and systems

• Able to understand client business models and adapt messaging accordingly

• Research competitors and industry best practices proactively

 

Keyword: Blueprint



Good-to-Have Skills



These skills will make you stand out but aren't required:

• SEO Knowledge: Basic understanding of keyword research, on-page optimisation, content structure for SEO, Google Business Profile optimisation, review management

• Design Skills: Can create simple branded graphics in Canva, basic photo editing and optimisation

• Analytics & Data Interpretation: Can pull and interpret Google Analytics data, comfortable with marketing metrics

• Industry Experience: Previous work in B2B services marketing, MSP or technology sector familiarity

• Deliverability Management:
 warmup, domain reputation, avoiding spam filters

 

Ideal Candidate Profile



Background

• 2-5 years marketing coordinator/assistant experience in B2B services

• 1-2 years cold outreach experience (LinkedIn +
) with measurable results

• Has executed outbound campaigns that generated qualified meetings/opportunities

• Previously worked with small-medium businesses (10-100 employees)

• Comfortable working remotely with minimal supervision

 

Work Style

• Takes ownership of deliverables from start to finish

• Proactively communicates progress and blockers

• Organised with multiple concurrent projects

• Detail-oriented but also able to meet deadlines

 

Compensation & Growth Potential

Starting Position: Part-time (15-20 hours/week) with hourly compensation based on experience level



Growth Path: As campaigns scale and lead generation increases, this role has potential to expand to full-time (30-40 hours/week) with increased responsibilities and compensation.



Performance Bonuses: Opportunity for performance-based bonuses tied to lead generation targets and campaign success metrics.



Skill Development: You'll gain diverse experience across content creation, outbound sales development, and full-funnel marketing execution—valuable skills for your career growth.



What Makes This Role Different

• Direct Impact: You'll see immediate results from your work

• Ground Floor Opportunity: Join during the transformation phase and help build marketing infrastructure from scratch

• Strategic Exposure: Work directly with the fractional CMO on strategic initiatives, not just tactical execution

• Diverse Experience: This is a hybrid Marketing Coordinator + Outbound SDR role—you'll develop skills across multiple marketing disciplines

• Quality Over Quantity: We value thoughtful, high-quality work over churning out volume. You'll have time to do things right.

• Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere with flexible hours, as long as deliverables are met

 

How to Apply



Application Requirements:



1. Complete the Application Form:

Answer all questions thoroughly and honestly. Generic or incomplete responses will not be considered.

2.                  Record a Short Video Introduction (2-3 minutes): Upload to YouTube, Loom, or Google Drive and include the link in your application.   In your video, please address:

• Why you're interested in this specific role with easyIT

• Your experience with B2B copywriting and cold outreach

• One specific example of a successful campaign you've executed

• What tools and systems you're most comfortable using

• Why you're a good fit for a remote, self-directed role

3.                  Submit Writing Samples:

Include 2-3 examples of B2B content you've written (blog posts,
 sequences, LinkedIn posts, case studies, or similar).

If you don't have portfolio samples, you may create a sample blog post (1,000+ words) on the topic: "How to Know When Your IT Provider Is Holding Your Business Back"

4.                  Demonstrate Attention to Detail:

In the application form, you will be asked for a specific keyword that appears in this job description. Including this keyword correctly demonstrates you've read the full description carefully.



Application Questions



Please answer these questions in your application:

5.                  What is the keyword mentioned in the job description that demonstrates you've read it carefully?

6.                  Describe your experience with B2B copywriting. What types of content have you written for business audiences?

7.                  Tell us about a cold outreach campaign you've executed (LinkedIn or
). What were the results? (Include specific metrics: connection/response rates, meetings booked, etc.)

8.                  Which outreach automation tools have you used? (e.g., SalesFlow, Apollo, Lemlist, Instantly, etc.) Describe your proficiency level with each.

9.                  How do you balance personalisation with scale when conducting cold outreach? Give a specific example.

10.              What CRM and marketing automation platforms have you worked with? (e.g., GoHighLevel, HubSpot, ActiveCampaign, etc.)

11.              Describe your work style. How do you manage multiple projects and deadlines when working remotely?

12.              Why are you interested in working with a B2B managed services provider specifically? What about this role appeals to you?

13.              What hours per week are you available to work? Can you commit to 15-20 hours/week initially with potential to scale?

14.              What is your expected hourly rate for this role?

15.              Please provide the link to your 2-3 minute video introduction.

16.              Please provide links to 2-3 writing samples or attach your sample blog post.

 

Final Note



This role is perfect for someone who wants to make a real impact, see tangible results from their work, and grow their skills across multiple marketing disciplines. You'll be joining a company with an exceptional track record at a pivotal transformation 
nt.



If you're tired of working on projects where you never see the results, if you want to build something meaningful rather than just execute tasks, and if you thrive on independence and ownership, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.



We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Top 1% Appointment Setter Wanted!
description:

Your Mission



As our Appointment Setter, you will work directly with our Founder, Jordan, to drive our lead generation efforts. Your key responsibilities will include:

• Prospect Engagement: Manage replies and convert interest into sales calls

• Performance Tracking: Track and report performance to ensure continuous improvement

• Pipeline Management: Maintain and update the sales pipeline with qualified leads

•
 Marketing Support: Draft and send weekly
 newsletters to nurture leads

Who We're Looking For

Ready to Make an Impact?

Learn more and apply here:

title: Journalist / News Research Reporter
description:
Job Overview:



 We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly curious Journalist / News Research Reporter to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about current events, investigative research, and producing accurate, engaging news content.

You will be responsible for researching news topics, verifying information, and producing well-structured reports and articles. Strong research skills and attention to detail are essential.



Key Responsibilities:

*Conduct in-depth research on assigned news topics

*Gather and verify information from credible sources

*Monitor trends, breaking news, and industry developments

*Write clear, engaging, and fact-checked news articles or reports

*Summarize complex information into easy-to-understand content

*Meet deadlines consistently

*Collaborate with editors and tea
mbers



Requirements:

*Proven experience in journalism, news writing, or research reporting

*Strong research and fact-checking skills

*Excellent written English (grammar and structure must be strong)

*Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

*Familiarity with news sourcing and verification tools

*Background in media, communications, or related field is a plus





Preferred Skills:

*Experience with investigative reporting

*SEO knowledge for news articles

*Experience working remotely





Work Setup:

*Remote position

*Flexible hours (with required deadlines)

*Competitive pay based on experience





How to Apply:

Please send:

*Your updated resume

*2–3 writing samples (preferably news articles)

*A short paragraph explaining why you are a good fit for this role



We look forward to working with a passionate and reliable journalist who values accuracy and integrity.

title: Construction Estimator
description:
Job Overview: We are a growing Australian-based construction firm seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Construction Estimator to join our team. The successful candidate will play a critical role in our project lifecycle, providing accurate cost estimates and take-offs for residential and commercial projects. This is a remote role for a professional who understands the nuances of the Australian building industry, including local standards, terminology, and pricing.



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct comprehensive quantity take-offs from architectural and structural drawings.



Prepare detailed cost estimates, including labor, materials, and equipment.



Liaise with Australian suppliers and subcontractors to obtain competitive quotes.



Utilize estimating software (e.g., Buildertrend, CostX, Cubit, or similar) to generate reports.



Analyze project specifications and identify potential risks or cost-saving opportunities.



Ensure all estimates comply with the National Construction Code (NCC) and Australian Standards.



Required Qualifications & Experience:



Experience: Minimum of 2 years of direct experience working as an Estimator for an Australian construction or renovation company.



Industry Knowledge: Deep understanding of Australian building methods, materials (e.g., timber framing, brick veneer), and the "Residential Cost Guide."



Software Skills: Proficiency in Bluebeam, Excel, and at least one major construction estimating platform.



Communication: Exceptional English communication skills (written and verbal), as you will be communicating with the AU team and local suppliers.



Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy in measurement and data entry is non-negotiable.

title: Virtual Receptionist / Legal Assistant Fluent English Required
description:
Work Hours:   8:30 a.m. – 5:30 p.m. Eastern Standard Time, with a one-hour lunch break

Reports To: Attorney and Paralegals



Position Overview



Provide remote administrative, clerical, and client-facing support to attorneys and legal staff. This role serves as a primary point of contact for incoming communications while assisting with scheduling, correspondence, and general office support functions. The position requires strong organizational skills, professionalism, discretion with confidential information, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced legal environment. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision.  Must be fluent in English with little to no accent and exceptional phone skills.



Key Responsibilities



Client and Communication Support



* Answer and route incoming phone calls using the firm’s **Nextiva phone system** in a professional and courteous manner.  This system is accessible via a mobile app or the internet

* Communicate with clients via phone,
, and messaging platforms

* Send, receive, and track client intake forms and related documentation

* Draft, review, and respond to routine
s and correspondence as directed

* Serve as an initial point of contact for general client inquiries



Scheduling and Calendar Management in Outlook



* Schedule and confirm appointments, consultations, hearings, and meetings

* Maintain attorney and staff calendars, including coordination across multiple schedules

* Send reminders and confirmations to clients, courts, and other parties

* Assist with coordination for virtual meetings and court appearances



Legal and Administrative Support



* Communicate with judicial assistants, court staff, opposing counsel offices, and other legal professionals as directed

* Prepare and organize basic documents, forms, and correspondence templates

* Assist with electronic filing preparation, document management, and digital record keeping

* Maintain contact lists, case tracking logs, and internal databases



General Office and Project Support



* Perform virtual receptionist duties including message taking and call screening

* Assist attorneys and support staff with special projects, research tasks, or administrative assignments as needed

* Provide overflow support for clerical or operational tasks

* Maintain confidentiality and adhere to firm policies and professional standards



Required Skills and Qualifications



* **Fluent in English (written and verbal)**

* Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage workload without constant supervision

* Highly organized with strong attention to detail

* Professional phone demeanor and client-service orientation

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

* Proficiency in **all Microsoft Office products**, including Word, Outlook, Excel, and Teams

* Ability to learn legal software and case management systems quickly

* Reliable high-speed internet connection and a dedicated remote workspace

* High level of discretion with confidential and sensitive information



Preferred Qualifications



* Prior experience in a legal, administrative, or customer service role

* Experience working in a law firm or legal services environment

* Familiarity with court procedures, scheduling protocols, or legal terminology

* Experience with virtual meeting platforms and cloud-based document systems



Additional Expectations



This role is intended to be flexible and may include additional administrative, clerical, or project-based duties as reasonably assigned by attorneys or support staff. Responsibilities may evolve based on firm needs, caseload, and operational requirements.



**Work Environment:** Fully remote / virtual position requiring consistent availability during designated Eastern Standard Time business hours.

title: Reels Creator
description:
Position: Reels Editor (Medium–Advanced CapCut Only)



I am hiring a high level Reels editor to support weekly content creation.



This is not a beginner role.



I require seven Reels per week, and I expect speed, creative input and quality. You will be responsible for sourcing strong concepts and hooks aligned with my brand direction, gaining approval, then editing using the footage I provide.



You must understand how to build content that holds attention and drives engagement. Cutting clips and adding captions is not enough.



### Style Reference – This Is The Level Required



The type of content you will be creating is aligned with the style below. Study these before applying:



[

Expect:

• Strong hooks in the first 2–3 seconds

• Strategic pacing shifts

• Confident on screen text

• Clean but dynamic edits

• Tension, energy and movement

• Structured storytelling



If your work does not resemble this style, this will not be a fit.



What This Role Requires



• Medium to advanced CapCut proficiency

• Strong understanding of hooks, pacing and retention psychology

• Clean, premium caption styling

• Seamless B roll integration

• Dynamic text animation

• Sound design that builds energy

• Confident use of transitions and subtle movement

• Ability to structure content for engagement

• Clear communication and fast turnaround



Some edits will require layered storytelling and emotional build. This is strategic editing, not basic clipping.







Weekly Expectations



• 7 Reels delivered per week

• Concept suggestions sent in advance for approval

• Edits delivered ready to post

• Revisions handled efficiently



Application Requirements



To apply, include:



1. Three to 7 Reels you have edited that genuinely match the style linked above. Do not send generic portfolio samples. Send relevant examples only.



2. A realistic breakdown of time required for:

   • Developing five concepts

   • Editing five Reels

   • Delivering final drafts



Be specific. Vague answers will not be considered.



3. Your monthly retainer rate for 7 Reels per week.



4. Comment the word **The Standard** in your application so I know you have read this fully.



Shortlisted Candidates



Shortlisted applicants will complete a small paid test task:

• One 30 to 45 second Reel edit using provided footage

• One aligned concept suggestion



This allows me to assess creative thinking, retention structure and technical execution.

title: Online Arbitrage Sourcer - Amazon
description:
We are currently looking for a Amazon Online Arbitrage Sourcer!



I am looking for a serious, dedicated individual to add to my team. We currently have 3 sourcers already that have been on the team from over a year! 



Please read below to understand our requirements and what you will be going through before getting the job so there is no confusion.



Full time position, Monday-Friday 7 hours a day 35 hours per week.



- You must have prior experience with sourcing for Amazon, using Selleramp and Keepa. We do not use any other software.

- You must have experience on sourcing, make sure you're NOT sourcing 3rd party places.

- You will be sourcing all types of leads from beauty to health and household to shoes and clothes

- You must source 6-10 in-stock leads daily. If you aren't able to consistently source atleast 6-8 leads per day (7 hour work day) please do not apply!

- We must be able to spend AT LEAST $5000 on the leads you sourced each month. (We care MORE about the amount we can spend on the leads rather than the amount of leads you sourced.)

- You must have 
 as this is the main source of communication

- If you reply to this job post with a copy paste you will be instantly denied.

- You must not work for other sellers while working for us.

- Must have good communication, speak up about any issues, ideas, and improvements to help us grow..



Sourcing Criteria:

25-100 Sales per month minimum

$4 profit per unit minimum

Category should be within: Health & Household, Beauty & Personal Care, Shoes, (Other categories may be accepted if the lead is good)

Making sure you are sourcing from legit places, and also verifying each lead you send is the exact same product as on Amazon, there shouldn't be careless mistakes of sourcing the wrong dimensions, flavors or sizes etc.

title: Senior Residential Appraisal Report Writer/Manager
description:
I run a residential appraisal firm located in the Bay Area, California, and am looking for an experienced residential appraisal writer to join the team. The team includes 3 Bay Area appraisers and 6 employees in the Philippines. We are rapidly growing and are looking for an experienced and senior level residential report writer/manager to join our team.



Your role will be to do the following:

1. Complete the entire residential appraisal report after the appraiser has provided you with the inspection information and comparables. This includes all the commentary, adjustments, and all other parts of the report. We will provide training on how we specifically expect the commentary and adjustments based on our own personal preferences, however you are expected to already have this type of experience working for other appraisers.

2. Review the work of other report writers on our team, provide feedback, and help train newer report writers on our team. You are expected to act as the "last line of defense" of the report before it is sent to the appraiser for their final review before submission. As such, we expect you to be able to review the report, find any issues, correct these issues, and then send to the appraiser a near perfect report.



To be considered for this role, you must meet the following criteria:

1. You have worked for a US residential appraiser

2. You have experience performing data entry for residential properties in the US

3. You have experience creating the 1004MC, selecting comparables, drawing the sketch, labeling photos, making adjustments to the sales grid, and making commentary for the addendum.

4. Ideally, you have experience managing other appraisal report writers.



We are flexible with your work hours and offer Philippine daytime shift hours for your convenience. We would like to start part time but then transition to full time, so ideally you are open to working full time exclusively with us if its a mutual fit.



To be considered for this position, you must do the following in your application message (failure to do all of the following will result in your application being ignored):

1. How many years have you worked for a US residential appraiser? What tasks did you perform for them?

2. How many hours does it take you to complete one report? What parts of the report do you complete?

3. Do you have experience writing commentary for the addendum, drawing the sketch, labeling photos, and creating the 1004MC? Please indicate which ones you have experience with, and how many years for each.

4. Please provide a sample of at least one appraisal report you have fully completed. You can redact any private information from the report. Please let me know what parts exactly you completed on this report(s).

5. Provide a publicly accessible link to your resume.

title: AI ADS - VEO3 SPECIALIST
description:
We’re Hiring: Google Veo 3 Specialist



Our fast-growing e-commerce brand is scaling toward 8-figures and beyond, and we’re ready to level up our creative production with the power of Google Veo 3. We’re looking for a Google Veo 3 Specialist to help us manage, refine, and execute AI-generated video ads that support our marketing goals.



To show you’ve carefully read this post, please start your response with the word peach before introducing yourself. Below, you’ll find the key responsibilities, requirements, and a few quick questions so we can get to know your experience.



Key Responsibilities:

- Prompt Creation & Optimization: Write, test, and refine prompts to generate high-quality video ads using Google Veo 3.

- Workflow Coordination: Manage the full AI production pipeline—concept to final output—ensuring deadlines are met.

- Creative Alignment: Collaborate with our marketing and UGC teams to blend AI-generated content with human-made assets.

- Quality Review: Ensure all outputs are polished, on-brand, and ready for launch.

- Innovation & Mastery: Stay up to date with Google Veo 3 features, updates, and best practices to keep us ahead of the curve.

- Documentation: Maintain a clear system for tracking prompts, revisions, and final deliverables.



Requirements:

- Hands-on experience with Google Veo 3 and AI video generation.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to manage multiple creative projects at once.

- Good communication skills for working with both AI and human creators.

- Comfortable using project management tools like Google Sheets, Notion, or similar.

- Consistent availability for 4-8 hours daily, 6 days per week.

- Bonus: Background in marketing, video production, or AI prompt engineering.



Questions for You:

- Have you worked directly with Google Veo 3 before? If so, tell us about your projects.

- How do you approach prompt testing and refining to get the best results?

- What’s your system for keeping multiple AI video projects organized?

- Are you comfortable balancing both creative expectations and technical workflows?

- Can you commit to 4-8 hours per day, 6 days per week, for this role?



If you’re passionate about AI-powered creativity and love working with cutting-edge tools like Google Veo 3, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Airbnb Claims Manager
description:
Role Overview

We are hiring an experienced Airbnb Claims Manager to handle all post checkout claims across our portfolio. You must have previous experience working in Airbnb Support and understand how to navigate claims, documentation requirements and review removal processes from the inside. Your role will focus on filing accurate claims, progressing them with support, and actioning review removals where eligible. The hours will be Monday - Saturday, 11am - 6pm.



Key Responsibilities

1. File all Airbnb Resolution Centre claims for damages, missing items, excess cleaning and breaches

2. Work directly with Airbnb Support using your platform experience to move claims to resolution

3. Prepare and upload evidence including photos, invoices, reports and message logs

4. Track all claims, maintain organised documentation and update internal records

5. Identify and action reviews eligible for removal based on Airbnb’s policy

6. Communicate professionally with guests when follow up is required

7. Flag any high risk cases or escalations to the management team

8. Coordinate with operations to quickly gather required evidence or details



Requirements

1. Must have previously worked for Airbnb Support handling claims or trust and safety matters

2. Strong written English with clear and confident communication

3. High attention to detail and an organised approach to evidence and documentation

4. Ability to work independently and follow structured processes

5. Reliable internet and ability to work Australian hours

title: Real Estate Market & Licensing Research Specialist
description:
Company Overview:

We are a service based company seeking a highly analytical and detail oriented Real Estate Market & Licensing Research Specialist to support our investment and development initiatives. This role is ideal for someone passionate about real estate, market analysis, and helping identify profitable opportunities for investment and growth





Position Overview:

This position focuses on conducting thorough research on real estate markets, property rehabilitation opportunities, and state-specific licensing requirements for certain programs. The ideal candidate is highly detail-oriented, great with numbers, experienced with the BRRRR Method (Buy, Rehab, Rent, Refinance, Repeat), understands basic construction pricing and workflow processes, evaluates auction properties, demonstrates out-of-the-box thinking, and is capable of performing in-depth research on programs such as Article 28 and Article 31, compiling step-by-step guides for licensing and approvals. The role requires strong follow-through to ensure all aspects of a project are completed from research to execution







Key Responsibilities:



Conduct detailed real estate market research to identify the best-performing and emerging markets for investment



Provide comprehensive market analysis reports, including metrics such as average home prices, rental rates, property values, and local market trends



Research rehab (renovation) opportunities in targeted markets and estimate potential costs, returns, and project feasibility



Understand basic construction pricing, set up, and workflow processes to better evaluate rehab projects



Evaluate auction properties, identifying promising deals and assessing potential risks and returns



Prepare clear and organized Excel reports summarizing findings, including property data, rehab budgets, auction analysis, and deal breakdowns for management review



Perform state-by-state research on rules and procedures for obtaining licenses or approvals required to run certain programs (e.g., Article 28, Article 31, etc.)



Compile step-by-step guides detailing how to file and obtain necessary licenses or program approvals in each state



Present research findings and recommendations in a clear and concise format, using innovative approaches to problem-solving



 Follow through on all aspects of projects from initial research to final execution, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and actionable outcomes  

On-site engagement  from A-Z







Requirements;



Experience in real estate research, data analysis, or investment support



Strong understanding of market evaluation, property trends, and basic rehab cost analysis



Knowledge of basic construction pricing and workflow processes



Experience evaluating real estate auctions and identifying profitable opportunities



Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (formulas, data organization, and presentation)



Proven ability to conduct independent, detailed research and summarize findings effectively



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Strategic, detail-oriented, and solution-focused mindset



Demonstrated out-of-the-box thinking to find creative solutions and uncover unique opportunities



Great with numbers and experienced with the BRRRR Method



Fluent in American English (spoken and written)









Position Details:



Type: Full-time



Schedule: Monday to Friday



Hours: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM (1-hour lunch break)



Compensation: $500 USD per month (paid monthly)

title: Travel & Content Creation Team – Join Me on the Road!
description:
Kamusta po! I am Jon, an American travel vlogger with a total following of over 900,000 across YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, and
. I’m currently building a small in-house team located near Pasig to join me on my travels and help with recording, editing, and many other parts of the content creation process. My goal is to build something that feels less like a traditional job and more like a close-knit team that grows and travels together.



We’ll start by focusing on localized short form content around 20-70 seconds long with minimal editing (mainly jump cuts and occasional blur effects). These videos usually take about an hour from start to finish, so we’ll aim for around 3-6 unique videos a day to repost across 8 different social media channels. Afterwards, we’ll begin to branch into long form content as we prepare for the first set of longer travels.



You do not need to have a lot of experience in content creation, and it’s totally okay if you’re shy around cameras. I was the same way when I first started making videos too. I’ll be working closely with you and teaching you everything step by step — all I ask is that you’re open-minded, willing to learn, and excited to grow with the team long-term.





There will be a 3-part interview process:

1. Online Conversation – We’ll start by chatting here or on Google Chat to clear up any misunderstandings and to begin learning more about each other.



2. Video Call – Just a casual call to see if we get along. (Background noise like chickens, jeepneys, or karaoke is totally fine — I’ve been living in the Philippines for over a year now, so I’m used to it)



3. In-Person Meet-Up & Casual Recording – We’ll meet up and do a short, relaxed recording together to see how our personalities work in real time. (Nothing scripted — just natural conversation)



If all 3 parts go well and both of us want to proceed, we will then spend around 2 weeks working closely together for training, building a workflow, and preparing for upcoming trips. During our travels, I will cover the costs for food, housing, transportation, and general travel expenses. In addition, each tea
mber will receive a direct percentage of my top-performing channel’s revenues. This is paid work, and all details will be discussed transparently during the interview process.







In conclusion, I’m looking for people who want to:

- Join me on my travels

- Help with all parts of the content creation process

- Grow together as a team



What’s included:

- Paid role (revenue share from my top-performing channels)

- Food, housing, and travel expenses covered during trips

- Connections with brands and sponsors

- Hands-on training and real-world experience

- Opportunity to grow long-term with the team



Interview process:

- Short online chat

- Casual video call to see if we get along

- In-person meet-up with a short, relaxed recording (nothing scripted — just natural conversation)



Requirements:

- Open to learning new skills

-  Positive, team-first attitude



Preferred (not required):

- Video editing experience

- Social media experience

- Located near Pasig



If this sounds like something you’d be interested in, send me a message and answer this question:

- If we were traveling together and just finished filming all day, what would you do to relax?



Thank you for taking the time to read this — I’m really looking forward to building something incredible together as we travel, create, and entertain the world!



- Jon

title: Medical Virtual Assistant - URGENT
description:
Role Overview

As one of the newest physicians in a private entity, client is looking for a proactive Virtual Medical Assistant to help build her practice from the ground up. This role is essential for streamlining clinic operations, providing exceptional patient support, and ensuring efficient practice management.



About the Clinic and Physician

Practice: Internal Medicine Physician.

Environment: A growing practice that values high-quality patient care, professionalism, and efficient administrative workflows.

Core Values: Proactivity, kindness, flexibility, and a commitment to long-term excellence.



Responsibilities and Tasks

The Virtual Medical Assistant will be responsible for a wide range of Virtual Medical Assistant tasks, including:

Patient Communication & Scheduling: 

Managing inbound and outbound calls.

Scheduling appointments for both new and existing patients.

Relaying messages to patients and providers.

Handling voi
 and ensuring prompt follow-ups.

Insurance & Authorizations:

Conducting insurance eligibility checks.

Managing referral authorizations and tracking their status.

Securing prior authorizations for medications and procedures.

Medical Records Management:

Requesting and organizing medical records.

Submitting and tracking faxes.

Ensuring accurate chart documentation and preparation.

Financial & Administrative Tasks:

Potentially handling balance collections (e.g., co-payments).

Maintaining HIPAA compliance in all data handling and communication.





Mandatory Requirements

Experience: Minimum of one year of experience as a Medical Assistant.

Compliance: Comprehensive knowledge and application of HIPAA regulations.

Soft Skills:

Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.

Exceptional communication skills (professional, kind, and helpful).

High level of flexibility and willingness to learn new tasks.

Proactive mindset with the ability to work independently.

Commitment: Looking for a long-term partnership (full-time, 40 hours per week).



Nice to Haves

Clinical Background: Previous experience supporting an Internal Medicine or Primary Care physician.

Administrative Versatility: Experience in multispecialty clinic workflows.



Tools Mentioned

Clinical Platforms: Kurogram and Passport (online communication platforms).

Practice Management: Elation (EMR/EHR platform).

Productivity & Security: Time Doctor

title: Real Estate Lead Generator
description:
Looking for a Real Estate Acquisitions Assistant to build our outbound deal flow and hunt for motivated sellers.



What You’ll Be Doing:

-Lead Qualification: Use our proven scripts to ask the right questions, uncover motivation, and gauge property condition.

-Relentless Follow-Up: Manage a long-term pipeline (30–180 days). You understand that the fortune is in the follow-up!

-Wholesale Networking: Reach out to wholesalers weekly to gather off-market opportunities.



Requirements

-Experience: Prior experience in Real Estate cold calling or appointment setting is highly preferred.

-Tech Savvy: Comfortable using power dialers (e.g., Mojo, BatchDialer), Google Sheets, and CRMs.

-English Fluency: Must have a clear, confident speaking voice

-Schedule: Must be available to work U.S. Business Hours (St. Louis/Central Time)

title: Real Estate Operations Admin
description:
Looking for a Real Estate Operations Admin to manage the entire process from "Contract to Closing." Your mission is to ensure deals close cleanly and on time, allowing leadership to focus entirely on acquisitions and growth.



Core Responsibilities

-Transaction Management: Prepare/send purchase contracts and track all key milestones and deadlines proactively.

-Third-Party Liaison: Act as the primary point of contact for title companies, lenders, and sellers to ensure a smooth flow of information.

-Administrative Operations: Coordinate insurance binders, utility transfers, and lender draw requests.

-Document Control: Organize rehab paperwork, receipts, and maintain "investor-ready" deal files in Google Drive.

-Process Accountability: Use and improve internal checklists to ensure zero missed steps or documentation gaps.



Requirements:

-Proven Experience: Background in U.S. Real Estate transactions, title coordination, or admin support for investors/brokers.

-Tech Proficiency: Expert level in Google Workspace (Sheets/Drive). Experience with CRM tools is a plus.

-Communication: Exceptional written English for professional correspondence with U.S. vendors.

title: Meta ads Image editor
description:
We’re Hiring: Talented Image Editor to Join Our Growing Branded Dropshipping Business!



Our business is scaling rapidly, and we have ambitious goals to reach 8-figure success this year. To help us achieve this, we’re looking for a skilled and creative Image Editor to join our team and produce high-quality, visually stunning content that captivates our audience.



To show you’ve carefully read this post, please start your response with the word blueberry before introducing yourself. Below, you’ll find the key responsibilities, qualifications for the role, and a few questions to help us understand your expertise.



Key Responsibilities:

- Edit and enhance high-quality images for advertisements, product listings, and social media campaigns.

- Create engaging and visually compelling content optimized for platforms like Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and
.

- Use tools like Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom, and Canva to deliver polished and professional images.

- Collaborate with the team to ensure all visuals align with our branding and marketing objectives.

- Implement feedback effectively and maintain open communication through tools like Slack.

- Consistently meet deadlines and deliver exceptional work that drives results.



Requirements:

- A strong background in image editing, graphic design, and visual storytelling.

- Proficiency in software such as Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom, and Canva.

- A keen eye for composition, color grading, typography, and branding consistency.

- Excellent communication and teamwork skills for seamless collaboration.

- Familiarity with communication tools like Slack.

- Ability to commit 2-4 hours daily, minimum 6 days a week, on a consistent basis.



Questions for You:

- What is your experience with image editing and content creation? Please include examples or a link to your portfolio if available.

- Which editing/design software do you use, and how proficient are you with each one?

- How do you ensure that your images align with branding guidelines and marketing goals?

- Have you worked with team communication tools like Slack before?

- Are you available to commit 2–4 hours per day, 6 days per week, to this role?



If you meet the requirements and are passionate about contributing to a fast-growing company, we’d love to hear from you! Let’s collaborate to create visually impactful images and achieve incredible results together!
